unlawful violation a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor penalties for each offense payment into city treasury of fines and penalties 1 11 11 11 11 14 14 14 14 14 14 14 chapter 1 general provisions application the provisions of this to all provisions in the city city to all persons and property within the city of red wing minnesota and within adjacent areas as stated in specific provisions citation this codification of the ordinances of the city of red wing shall be known as the city cited thus city code  titles a title or caption in any provision of the city for convenience only and shall not limit expand or otherwise alter or control the content wording or interpretation thereof rules of construction subd 1 unless otherwise provided herein or by law or implication required the same rules of construction definition and application govern the interpretation of this those governing the interpretation of state law subd 2 gender as well words importing one gender include and apply to the other subd 3 words in the singular include the plural and words in the plural include the singular definitions words and phrases shall have their plain ordinary and usual meaning technical words and phrases however having a peculiar and appropriate meaning in law shall be understood according to their technical import for the purpose of this the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning 1 city  the city of red wing minnesota acting by or duly authorized representative 2 council and city council  the city council of the city of red wing minnesota 3 council administrator  the person duly appointed by the city council and acting in such capacity or acting designee 4 finance director city clerk city attorney director of engineering police chief and fire chief  the persons duly appointed as officers by the city council and acting in such capacity 5 person includes all firms partnerships associations corporations and natural persons 6 written and in writing  any mode of representing words and letters in the english language whether by printing or otherwise 7 street  the entire area dedicated to public use or contained in an easement or other conveyance or grant to the city and includes but is not limited to roadways boulevards sidewalks alleys and other public property between lateral property lines in which a roadway lies 8 public property and public place  any place property or premises dedicated to public use such public property or public place may be owned by the city occupied by the city as a lessee dedicated to the city in a plat or occupied by the city by reason of an easement including but not limited to streets storm water drainage and utilities parks trails or parking lots so owned or occupied 9 private property  all property not included within the definition of public property or public place 10 intersection  the area embraced within the prolongation or connection of the lateral curb line or if no curb then the lateral boundary lines of the roadways or streets which join one another at or approximately at right angles or the area within which vehicles traveling upon different streets joining at any other angle may come in conflict 11 roadway  that portion of a street improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel if a street includes two or more separate roadways the term roadway as used herein shall refer to any such roadway separately but not to all such roadways collectively 12 police officer and peace officer  every officer including special police authorized to direct or regulate traffic and keep the peace and appointed or employed for the purpose of law enforcement 13 misdemeanor  the crime for which a sentence of not more than 90 days or a fine of not more than $700 or both may be imposed 14 petty misdemeanor  an offense which does not constitute a crime and for which a sentence of a fine of not more than $100 may be imposed 15 conviction  either of the following accepted and recorded by a court a a plea of guilty or  b a verdict of guilty by a jury or a finding of guilty by a court 16 crime  conduct prohibited by ordinance for which the actor may be sentenced to imprisonment andor fined 17   an ordinance duly adopted by the city council of red wing minnesota 18 ex officio member  a person who is not counted for the purpose of determining a quorum and has no right to vote but shall have the right and obligation at the persons discretion to speak to any question coming before the board commission or other deliberative body of which the person is such member 19 advisory member  a a person that is appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council who acts in an advisory capacity and provides input to a board an advisory member does not have the right to vote make motions or be counted for purposes of a quorum an advisory member need not be a resident of the city 20 may  is permissive 21 shall  is mandatory 22 violate  includes failure to comply 23 premises  any lot or parcel of land within a continuous boundary whether publicly or privately owned occupied or possessed 24 board and commission  the official advisory bodies established by the city charter or by the city council per the city joint powers board  legal partnerships between other governmental agencies that improve operational efficiencies efforts severability if any subsection sentence clause phrase word or other portion of this now or later amended or its application to any person or circumstance is held invalid in whole or in part by any court of competent jurisdiction such portion shall be deemed severable and such invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this can be given effect without the invalid provision or application reference to a public official wherever an appointed public official is referenced in the city the reference shall include such public official or the officials designee otherwise unlawful the city not authorize an act or omission otherwise prohibited by law violation a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor a person who violates a section subdivision paragraph or provision of this city or amendment thereof by performing an act thereby prohibited or declared unlawful or by failing to act when such failure is thereby prohibited or declared unlawful shall be punished for a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor upon conviction thereof except as otherwise stated in specific provisions or amendments thereto upon conviction for a crime the actor may be convicted of either the crime charged if it is a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor as an included offense necessarily proved if the misdemeanor charge were proved penalities for each offense when a penalty or forfeiture is provided for the violation of a provision of this city such penalty or forfeiture shall be construed to be for each such violation payment into city treasury of fines and penalties all fines forfeitures and penalties recovered for the violation of any ordinance charter rule or regulation of the city shall be paid into the city treasury by the court or officer thereof receiving such monies payment shall be made in the manner at the time and in the proportion provided by law code enforcement subd 1 police and peace officers police and peace officers appointed by the city may enforce the provisions of this connection with such authority police and peace officers may make arrests and issue citations in lieu of arrest in the manner provided by law subd 2 employees and agents the following city employees and agents and their designees may issue notices of violations and citations in lieu of arrest for alleged violations of the employees and agents shall not arrest or otherwise take persons into custody the city council shall identify and approve designees by name annually a community service officers b parking enforcement attendants c fire chief d engineering director e public works director f community development director title page chapter2 administration administration and departmental organization 21 202 elective officers 22 203 signatories on deeds 22 204 accounts claims or demands 22 205 facsimile signatures 23 206 workers compensation 23 207 emergency management 24 208 boards payment of assessments 233 224 expense reimbursement and escrow system 234 225 violation a misdemeanor 234 page revised 09172014 chapter2 administration organization administration and departmental subd 1 this administrative code defines the authority and responsibility of the council administrator and other officers and employees provides for the coordination and control of activities and creates lines of communication within the administrative services of the city subd 2 following duties the council administrator or designee shall perform the a control and supervise all employees and affairs of the city government and to that end may investigate examine or inquire into the affairs or operation of any department division or office of the city except as may be otherwise provided b issue administrative manuals orders rules directives and regulations consistent with the charter the city state law such rules manuals orders directives and regulations shall outline the procedures for city administration c recommend to the council such policies and procedures determined to be in the best interest of the city d temporarily reassign personnel from one department to another as needed e make necessary purchases of material and supplies in accordance with the citys established purchasing policies and state law provided that all purchases and expenditures are within budgetary limits f provide administrative assistance to the mayor to perform or carry out mayoral duties g perform all other duties prescribed by law required by the city charter city or assigned by the council subd 3 to provide for the economic and efficient service delivery the city will be organized by departments and divisions the organizational structure and functions of each department and division will be represented in an organizational chart that will be adopted by city council subd 4 the city charter identifies officers appointed by the city council each officer shall perform all duties required by state law the city charter the city the job description for the position as approved by the city council these officers will serve as a department or division head all departmentdivision heads including officers appointed by the city council shall report directly to the council administrator subd 5 the city will be guided by city council adopted organizational policies including but not limited to the personnel policy data practices policy purchasing policy and records retention schedule departments and divisions may have additional internal policies or procedures approved by the city council administrator or department heads elective officers subd 1 the elected officers shall be as provided by charter subd 2 elective officer salary in accordance with minnesota statutes subd 2 no change in salary shall take effect until after the next succeeding municipal election effective  elective officer salaries will be $30770 biweekly $800020 annually subd 2a council members shall receive a per diem of $75 per meeting for services performed for the board of equalization signatories on deeds subd 1 purpose the purpose of this to clarify required signatures on deeds of conveyance on behalf of the city while the charter addresses required signators for city contracts it is silent with respect to those signatories required for deeds subd 2 signatories that every deed of conveyance in which the city is a grantor shall be signed by the mayor and the city clerk with the seal of the city affixed thereto accounts claims or demands subd 1 generally except as to an annual salary fees of jurors or witnesses fixed by law or wages or salaries of employees which have been fixed on an hourly daily weekly or monthly basis by the council and which by law are authorized to be paid on a payroll basis any account claim or demand against the city which can be itemized in the ordinary course of business the council shall not audit or allow the claim until the person claiming payment or his agent reduces it to writing in items and signs a declaration to the effect that such account claim or demand is just and correct and that no part of it has been paid in accordance with minnesota statutes subd 2 discretionary exception the council may in its discretion allow a claim prepared by the city finance director prior to such declaration by the claimant if the declaration is made on the check or ordercheck by which the claim is paid as provided in minnesota statutes subd 2 subd 3 form of declaration for claim the declaration provided for in subdivision 1 hereof is sufficient in the following form as provided in minnesota statutes subd 1 i declare under the penalties of law that this account claim or demand is just and correct and that no part of it has been paid signature of claimant subd 4 form and effect of declaration on check the declaration provided for in subdivision 2 hereof shall be printed on the reverse side of the check above the space for endorsement thereof by the payee as follows the undersigned payee in endorsing this check or ordercheck declares that the same is received in payment of a just and correct claim against the city and that no part of it has heretofore been paid when endorsed by the payee named in the check or ordercheck such statement shall operate and shall be deemed sufficient as the required declaration of the claim in accordance with minnesota statutes subd 2 subd 5 signing checks all checks shall be signed by the mayor and city finance director subd 6 as an alternative to payment of claims and obligations by check the city finance director may make payment by electronic or wire funds transfer provided the declaration set forth in subdivision 1 above has been made facsimile signatures the mayor and city finance director are hereby authorized to request a depository of city funds to honor an order for payment when such instrument bears a facsimile of either signature and to charge the same to the account designated thereon or upon which it is drawn as effectively as though it were a manually written signature such authority is granted only for the purpose of permitting such officers an economy of time and effort workers compensation no person shall receive coverage for workers compensation except as provided in minnesota statutes elected officials and appointed board and commission members shall be excluded from coverage emergency management subd 1 purpose a this section shall be in accord with the minnesota emergency management act of 199 minnesota statutes is established to enable the city to perform local emergency management functions b because of the possibility of the occurrence of natural and other disasters and in order to ensure that preparations of the city will be adequate to deal with such disasters and generally to protect the public peace health and safety and preserve the lives and property of the people of the city it is hereby found and declared to be necessary 1 to establish a local emergency management plan  2 to provide for the exercise of necessary powers during emergencies  and 3 to provide for the rendering of mutual aid between the city and other political subdivisions of this state and with other states to carry out emergency management functions  and 4 to institute training and public information programs to ensure emergency preparedness c it is further declared to be the purpose of this the policy of the city that all emergency management functions be coordinated to the maximum extent practicable with the comparable functions of the federal government of this state of other states and localities and of private agencies of every type to the end that the most effective preparations and use may be made of the labor supply resources and facilities for dealing with any disaster that may occur subd 2 definitions for the purpose of this  emergency management  the preparation for and the coordination of emergency functions other than functions for which military forces are primarily responsible to prevent minimize and repair injury and damage resulting from natural disasters as well as those caused by enemy attack these functions include without limitation firefighting services police services medical and health services rescue engineering warning services communications radiological chemical and other special weapons defense evacuation of persons from stricken areas emergency human services emergency transportation existing or properly assigned functions of plant protection temporary restoration of public utility services implementation of energy supply emergency conservation and allocation measures and other functions related to civilian protection together with all other activities necessary or incidental to preparation for and coordination of these functions 2 declared emergency  a national security or peacetime emergency declared by the governor pursuant to minnesota statutes or an emergency proclaimed by the mayor as authorized under this subdivision and in addition includes disasters caused by fire flood tornadoes wind storms or other natural causes subd 3 emergency management fiscal procedure there is hereby established in the city treasury a special account to be known as the emergency management fund this account shall contain the proceeds of taxes levied for emergency management money transferred from other funds gifts and other revenues of the emergency management division these funds shall not be used for regular and ongoing costs of the emergency management division but only shall be used in case of an emergency boards and commissions generally subd 1 charter authorization as provided by charter all boards and commissions shall be established by ordinance which shall set forth their powers and duties including the handling of funds except as otherwise specifically provided all boards and commissions shall be advisory to the council and neither shall they handle their own funds or accounting nor have the authority to contract for the sale or purchase of goods or services or financially obligate the city in any way except as authorized in the city charter except as otherwise provided in this all of the provisions of this apply to every board and commission subd 2 city council authority the city council has the authority to establish policies for boards and commissions no board or commission or any member thereof may lobby solicit or attempt to influence any governmental entity on behalf of said board or commission or the city of red wing for any purpose without the prior approval of the city council subd 3 membership all boards and commissions shall be composed of three to fifteen members members may be removed by twothirds vote of the council  and terms of appointees to each board or commission shall be staggered to provide continuity no appointed board or commission member shall be an employee of the city except those who are members by virtue of their office except as may be otherwise specifically provided by city the city charter the port authority enabling resolution or other law no member of the council shall serve on a board or commission in addition to the regular members the mayor may appoint an honorary member to each board or commission on an annual basis to be known as the commissioner emeritus such commissioner emeritus shall meet the same criteria for a regular member set forth above but shall not have a vote subd 4 residency except as otherwise provided in this all appointees shall have been residents of the city for at least six months if questions arise concerning the continued residency of a board or commission member the council shall appoint a subcommittee of the council to gather facts pertinent to the residency question the subcommittee shall make a recommendation to the council as to its findings in assessing residency the council shall consider whether the individual at issue votes or is eligible to vote in the city whether the individual lives within the city limits and the address listed on the individuals drivers license as predominant factors of residency though the council is free to consider other evidence it determines is relevant to the residency question subd 5 vacancy any board or commission member removed by the council or whose seat is declared vacant by a lack of residency shall have their position filled as any other vacancy all vacancies shall be filled in the same manner as an initial appointment but only for the unexpired portion of the term subd 6 procedures the chairman of each board or commission shall be chosen from voting membership and may serve two consecutive one year terms each board and commission shall establish its rules of procedure and establish its regular meeting time all of which shall be approved by the council subd 7 compensation the port authority board of commissioners shall be paid a per diem in accordance with minnesota statutes subd 5 all other appointed board and commission members shall serve without remuneration but may be reimbursed for outofpocket expenses incurred in the performance of their duties when such expenses have been authorized by the staff liaison before they were incurred subd 8 joint powers agreements the council may as the needs and interests of the city dictate enter into joint powers agreements subd 9 mutual aid agreements the council may as the needs and interests of the city dictate enter into mutual aid agreements with other public entities advisory planning commission subd 1 establishment and composition an advisory planning commission is hereby established the commission shall be composed of seven members subd 2 powers and duties a the advisory planning commission shall have all the powers and duties defined or granted in minnesota statutes and the city to planning zoning and subdivision regulation airport board subd 1 policy it is the policy of the city to have an airport board pursuant to minnesota statutes  composition the board shall be composed of seven members  four of whom shall be residents of the city of red wing one of whom shall be a goodhue county minnesota resident and taxpayer of the city of red wing or hangar lessee and two who shall be residents of pierce county wisconsin preference shall be given to residents of the townships of isabelle and trenton subd 3 purpose to recommend policy and guidelines for the operation and maintenance of the airport to encourage economic recreational and community development and to enhance strong local and regional involvement in these actions subd 4 powers and duties the board shall advise the council in all matters dealing with the airport and its operation the board shall recommend an annual operating budget report on the adequacy of facilities recommend capital improvements and serve as a forum for citizen input on subjects relating to the airport and its operation harbor commission subd 1 commission policy it is the policy of the city to have a harbor subd 2 composition the commission shall be composed of seven members members shall be residents of the city in accordance with subdivision 4 of this except that one member may be a nonresident who either owns real property in the city or has a slip at a city marina the nonresident member shall be subject to nomination by the mayor and confirmation by the city council and the port authority in the event that the mayor does not appoint a nonresident the mayor can appoint a city resident as the seventh member of the commission and that member will be subject to confirmation by the city council and the port authority with regard to the members who are residents three shall be appointed by the port authority president and confirmed by the port authority board and three shall be appointed by the mayor and confirmed by the city council all members shall have the right to vote a representative of the port authority shall serve as a nonvoting liaison between the port authority and the harbor commission a representative of the red wing city council shall serve as a nonvoting liaison between the city council and harbor commission subd 3 purpose the purpose of the harbor commission is to 1 recommend policy guidelines for commercial and recreational activities related to the citys riverfront and navigable waters 2 advise the planning commission port authority andor city council on new development or redevelopment along the riverfront or navigable waterways  3 suggest policies as it relates to navigable waters within the city 4 recommend operational policy for the marinas that are utilizing city property and 5 assist with marketing and communications related to the commissions activities subd 4 powers and duties the harbor commission shall have the following powers and duties a make recommendations related to all riverfront development or redevelopment projects b assist with review analysis and updating of recreational leases c assist with developing policies that affect recreational issues including but not limited to marina pricing marketing recommendations gas sales waiting lists etc d develop and assist with the implementation of marketing recommendations for recreational aspects of the river and for ole miss marina activities e communicate with residents and boaters the rationale for various harbor related policies human rights commission subd 1 commission policy it is the policy of the city to have a human rights subd 2 composition the commission shall be composed of up to nine members members shall be residents of the city in accordance with subdivision 4 of this or nonresidents of the city drawn from within the boundary limits of independent school district no 256 such nonresidents shall have resided within the boundary limits of the school district for at least six months the number of nonresident members must not constitute a quorum or more of the commission the commission is not required to contain a minimum number of nonresidents as members all members shall have the right to vote subd 3 purpose the purpose of the commission is to secure for all citizens equal opportunity in employment housing public accommodations public services education and full participation in the affairs of the city by supporting the minnesota department of human rights in implementing the minnesota human rights act and by advising the council on longrange programs to improve community relations in the city subd 4 responsibilities the human rights commission shall have the following responsibilities a create and collaborate with individuals agencies and organizations to provide the community with opportunities for educational and cultural events and activities b advise and inform the mayor the council and other departments of city government on human rights and civil rights issues c promote education and understanding within the red wing community regarding the minnesota human rights act d provide information and referral services to people in red wing who need assistance from the minnesota department of human rights sister cities commission subd 1 policy it is the policy of the city to have a sister cities commission subd 2 composition the sister cities commission shall consist of up to 15 members members shall be residents of the city in accordance with subdivision 4 of this or nonresidents of the city drawn from within the boundary limits of independent school district no 256such nonresidents shall have resided within the boundary limits of the school district for at least six months the number of nonresident members must not constitute a quorum or more of the commission the commission is not required to contain a minimum number of nonresidents as members all members shall have the right to vote source fourth series effective date 07162011 subd 3 purpose the purpose of this commission is to promote the interests of the city and the united states by encouraging and fostering the development of sister city relationships of a longterm nature between this city and cities of other countries the establishment of this commission will benefit everyone and enable the sister cities commission to a exchange ideas and personal visits with their counterparts  b develop a way for the many and diverse elements of every community to come together to enjoy and profit from a cooperative program  c open new dialogues with other cultures to find unique solutions to improving the quality of life  and d further global understanding and world peace subd 4 powers and duties powers and duties the commission shall have the following a coordinate the establishment of official sister city relationships between the city of red wing and cities of other countries cities international b establish official contacts with our sister cities collect and disseminate information on these cities and host official visits of sister city delegations c promote cultural economic and educational understanding between the city of red wing and its sister cities and citizen exchanges d provide contacts and liaisons for the business community public schools and other interested groups with our sister cities e address the mayor and city council on all aspects of the citys sister city relationships f promote internship programs leadership development programs newsletters workshops and trade and economic development sustainability commission subd 1 commission policy it is the policy of the city to have a sustainability subd 2 composition the commission shall be composed of a minimum of nine members and a maximum of fifteen members members must be residents of the city in accordance with subdivision 4 of this or nonresidents of the city drawn from within the boundary limits of independent school district no 256 such nonresidents shall have resided within the boundary limits of the school district for at least six months the number of nonresident members must not constitute a quorum or more of the commission the commission is not required to contain a minimum number of nonresidents as members all members shall have the right to vote subd 3 purpose the purpose of the sustainability commission is to provide advice to the city council concerning environmental issues and initiatives confronting the city the commission shall work with citizens government businesses and local community organizations to protect and preserve the ecological resources of the community so that they are in balance with the cultural historic recreational and economic resources of our river and land for generations to come subd 4 powers and duties a draft and recommend a sustainability action plan for city council consideration and approval b assist and advise the city council advisory planning commission and other city staff in assessing the environmental impact of proposed undertakings that fall in part or in total under the citys jurisdiction and recommend changes that would lesson or eliminate the environmentally detrimental effects of such undertakings c recommend to the city council additional environmental policy provisions and ordinances for enactment as well as actions and programs that will maintain or improve environmental quality and conservation of natural resources d request that the city council authorize studies on matters pertaining to environmental quality and natural resources and recommend when necessary the employment of professional qualified persons to carry out such studies e establish educational programs and public forums that provide information to community residents businesses and other institutions about environmental issues and initiatives f establish environmental programs volunteer opportunities and initiatives in which community residents can take part code of conduct subd 1 purpose the mayor and city council of the city of red wing determines that a code of conduct for its members as well as the members of the various advisory boards and commissions of the city of red wing is essential for the public affairs of the city by eliminating conflicts of interest and providing standards for conduct in city matters the city council hopes to promote the faith and confidence of the citizens of red wing in their government and to encourage its citizens to serve on its council and boards and commissions subd 2 standards of conduct no elected official or a city advisory board or commission member may knowingly a violate the open meeting law b participate in a matter that is before the city council or relevant board that affects the persons financial interests or those of a business with which the person is associated unless the effect on the person or business is no greater than on other members of the same business classification profession or occupation c use the persons public position to secure special privileges or exemptions for the person or for others d use the persons public position to solicit personal gifts or favors e use the persons public position for personal gain f except as specifically permitted pursuant to minnesota statute  accept or receive any gift of substance whether in the form of money services loan travel entertainment hospitality promise or any other form under circumstances in which it could be reasonably expected to influence the person the persons performance of official action or be intended as a reward for the persons official action g disclose to the public or use for the persons or another persons personal gain information that was gained by reason of the persons public position if the information was not public data or was discussed at a closed session of the city council or committee h disclose information that was received discussed or decided in conference with the citys legal counsel that is protected by the attorneyclient privilege unless a majority of the city council has authorized the disclosure except as prohibited by the provisions of minnesota statute there is no violation of item b of this section for a matter that comes before the council board or commission if the member of the council board or commission publicly discloses the circumstances that would violate these standards and refrains from participating in the discussion and vote on the matter nothing herein shall be construed to prohibit a contract with an elected or appointed official under the circumstances described under minnesota statute if proper statutory procedures are followed subd 3 complaint hearing any person may file a written complaint with the city clerk alleging a violation of the aforementioned standards of conduct the complaint must contain supporting facts for the allegation the city council may hold a hearing after receiving the written complaint or upon the councils own volition a hearing must be held only if the city council determines 1 upon advice of the city attorney designee or other attorney appointed by the council that the factual allegations state a sufficient claim of a violation of these standards or rise to the level of a legallyrecognized conflict of interest and 2 that the complaint has been lodged in good faith and not for impermissible purposes such as delay the city councils determination as to whether to hold a hearing must be made within 30 days of the filing of the allegation with the city clerk if possible the council may grant an extension to this 30day timeline if additional time is needed to adequately investigate the complaint if the council determines that there is an adequate justification for holding a hearing the hearing must be held within 30 days of the city councils determination the purpose of the hearing is to provide the person accused with the opportunity to be heard if after the hearing the council finds that a violation of a standard has occurred or does exist the council may at the same meeting or a future meeting censure the person refer the matter for criminal prosecution request an official not to participate in a decision remove an appointed member of a board or commission from office andor any other action within the councils authority that the council deems appropriate fair housing subd 1 purpose discrimination in housing and real property based upon race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability and status in regard to public assistance adversely affects the health welfare peace and safety of the community people subject to such discrimination suffer depressed living conditions poverty and hopelessness which injures the public welfare and places a burden upon the public treasury to improve these conditions it is the purpose of this foster equal opportunity for all to obtain housing without regard to race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability and status in regard to public assistance subd 2 definitions the following terms as used in this shall have the following meanings 1 commission  the red wing human rights commission 2 commissioner  refers to a member of the red wing human rights commission unless the context otherwise indicates 3 complainant  an individual who is aggrieved by an alleged unfair discriminatory practice and who has filed a grievance either with the minnesota department of human rights or with the commission 4 disability  any condition or characteristic that renders a person disabled a disabled person is any person who 1 has a physical sensory or mental impairment which materially limits one or more major life activities  2 has a record of such an impairment  or 3 is regarded as having such an impairment 5 familial status  the condition of one or more minors being domiciled with a their parent or parents or the minors legal guardian or b the designee of the parent or parents or guardian with the written permission of the parent or parents or guardian the protection afforded against discrimination on the basis of family status apply to any person who is pregnant or is in the process of securing legal custody of an individual who has not attained the age of majority 6 marital status  whether a person is single married remarried divorced separated or a surviving spouse 7 national origin  the place of birth of an individual or of an individuals lineal ancestors 8 person  an individual partnership association corporation municipal corporation school or school district county legal representative trustee trustee in bankruptcy and receiver 9 real estate broker and salesman  a real estate broker as defined by minnesota statutes subd 4 and a real estate salesperson as defined by minnesota statutes subd 5 10 real property  real estate lands tenements and hereditaments corporeal and incorporeal 11 respondent  a person against whom a complaint has been filed or issued for alleged unfair discriminatory practices 12 sex  includes but is not limited to pregnancy childbirth and disabilities related to pregnancy or childbirth 13 sexual orientation  having or being perceived as having an emotional physical or sexual attachment to another person without regard to the sex of that person or having or being perceived as having an orientation for such attachment or having or being perceived as having a selfimage or identity not traditionally associated with ones biological maleness or femaleness sexual orientation does not include a physical or sexual attachment to children by an adult 14 status with regard to public assistance  the condition of being a recipient of federal state or local assistance including medical assistance or of being a tenant receiving federal state or local subsidies including rental assistance or rent supplements 15 unfair discriminatory practice  any act described in subdivision 3 the word discriminate includes segregate or separate subd 3 practice unfair housing discrimination it is an unfair discriminatory a for an owner lessee sublessee assignee or managing agent of or other person having the right to sell rent or lease any real property or any agent of any of these 1 to refuse to sell rent or lease or otherwise deny to or withhold from any person or group of persons any real property because of their race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance  2 to discriminate against any person or group of persons because of their race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance in the terms conditions or privileges of the sale rental or lease of any real property or in the furnishing of facilities or services in connection therewith  or 3 in any transaction involving real property to print circulate or post or cause to be printed circulated or posted any advertisement or sign or use any form of application for the purchase rental or lease of real property or make any record or inquiry in connection with the prospective purchase rental or lease of real property which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination b for a real estate broker real estate salesman or employee or agent thereof 1 to refuse to sell rent or lease or refuse to offer for sale rental or lease any real property to any person or group of persons or refuse to negotiate for the sale rental or lease of any real property to any person or group of persons because of their race color creed religion national ong1n sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance or represent that real property is not available for inspection sale rental or lease when in fact it is so available or otherwise deny or withhold any real property or any facilities of real property to or from any person or group of persons because of their race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance  2 to discriminate against any person because of race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability and status in regard to public assistance in the terms conditions or privileges of the sale rental or lease of real property or in the furnishing of facilities or services in connection therewith  or 3 to print circulate or post or cause to be printed circulated or posted any advertisement or sign or use any form of application for the purchase rental or lease of any real property or make any record or inquiry in connection with the prospective purchase rental or lease of any real property which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability and status in regard to public assistance or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination c for a person bank banking organization mortgage company insurance company or other financial institution or leader to whom application is made for financial assistance or for the purchase lease acquisition construction rehabilitation repair or maintenance of any real property or any agent or employee thereof 1 to discriminate against any person or group of persons because of their race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance or of the prospective occupants or tenants of such real property in the granting withholding extending modifying or renewing or in the rates terms conditions or privileges of any such financial assistance or in the extension of services in connection therewith  2 to use any form of application for such financial assistance or make any record or inquiry in connection with applications for such financial assistance which expresses directly or indirectly any limitation specification or discrimination as to race color creed religion national ong1n sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance or any intent to make any such limitation specification or discrimination d for any real estate broker or real estate salesman for the purpose of inducing a real property transaction from which such person that persons firm or any of its members may benefit financially to represent that a change has occurred or will or may occur in the composition with respect to race color creed religion national origin sex sexual orientation marital status familial status disability or status in regard to public assistance of the owners or occupants in the block neighborhood or area in which the real property is located and to represent directly or indirectly that this change will or may result in undesirable consequences in the block neighborhood or area in which the real property is located including but not limited to the lowering of property values an increase in criminal or antisocial behavior or a decline in the quality of schools or other public facilities subd 4 unfair discrimination  aiding and obstructing it is unfair discriminatory practice for any person a intentionally to aid abet incite compel or coerce a person to engage in any of the practices forbidden by this   b intentionally to attempt to aid abet incite compel or coerce a person to engage in any of the practices forbidden by this   c to intentionally obstruct or prevent any person from complying with the provisions of this or any order relating to discrimination issued under state law or to resist prevent impede or interfere with the state commissioner of human rights or any of the commissioners employees or representatives in the performance of duty under state law relating to discrimination subd 5 reprisals it is an unfair discriminatory practice for any employer labor organization employment agency lessor public accommodation public service or educational institution or owner lessor lessee sublessee assignee or managing agent of any real property or any real estate broker real estate salesman or employee or agent thereof to intentionally engage in any reprisal against any person because that person a opposed a practice forbidden under this chapter or has filed a charge testified assisted or participated in any matter in an investigation proceeding or hearing under this   or b associated with a person or group of persons of a different race color creed religion sexual orientation or national origin nothing contained in this be construed to limit the right of any person to file a complaint with the minnesota commissioner of human rights or to limit the right of any person concerned or affected to a hearing of the facts and issues in any court having jurisdiction of cases involving discriminatory practices subd 6 exemptions a the provisions of subdivision 3 shall not apply to 1 rooms in a temporary or permanent residence home run by a nonprofit organization if the discrimination is by sex  or 2 the rental by a resident owner or occupier of a onefamily accommodation of a room or rooms in such accommodation to another person or persons if the discrimination is by sex marital status status with regard to public assistance sexual orientation or disability nothing in this be construed to require any person or group of persons selling renting or leasing property to modify the property in any way or exercise a higher degree of care for a person having a disability than for a person who does not have a disability  nor shall this construed to relieve any person regardless of any disability in written lease rental agreement or contract of purchase or sale or to forbid distinctions based on the inability to fulfill the terms and conditions including financial obligations of such lease agreement or contract 3 the rental by a resident owner of a unit in a dwelling containing not more than two units if the discrimination is on the basis of sexual orientation b the provisions of subdivision 3 prohibiting discrimination because of familial status shall not be construed to defeat the applicability of any local state or federal restrictions regarding the maximum number of occupants permitted to occupy a dwelling unit and shall not apply to 1 an unoccupied dwelling unit in any building in which at least a majority of the dwelling units are occupied by elderly persons or are unoccupied and available for occupancy solely by households of which at least one member is an elderly person  or 2 any owner occupied building containing four or fewer dwelling units  or 3 an unoccupied dwelling unit in any building which is the subject of a valid certificate filed with the state commissioner of human rights pursuant to the provisions of minnesota statutes subd 2 as amended subd 7 filing with building official owners of dwelling units exempt from the provisions of subdivision 3 prohibiting discrimination because of familial status pursuant to subdivision 683 shall file a copy of the election or certificate with the housing inspector for the city subd 8 grievance procedure the commission shall develop rules and regulations for the establishment of a procedure to address grievances pursuant to this chapter said rules and regulations shall include but not be limited to application for grievance hearing information required commission response deadlines notification of result and denial of services subd 9 notice to state the commission may in its discretion notify the minnesota department of human rights of any unfair discriminatory practice which has come to its attention either by grievance or otherwise subd 10 construction nothing in this be construed to a mean the city of red wing condones homosexuality or bisexuality or any equivalent lifestyle  or b authorize the recognition of or the right of marriage between persons of the same sex subd 11 criminal   effect nothing in this chapter alters the provisions of minnesota statutes or any other law relating to criminal penalties human rights and domestic partnerships subd 1 statement of legislative purpose and intent the city of red wing recognizes that nationwide debate has advanced an expanded concept of familial relationships beyond traditional marital and blood relationships this ordinance creates a process to provide two nonmarried but committed adult partners to declare themselves domestic partners thereby providing a governmentbased foundation to such committed relationships which positively contributes to the health safety and welfare of the community as a whole this ordinance does not create or confer rights or privileges that are available to married persons under state or federal laws the city of red wing does not provide legal advice concerning domestic relationships applicants and registrants should consult with attorneys or other advisors for advice on such matters as wills durable powers of attorney health care directives medical matters health care finances or employment benefits subd 2 definition for the purpose of this the term domestic partner means two persons 18 years of age or older who a are not related by blood closer than permitted under the marriage laws of the state  b are not married in a manner recognized in minnesota  c are competent to contract  d have no other domestic partner  e affirm that they are jointly responsible to each other for the necessities of life  f affirm that they are committed to one another to the same extent as married persons are to each other except for the traditional marital status and solemnities  and g at least one of the partners either resides or works in the city of red wing subd 3 registration of domestic partners a the city clerk shall accept an application to register as domestic partners from persons who state in such application that they meet the definition of domestic partners set out in subd 2 b for all applications received in 201 the city clerk will charge an application fee of $50 for the registration of a domestic partnership after 201 the application fee may be increased or decreased on an annual basis and will thereafter be set forth in the citys fee ordinance the city clerk shall also charge a reasonable fee per document for providing certified copies or registrations amendments or notices of termination there shall be no charge for filing amendments or notices of termination c the city clerk shall provide each domestic partner with a registration certificate the registration certificate shall not be issued prior to the third working day after the date of application d this application and certificate may be used as evidence of the existence of a domestic partners relationship e the city clerk shall keep a record of all registrations of domestic partnership amendments to registrations and notices of termination received by the city clerk the records shall be maintained so that amendments and notices of termination are filed with the registration of domestic partnership to which they pertain f upon production of valid governmentissued documentation and only to the extent of the rights and responsibilities established therein or elsewhere in this the terms domestic partnership and registered domestic partnership shall include in addition to domestic partnerships registered with the city of red wing and regardless of whether partners in either circumstance have sought further registration with the city of red wing 1 any person who has a currently registered domestic partnership with a governmental body pursuant to state local or other law authorizing such registration the term domestic partnership should be construed broadly to include samesex civil unions or other such samesex unions in which two samesex individuals are committed to one another to the same extent as married persons are to each other except for the traditional marital status and solemnities  and 2 marriages that would be legally recognized as a contract of lawful marriage in another local state or foreign jurisdiction subd 4 amendments the city clerk may accept amendments for filing from persons who have a domestic partnership application on file except amendments which would change the identity of the partners subd 5 termination of domestic partnerships a either person in a domestic partnership may initiate termination of the domestic partnership by written notification to the city clerk on a form provided by the city clerks office b a domestic partnership terminates when the earlier of the following occurs 1 one of the partners dies  or 2 fortyfive days after one partner sends the other a written notice of termination that he or she has terminated the partnership by filing a notice of termination with the city clerk source fourth series effective date 07022011 disposal of abandoned motor vehicles unclaimed property and excess property subd 1 disposal of abandoned motor vehicles a definitions 1 abandoned motor vehicle  a motor vehicle as defined in minnesota statutes subd 3 that has remained illegally for a period of more than 48 hours on public property or lacking vital component parts or has remained for more than 48 hours on private property without the consent of the person in control of such property and lacks vital component parts or is in an inoperable condition such that it has no substantial potential for further use consistent with its usual function unless it is kept in an enclosed garage or storage building it shall also mean a motor vehicle voluntarily surrendered by its owner to and accepted by the city a classic car or pioneer car as defined in minnesota statutes shall not be considered an abandoned motor vehicle within the meaning of this on the premises of junk yards or automobile graveyards which are licensed and maintained in accordance with the city shall not be considered abandoned motor vehicles within the meaning of this vital component parts  those parts of a motor vehicle that are essential to the mechanical functioning of the vehicle including but not limited to the motor drive train and wheels 3 garage keeper  is an operator of a parking place or establishment an operator of a motor vehicle storage facility or an operator of an establishment for the servicing repair or maintenance of motor vehicles b custody the city may take into custody and impound any abandoned motor vehicle c notice of taking within ten days when an abandoned motor vehicle is taken into custody the city shall give notice of the taking within ten days the notice shall be sent by mail to the registered owner if any and to all readily identifiable lienholders of record if it is impossible to determine with reasonable certainty the identity and address of the registered owner and all lienholders the notice shall be published once in the official newspaper of the city the notice shall set forth the date and place of the taking the year make model and serial number of the impounded motor vehicle if such information can be reasonably obtained and the place where the vehicle is being held inform the owner and any lienholders of their right to reclaim the vehicle and state that failure of the owner or lienholders to exercise their right to reclaim the vehicle shall be deemed a waiver by them of all right title and interest in the vehicle and contents and a consent to the transfer or title to and disposal or sale of the vehicle and contents d right to reclaim 1 payment of charges the owner or any lienholder of an abandoned motor vehicle shall have a right to reclaim such vehicle from the city upon payment of all towing and storage charges resulting from taking the vehicle into custody within 15 days after the date of the notice required by this subdivision 2 lienholder nothing in this subdivision shall be construed to impair any lien of a garage keeper under the laws of this state or the right of the lienholder to foreclose e public sale after 15 days 1 an abandoned motor vehicle is eligible for disposal or sale 15 days after notice to the owner under this section an abandoned motor vehicle and contents taken into custody and not reclaimed under this subdivision shall be sold to the highest bidder at public auction or sale or electronic selling process following notice required under this subdivision the purchaser shall be given a receipt in a form prescribed by the registrar of motor vehicles which shall be sufficient title to dispose of the vehicle the receipt shall also entitle the purchaser to register the vehicle and receive a certificate of title free and clear of all liens and claims of ownership before such a vehicle is issued a new certificate of title it must receive a motor vehicle safety check 2 from the proceeds of the sale of an abandoned motor vehicle the city shall reimburse itself for the cost of towing preserving and storing the vehicle and all administrative notice and publication costs incurred pursuant to this subdivision any remainder from the proceeds of a sale shall be held for the owner of the vehicle or entitled lien holder for 90 days and then shall be deposited in the general fund of the city f disposal of vehicles not sold where no bid has been received for an abandoned motor vehicle the city may dispose of it in accordance with this subdivision g contracts and disposal 1 the city may contract with any qualified person for collection storage incineration volume reduction transportation or other services necessary to prepare abandoned motor vehicles and other scrap metal for recycling or other methods of disposal 2 where the city enters into a contract with a person duly licensed by the minnesota pollution control agency the agency may review the contract to determine whether it conforms to the agencys plan for solid waste disposal a contract that does so conform may be approved by the agency where a contract has been approved the agency may reimburse the city for the costs incurred under the contract which have not been reimbursed 3 if the city utilizes its own equipment and personnel for disposal of the abandoned motor vehicle it shall be entitled to reimbursement for the cost thereof along with its other costs as herein provided subd 2 disposal of unclaimed property other than motor vehicles a scope except as otherwise provided in minnesota statutes this the procedure for the disposition of abandoned personal property including found property b definitions as used in this chapter the following words and phrases shall have the following meanings unless the context clearly indicates that a different meaning is intended 1 abandoned property  is personal property of any type  the owner of which has failed to make satisfactory claim and proof of ownership within 60 days after notice has been provided as described below 2 finder  is a person who finds lost or discarded personal property belonging to another and gives the property to an officer 3 found property  is personal property which appears to have been lost or discarded and then subsequently found by another found property does not include property left in the care of an individual which is subsequently unclaimed by its owner 4 officer  is any officer agent or employee of the city acting within the scope of his or her employment 5 unclaimed property  is personal property of any type where the owner or his or her whereabouts is unknown or which is unclaimed for more than seven days c notice of official possession 1 any officer having in his or her official possession unclaimed property and wishing to dispose of such property at a public auction or sale including an electronic selling process shall from time to time prepare and publish written notice containing the information required in subdivision 2 2 the written notice shall contain the following information a the name designation and office address of the officer giving the notice  b the description of the unclaimed property individually or by lot that has come into the possession of the officer since the issuance of the last notice  c a demand that all owners of the property described in the notice make claim and proof of ownership satisfactory to the officer named in the notice within 60 days from the date of the notice  d a statement that any of the unclaimed property not so claimed within the 60day period shall be deemed to be abandoned and that the same may be disposed by the city  and e the date of the notice 3 the notice shall be published in the citys official newspaper at least once a copy of the notice shall be posted at city hall and a copy of the notice shall be mailed to the owner if the owners name and address is known 4 nothing in this prevent an officer from disposing of unclaimed property by a private sale nonprofit organization that has a mission of community service after the property has been in the possession of the municipality for a period of at least 60 days d claim and proof of ownership except as provided in subdivision 2c4 if unclaimed property remains in the possession of the officer without any person making satisfactory claim and proof of ownership for a period of 60 days from the date of the notice describing it the personal property shall be deemed to be abandoned and title to the property shall be deemed to be in the city by reason of abandonment by the owner and possession by the city e found property 1 when dealing with property which is lost and found by a finder and then turned over to an officer the finder shall be deemed to have made satisfactory claim and proof of ownership to be entitled to possession of the unclaimed property at the end of 60 days the waiting period from the date of the notice however the finders claim and proof of ownership under this subdivision shall be inferior to and subject to a satisfactory claim and proof of ownership by any owner of the property 2 after the expiration of the waiting period the city shall notify the finder in writing of the expiration of the waiting period and the disposition of the found property if the property has not been returned to the owner the notice shall include the statement that the finder must take possession of the property within 30 days of the date of the notification and that failure to take possession of the property shall result in the title of the property vesting in the city 3 in the event that the finder fails to take possession of the property as provided above or the owner fails to take possession of the property within 30 days of the owners satisfactory claim and proof of ownership the property shall be considered abandoned and title of the property shall vest in the city for disposition according to this upon delivery of the unclaimed property to the finder as provided in this subdivision the city shall have no further interest or obligations with respect to the property the city shall however provide the name and address of the finder and the location of the property if known to any person making a satisfactory claim and proof of ownership subsequent to the delivery of the property to the finder f disposal 1 the city shall have the right to sell or otherwise dispose of abandoned property to the highest bidder at public auction or sale or by sale to the highest bidder using an electronic selling process alternatively the city may deliver abandoned property at no charge to any community nonprofit organization 2 abandoned property need not be sold for less than the cost of advertising and selling the city reserves the right to reject any and all bids if abandoned property cannot be disposed of at an amount greater than the cost of advertising and selling the city may destroy the property or otherwise dispose of it as it sees fit 3 the officer or entity conducting the sale shall maintain a complete and accurate record of the sale which shall include the description of the abandoned property sold the name and the address of the purchasers the sale price of each item sold and the costs of the sale 4 the officer or entity conducting the sale shall execute and deliver a certificate of sale or a receipt to the purchaser of each item of property the certificate shall describe the item sold the purchase price the name and address of the purchaser and the date of purchase the certificate shall pass the title of the item to the purchaser 5 the chief of police is authorized to administer the disposal of bicycles lawfully coming into the possession of the city and remaining unclaimed by the owner after a 60day waiting period in addition to the disposal methods provided herein disposal of unclaimed bicycles may be by donation to a nonprofit organization that has a significant mission of community service or to another public corporation for public use a notice specifying the date of the donation the identity of the donor and a general description of the bicycles shall be published in the official newspaper of the city at least eight months prior to such donation at any time prior to the donation date and upon satisfactory proof of ownership the bicycle shall be returned to its owner g disposition of proceeds 1 all monies received from the disposal of abandoned property less the costs of advertising and selling shall be immediately paid to the finance director and retained in a separate fund for at least six months 2 should any person within six months from the date of disposal of any abandoned property make claim to it and establish ownership the sum of money paid over to the finance director shall be paid to that person in no event shall any claim be considered unless it shall be presented to the finance director in writing before the expiration of six months from the date of the disposal of the item claimed 3 after expiration of six months from the date of the disposal of the item claimed the monies received from the disposal of abandoned property shall be transferred into the citys general fund h contraband personal property which is illegal to possess may not be sold at auction or returned to a finder subd 3 disposal of excess property a declaration of surplus and authorizing sale of property the council administrator may from time to time recommend to the council that certain property chattels owned by the city is no longer needed for a municipal purpose and should be sold pursuant to of the city charter the council may declare said property to be surplus estimate the value of the property and authorize the council administrator to dispose of said property in the manner stated herein b surplus property with a total estimated value of less than $100 the council administrator may authorize the sale of surplus property with a total value of less than $100 sale or by an electronic selling process c surplus property with a total estimated value between $100 and $10000 the council administrator shall offer for public sale to the highest bidder surplus property with a total estimated value of $100 to $10000 such sale shall be by quotation competitive bids or by public auction including an electronic selling process in the event that sale is by competitive bids notice of such public sale shall be given stating time and place of sale and generally describing the property to be sold at least ten days prior to the date of sale by publication once in the official newspaper d surplus property with a total estimated value over $10000 the council administrator shall offer for public sale to the highest bidder surplus property with a total estimated value over $10000 notice of such public sale shall be given stating time and place of sale and generally describing property to be sold at least ten days prior to the date of sale by publication once in the official newspaper such sale shall be to the person submitting the highest bid by means of publically advertised sealed bids or public auction including an electronic selling process e receipts from sales of surplus property all receipts from sales of surplus property under this be deposited in the fund disposing of such surplus property subd 4 persons who may not purchase  exception a no employee of the city who is a member of the administrative staff department head a member of the council or an advisor serving the city in a professional capacity may be a purchaser of property under this city employees may be purchasers if they are not directly involved in the sale if they are the highest responsible bidder and if at least one weeks published or posted notice of sale is given b it is unlawful for any person to be a purchaser of property under this such purchase is prohibited by the terms of this 19 vacation of real property subd 1 purpose the purpose of this to clarify the procedure for vacation of streets real property or utility easements by the city council set forth at 02 of the red wing city charter subd 2 vacation of real property by city council the city council may by resolution approved by at least a majority of all members of the council vacate any street or other interest in real property owned by the city or by the public and located within the city except for public utility easements no vacation shall be made unless it appears in the interest of the public to do so after a hearing preceded by ten days published notice after such resolution is adopted the city clerk shall file a certified copy of the resolution in the office of the county recorder any failure to file said certified copy of resolution shall not invalidate any such vacation proceedings the action shall take effect upon filing subd 3 vacation of public utility easements by city council the city council may by resolution approved by a majority of all members of the council vacate any public utility easement owned by the city or by the public and located within the city after such resolution is adopted the city clerk shall file a certified copy of the resolution in the office of the county auditor and in the office of the county recorder any failure to file said certified copy of resolution shall not invalidate any such vacation proceedings the action shall take effect upon filing subd 4 vacation of real property upon petition the city council may by resolution approved by a majority of all members of the council vacate any street or other interest in real property owned by the city or by the public and located within the city upon the following a filing of a verified petition signed by or on behalf of any and all owners natural or corporate of any real estate abutting thereon  and b presentation and filing proof of ownership of said property abutting the real property to be vacated in a form subject to approval by the city attorney after such resolution is adopted the city clerk shall file a certified copy of the resolution in the office of the county auditor and in the office of the county recorder any failure to file said certified copy of resolution shall not invalidate any such vacation proceedings the action shall take effect upon filing deferred special assessments for disabled and senior citizens subd 1 the council may at its discretion and pursuant to minnesota statutes defer payment of certain special assessments in accordance with the following guidelines and procedures subd 2 qualifications for deferment persons seeking deferment of a special assessment imposed by the city shall meet the following qualifications 1 own a homestead  2 be 65 years of age or older retired by virtue of a permanent and total disability or a member of the minnesota national guard or other military reserves who is ordered into active military service as defined in minnesota statutes subds 5b or 5c as stated in the persons military orders  3 demonstrate that payment of the assessment would be a hardship  4 be obligated to pay an assessment set by council resolution  and 5 be willing to provide the city with such information as the city may require to make a proper determination as to eligibility subd 3 procedure a a person seeking deferment must be the owner of the property which shall have homestead status and shall make application to the city on forms prescribed by the city an application shall be made not later than 15 days prior to the certification of assessments to the county auditor b the application shall be filed with the city clerk an application shall be dated and shall contain a certification by the applicant that the information therein or made a part thereof is true and correct the application shall contain a financial statement in form customarily used by a lending institution in the city it shall also contain a copy of the previous years minnesota income tax return if one was prepared andor submitted to the state c the city clerk shall consider the application and make a written report the city clerk may interview the applicant and may request additional information from the applicant or others a report shall be filed on or before october 31 the report shall contain a recommended interest rate on any deferred assessment a copy of the report shall be mailed to or given to the applicant by the clerk d any unusual circumstances pertaining to an applicant not covered by the standards and guidelines herein set forth may be referred to the city council for its final determination the determination shall be made in a nondiscriminatory manner and the city council will not give the applicant an unreasonable preference or advantage over other applicants e if a deferment is granted the city clerk shall make the proper certification to the county recorder which shall set forth the amount of the assessment and the amount of interest if any pursuant to minnesota statutes  determination of hardship a for the purpose of the the word hardship means financial suffering privation or trouble that is extremely hard to bear b to determine whether or not there is hardship the city clerk shall carefully examine the financial status of the applicant the clerk shall determine the applicants net income and consider any relevant and special facts concerning the applicants financial condition the city clerk shall not grant a deferment for a person with a monthly income exceeding the income limits established by the department of housing and urban development income guidelines for goodhue county and as approved by council resolution for the purposes of this net income is the previous years minnesota income tax adjusted gross income plus tax exempt income in the event no income tax form was prepared andor submitted to the state the city clerk shall require the applicant to submit the information which would have been used to determine net income if the determination of net income does not correctly reflect the present financial status of the applicant other facts may be considered c the city clerk shall include in the report exceptional or unusual circumstances pertaining to hardship together with a recommendation respecting the same subd 5 termination of deferred assessments a the option to defer the payment of special assessments shall terminate and all amounts accumulated plus applicable interest and the amount of any recording fees paid by the city in connection with the deferred assessment shall become due upon the occurrence of any one of the following 1 death of the owner when there is no spouse who is eligible for deferment 2 sale transfer or subdivision of all or any part of the property 3 loss of homestead status on the property 4 determination by the council for any reason that there would be no hardship to require immediate or partial payment b if the eligibility for deferment is lost the entire amount of the special assessment shall be due within 60 days if the special assessment is not paid within 60 days the city clerk shall add interest thereto at the rate originally certified from the due date of the following year and the total amount of principal and interest shall be certified to the county auditor for collection with taxes for the following year or equal annual installments for the remaining years of the original special assessment time period whichever is longer acres deferred special assessments for green deferrals of special assessments are required for certain agricultural or specialized use property in accordance with minnesota statutes commonly known as the green acres law the city will follow the requirements of that statute deferred assessments governed by this be subject to an interest rate set by council resolution if allowed by minnesota statute other applicable law the amount of any recording fees paid by the city in connection with the deferred assessment will be added to the assessment amount property deferred assessments for unimproved subd 1 criteria for deferment the city council may in its discretion and pursuant to minnesota statutes subd 2 defer payment of certain special assessments for unimproved property in accordance with the following guidelines a assessments on commercial property that is marginally buildable may be deferred for up to ten years b assessments on residential property that is unplatted and has undeveloped frontage in excess of 200 feet may be deferred up to a maximum of ten years subd 2 interest all deferred assessments shall be subject to an interest rate set by council resolution the interest will be compounded annually until the assessment is activated subd 3 activation of deferred assessments
