deferred assessments pursuant to this be activated when the land is sold transferred subdivided combined developed a building permit is issued utility services are connected or the deferment period expires whichever occurs first when the assessment becomes active the term and rate will be as set forth in the original assessment resolution subd 4 recording of deferred assessments the city shall record deferred assessments for unimproved property in accordance with minnesota statutes subd 2 the amount of any recording fees paid by the city in connection with the deferred assessment will be added to the assessment amount payment of assessments subd 1 payment of whole assessment before initial certification the owner of property assessed may at any time prior to initial certification of the assessment to the county auditor pay the whole of the assessment on such property with interest accrued to the date of payment to the city except that no interest shall be charged if the entire assessment is paid within 30 days from the adoption of the assessment resolution subd 2 payment of whole assessment after initial certification after the initial certification of the assessment to the county auditor prepayment will be accepted for the total amount still owing with interest accrued to december 31 of the year in which such payment is made such payment must be made by november 15 or interest will be charged of the next succeeding year subd 3 partial prepayment of assessment within 30 days from the adoption of the assessment resolution a property owner may make a partial prepayment of the principal to the city interest free such partial prepayment must be at least $100 subd 4 multiple special assessments if a parcel has two or more separate special assessments payment as described in the preceding paragraphs of this may be made on one or more assessments subd 5 certification of assessment if the assessment is not paid in its entirety the city will certify each years collection of principal and interest to the county auditor in november certification to the county auditor will result in the principal and interest appearing on the property tax statements of those assessed subd 6 this adopted pursuant to the authority of minnesota statutes 24 system expense reimbursement and escrow subd 1 expense reimbursement required all applicants for any licenses and permits of any kind and description from the city along with all applicants for any land use approvals including without limitation rezoning conditional use permits and variances subdivision approval or planned development of all kind and description shall reimburse the city for all expense incurred by the city in processing the application including without limitation reimbursement of staff time and consultant fees subd 2 escrow deposit required before any application is accepted by the city for any of the foregoing the applicant shall pay a minimum base fee and provide an escrow deposit in a noninterest bearing account in an amount determined by the city as necessary to reimburse the city for all staff time and expense and consultant fees that are incurred in the processing of the application the city council shall by ordinance set all fees and initial escrow amount for each type of license and permit the determination of the amount of the escrow shall be based upon the wage and benefit rates of staff members anticipated to be involved in the processing and approval process and anticipated consultant fees if the applicant fails to make the escrow deposit the application shall be deemed incomplete and shall not be processed by the city in the event the amount in the escrow deposit is deemed insufficient the finance director or a designee shall notify the applicant the applicant shall be required to immediately deposit an additional amount deemed sufficient to cover all staff and consultant expense as determined by the finance director the failure to make such a deposit upon request shall be grounds for denial of the land use approval sought upon final disposition of the application the applicant shall be reimbursed for any amounts that are not used for reimbursement of expense to the city the city shall make said reimbursement within 45 days of final action violation a misdemeanor or a petty misdemeanor upon conviction of violating this a person shall be punished for a petty misdemeanor except for violations of which constitute a misdemeanor title page chapter 3 02 303 304 305 306 307 308 309 310 311 312 313 municipal utilities  rules and regulations rates charges and collections definitions 31 fixing rates and charges for utilities 31 contractual contents 32 rules and regulations relating to utilities 32 rules and regulations relating to water service 34 special water connection charges 38 rules and regulations relating to sanitary sewerage service 311 controls on use of public sewers and pretreatment of industrial wastewater 316 stormwater management 345 drainage ditch charges for the pioneer watershed area 345 rules and regulations relating to stormwater service 346 special sewer connection charges 349 violation a misdemeanor andor will result in a fine andor a bill 349 chapter 3 municipal utilities  rules and regulations rates charges and collections definitions as used in this the following words and terms shall have the meanings stated 1 utility  any cityowned utility system that provides including but not by way of limitation water sanitary sewerage stormwater solid waste and communication service 2 consumer or customer  the owner of the property being served by the municipal utility 3 utility system  infrastructure that produces transports or delivers service from a publicly or cityowned property 4 service  providing a particular utility to a customer or consumer 5 stormwater pollution prevention plan swppp  a national pollution discharge elimination system npdes permit requirement that describes mandatory best management practices bmps for municipal separate storm sewer systems in order to discharge municipal stormwater into the waters of the state 6 biochemical oxygen demand bod  the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five days at 20 centigrade expressed in terms of weight and concentration milligrams per liter mgi 7 suspended solids ss  the total suspended matter that floats on the surface of or is suspended in water wastewater or other liquids and which is removable by a standard glass fiber filter fixing rates and charges for utilities all rates and charges for utilities including but not by way of limitation rates for service annual area fee special stormwater sewer connection charge permit fees deposit connection and meter testing fees service repair charges disconnection fees reconnection fees including penalties for nonpayment if any shall be fixed determined and amended by the city council and adopted by ordinance such ordinance containing the effective date thereof shall be kept on file and open to inspection in the office of the city clerk and shall be uniformly enforced for the purpose of fixing such rates and charges the city council may categorize and classify under the various types of service provided that such categorization and classification shall be included in the ordinance authorized by this 03 contractual contents provisions of this to utilities shall constitute portions of the contract between the city and all consumers of utility services and every such consumer shall be deemed to assent to the same utilities rules and regulations relating to subd 1 application connection and sale of service application for utility services shall be made upon forms supplied by the city and strictly in accordance therewith no connection shall be made until consent has been received from the city to make the same and all fees and charges required by this been paid in full all utilities shall be sold and delivered to consumers under the then applicable rate applied to the amount of such utilities taken as metered or ascertained in connection with such rates subd 2 discontinuance of service utilities that do not affect the primary heat source for a residential unit may be shut off or discontinued whenever it is found that a the consumer or customer of the premises served or any person working on any connection with the utility systems has violated any requirement of the city thereto or any connection therewith or b any charge for a utility service or any other financial obligation imposed on the present consumer or customer of the premises served is unpaid after due notice thereof or c there is fraud or misrepresentation by the consumer or customer in connection with any application for service or delivery or charges therefore subd 3 cold weather rule utilities that affect the primary heat source for a residential unit may not be disconnected between october 15 and april 15 except in accordance with the cold weather rule contained in minnesota statutes as it may be amended a the consumer or customer shall be responsible for notifying the city in writing that their primary heat source or residential unit is dependent on city utility connection for operation subd 4 right of entry with consent of the owner or occupant or in the event of an emergency the city has the right to enter in and upon private property including buildings and dwelling houses in or upon which is installed a utility or connection therewith at all times reasonable under the circumstances for the purpose of reading utility meters for the purpose of inspection and repair of meters or a utility system or any part thereof and for the purpose of connecting and disconnecting service subd 5 unlawful acts a it is unlawful for any person to willfully or carelessly break injure mar deface disturb or in any way interfere with any buildings attachments machinery apparatus equipment fixture or appurtenance of any utility or utility system or commit any act tending to obstruct or impair the use of any utility b it is unlawful for any person to make any connection with opening into use or alter in any way any utility system without first having applied for and received written permission to do so from the city c it is unlawful for any person to turn on or connect a utility when the same has been turned off or disconnected by the city for nonpayment of a bill or for any other reason without first having obtained a permit to do so from the city d it is unlawful for any person to jumper or by any means or device fully or partially circumvent a utility meter or to knowingly use or consume unmetered utilities or use the services of any utility system the use of which the proper billing authorities have no knowledge subd 6 utility services and charges a lien a payment for all utility service and charges shall be the primary responsibility of the consumer or customer of the premises served and shall be billed to the owner of the premises on or after  the city may collect the same in a civil action or in the alternative and at the option of the city as otherwise provided in this subdivision b each such charge including those termed special charges is hereby made a lien upon the premises served by a connection to or utilization of a municipal utility system or service of the city and located within the city all such charges not paid and becoming delinquent may be recovered by assessing the property the unpaid balance shall be placed on the assessment roll as provided by the city charter and statute provisions service rules and regulations relating to water subd 1 use requirements where the public water supply system is accessible no person shall maintain a water distribution system which is not connected to the public water supply system without authorization by the city council where the public water supply system is accessible no person shall use private well water for domestic use without authorization by the city council subd 2 customers additional application procedures for water consumers or a when the consumer or customer desires to terminate city water service five business days written notice to the public works office must be given said notice shall state therein the date of the requested termination unless the notice provision is complied with the consumer or customer shall continue to be responsible for charges and fees incurred because of the city supplying water to the premises b after water has been introduced into any building or upon any premises no person shall make any tap or connection with the pipes upon such premises for alteration extensions or attachments unless the party ordering such tapping or other works shall exhibit the proper permit for the same from the city c all persons taking the water shall keep their own service pipes service corporations stopcocks or curb stops and apparatus in good repair and protected from frost at their own risk and expense all water taken or used from the city water system unless otherwise ordered by the city council must be metered and paid for except water used in putting out fire d all expenses relating to the introduction of water into buildings or private premises shall be paid by the applicant no charge however shall be made for the services of the city in directing where and in what manner the mains shall be tapped and excavations made in the streets for laying pipe e it is expressly stipulated by the city that no claim shall be made against it by reason of the breaking or freezing of any service pipe service cock or curb stop  nor if from any cause the supply of water should fail  nor from damage arising from shutting off water to repair mains making connections or extensions  nor for any other purpose that may be necessary the right is hereby reserved to cut off the supply of water at any time for the purpose of repairs or any other necessary purpose any permit granted or regulation to the contrary notwithstanding whenever it becomes necessary to shut off the water supply within any area of the city the city shall if practicable give notice to each and every consumer or customer within said area of the time when such supply will be shut off f water will not be turned on to any building or private service pipe except upon the order in writing of the city when the water has been turned off by the order of the city no consumer or customer shall turn it on nor permit it to be turned on without the written consent of the city subd 3 and appliances tapping of main water lines and installation of service pipe a no persons except those having special permission from the city or persons in their service and approved by them will be permitted under any circumstances to tap the mains or distributing pipes or altering any service of appurtenances the kind and size of the connection with the mains shall be that specified in the permit or order from the city b mains must always be tapped midway in the upper quadrant between the horizontal and perpendicular lines drawn center of the main and not in any case at or within 14 inches of the hub c copper pipe in size not less than one inch shall be used from the main to the curb stop near the property line any pipe allowed under law may be used from the curb stop to the inside of the building and water meter if such pipe is not capable of being heated by electrical current a warning must be permanently posted by the water meter and point of entry of the pipe into the building stating warning  frozen  cannot be thawed electrically the sign shall be of substantial size to be readily noticed and in a form approved by the city the sign shall be maintained by the property owner and it shall be unlawful to remove the sign every pipe shall be laid sufficiently waving and in such manner to prevent rupture by settling nonconductive materials used for water services in lieu of copper pipe shall require that a locator wire be installed for location of utilities the contractor will furnish and install a coated solid copper tracer wire on all nonconductive watersewer service lines in the trench alongside the pipe wire color will be blue for water and green for sewer the tracer wire shall daylight at the point of entry at the foundation of the building conduit and a blank box as a future contact point to locate the service d all service pipes must be laid to a depth of eight feet below the surface of the finished grade in all cases they must be so protected as to prevent rupture by settling e every service pipe must be provided with two stopcocks for each consumer or customer easily accessible  the one to the consumer or customer the other to the city and so situated that the water can be conveniently shut off stopcocks must be of the pattern known as the round water way or full flow f unless otherwise permitted the city stopcocks or curb stops shall be placed on the property line and protected by a box or iron pipe reaching from the stopcock or curb stop to the surface and of suitable size to admit a stop key or curb stop key for turning on and off the stop such protecting box or pipe shall have a cover with the letter w thereon visible and even with the pavement of finished grade g automatic pressure regulators may be provided by the consumer or customer in every service pipe entering buildings to reduce the excessive pressure from the mains stopcocks and other appurtenances must be sufficiently strong to bear the pressure and ram of the water in the mains all house boilers shall be constructed with one or more air holes near the top of the inlet pipe and be sufficiently strong to bear the pressure of the atmosphere under the vacuum h all lateral or service pipes for public or private uses and all necessary fixtures connected therewith shall be subject to the approval and laid under the supervision of the city or the authorized agent  and the right is reserved to said city to decline to connect with plumbing not done in accordance with the existing rules and regulations or the orders of the city pertaining thereto subd 4 repair or replacement of service lines or appurtenances a the city shall have the sole authority to repair or replace at the owners expense any service lines or appurtenances thereto on public property that due to damage or faulty condition are leaking or inoperable the city need not obtain a property owners permission to make such repairs b in the event a service line on private property is damaged or in faulty condition resulting in leaks said private property owner shall have a maximum of 72 hours to repair said leak in the event said repairs are not made within the 72 hour period the city shall have the right to turn off the water subd 5 water meters and meter appurtenances a all water meters and meter appurtenances used in the city for city water shall be owned furnished and kept in ordinary repair by the city the original installation must be accomplished by a licensed plumber or the city b all such water meters and meter appurtenances must be so set up and maintained that they can be easily examined and read and be provided with suitable protection so as to make them safe from frost or other damage  and the consumer or customer of such meter and meter appurtenances at the consumer or customers expense must furnish such protection in case any such water meter andor meter appurtenances are injured by frost or otherwise damaged by the carelessness of the consumer or customer or the consumer or customers agent or servant or because the consumer or customer neglects or fails to furnish a safe and suitable place for the meter andor meter appurtenances or the protection thereof or such meter andor meter appurtenances should be damaged by the consumer or customer then such meters andor meter appurtenances may be repaired or replaced by the city at the expense of the consumer or customer or property owner as the city may determine in case of neglect or refusal by the consumer or customer to furnish safe and suitable protection so as to make such meter andor appurtenances safe from frost or other damage the city or its authorized agent shall refuse to turn on city water or until the consumer or customer shall have complied with such requirement said city shall install all such water meters andor meter appurtenances and replace and keep the same in ordinary repair at the expense of the city provided such repair or replacement is not caused by the negligence of the consumer or customer or his refusal to comply with the terms of this or the rules of the city subd 6 general provisions a where city water is used or furnished for purposes not specified in the ordinance adopting rates the charges shall be fixed by the city council and where different or larger water meters than are specified are used such service charges shall be made therefore as the city council may determine b persons wishing to obtain bulk amounts of water must obtain the water from the public works department at designated facilities with loading to be supervised by city personnel c persons shall be charged actual costs of labor and equipment supplied by the city in addition to the water charges in no event shall any person obtain water from any city hydrant other than provided herein d any person desiring to use city hydrants for the purpose of filling a swimming pool shall contact the public works department the public works department shall arrange for the provision of services for the filling of the pool and shall attach a meter to the hydrant to measure the water usage and certify the meter reading to the public works department office for billing purposes the charges made therefor to be contained on the regular billing as sent to the consumer or customer e a consumer or customer who wishes to connect to the citys water system for the purpose of supplying water to a fire suppression sprinkler system or private fire hydrant for use as firefighting protection shall be permitted to connect to the street main at the consumer or customers own expense upon application to the city and upon approval thereof construction of said main to be supervised by an authorized agent of the city the use of such water to be restricted solely to firefighting purposes all valves admitting water to such pipes must be sealed in the event a seal is broken or damaged the consumer or customer must notify the public works department of such damage or breakage f all water supplied for emergency firefighting purposes shall be furnished at no cost to the consumer or customer g all sprinkler and private fire hydrant annual charges not paid and becoming delinquent may be recovered by assessing the property the unpaid balance shall be placed on the assessment roll as provided by the city charter and statute provisions subd 7 maintenance cross connection device installation testing and a the terms administrative authority crossconnection backflow preventer testable backflow prevention assembly shall have the same meanings as set forth in the minnesota plumbing city council or its designee shall act as the administrative authority for purposes of enforcing the provisions of this ordinance b all plumbing connections to the citys water distribution system shall be installed in accordance with the minnesota plumbing as it may be amended if in accordance with the minnesota plumbing or if in the judgement of the administrative authority an approved backflow prevention device is necessary for the safety of the public water system the administrative authority will give notice to the water customer to install such an approved device immediately the water customer shall at his own expense install such an approved device immediately at a location and in a manner that is compliant with the minnesota plumbing the administrative authority must be notified prior to the installation of any testable backflow prevention assembly d any crossconnection control devices including but not limited to reduced pressure backflow preventers rpz or other testable backflow prevention assemblies shall be inspected maintained and overhauled at intervals not exceeding those identified in the minnesota plumbing test and inspection tag that includes the test date and tester signature and identification number shall be affixed to the device written records of testing and maintenance shall be maintained and submitted to the administrative authority the city may designate a process or outside entity to monitor and track reporting requirements e no person firm or corporation shall establish or permit to be established or maintain or permit to be maintained any connection whereby a private auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public water supply of the city may enter the supply or distribution system of the city unless such private auxiliary or emergency water supply and the method of connection and use of such supply shall be approved by the administrative authority and the minnesota department of health f the administrative authority shall have the right to enter at any reasonable time any property served by a connection to the public water supply or distribution system of the city for the purpose of verifying the presence or absence of cross connections or testing backflow devices or assemblies or for verifying information submitted by the customer regarding the required crossconnection control inspection such requirement shall be a term and condition related to the privilege of receiving water from the city public water supply in the event that the person in ownership or control of the property should refuse or prevent entry or inspection the city may seek the issuance of an administrative search warrant on demand lessees or occupants of any property served by the city public water supply shall furnish to the administrative authority any information requested regarding the piping system or systems or water use on such property the refusal of such information when demanded shall within the discretion of the administrative authority be deemed evidence of the presence of improper connections as provided by this ordinance and shall require that backflow protection be installed on the service line to the premise g the administrative authority after reasonable notice to the property owner and lessee or occupant if applicable may discontinue the water service to any property wherein any condition in violation of the cross connection control requirements outlined in this ordinance or the minnesota plumbing known to exist and to take such other precautionary measures as it may deem necessary to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public water supply distribution mains water service to any property that has been disconnected from the public water supply shall not be restored until such conditions have been eliminated or corrected in compliance with this section and the reconnection charge identified in the fee schedule is paid to the city immediate disconnection with verbal notice can be affected when the administrative authority reasonably believes that imminent danger of harmful contamination of the public water supply exists such action shall be followed by written notification of the cause for disconnection immediate disconnection without notice to any party can be affected to prevent actual or anticipated contamination or pollution of the public water supply provided that in the opinion of the administrative authority or the minnesota department of health such action is required to prevent contamination or pollution of the public water supply neither the public water supply the administrative authority or its agents or assigns shall be liable to any customer for any injury damages or lost revenues which may result from termination of said customer water supply in accordance with the terms of this section whether or not said termination was with or without notice h any person who has knowledge of a backflow into any potable water system or to the public water system must report that backflow to the citys utility department immediately upon becoming aware of the backflow any person responsible for any substance that enters the potable water system or backsiphonage or contamination of the public water supply system occurs illegal crossconnection or an improperly installed maintained or repaired device or a device that has been bypassed must bear the cost of the cleanup of the potable water supply system subd 8 regulations governing nonessential water usage upon critical water deficiency as authorized by minn stat 103g291 subd 1 and 2 a this subd establishes water conservation restrictions  and the plan will be in effect at any time the governor declares by executive order a critical water deficiency pursuant to minnesota statutes section 103g291 b application 1 this rule applies to all entities including residential commercial industrial and institutional customers that acquire water from the city of red wings municipal water supply system who own or control water use on any premise 2 no person shall make cause use or permit the use of water received from a the city of red wing municipal water supply system for residential commercial industrial governmental or any other purpose in any manner contrary to any provision in this ordinance 3 mandatory emergency conservation measures shall be implemented based upon the declaration of a critical water emergency by the governor c declaration of critical water deficiency  upon the declaration of a critical water deficiency by the governor the public water supplier shall immediately post notice of the emergency declaration at the usual meeting place of the city council or the official city bulletin boards the city shall provide notification to the public as quickly as possible or water supply plans emergency response plans or procedures d mandatory emergency water conservation measures  upon declaration of a water emergency and notification to the public the following mandatory restrictions upon nonessential water use shall be enforced 1 outdoor irrigation of yards gardens golf courses parklands and other nonagricultural land except for those areas irrigated with reclaimed water is prohibited reclaimed water means water collected from rooftops paved surfaces or other collection devices and all water utilized more than once before reentering the natural water cycle 2 washing or spraying of sidewalks driveways parking areas tennis courts patios or other paved areas with water from any pressurized source including garden hoses except to alleviate immediate health or safety hazards is prohibited 3 the outdoor use of any waterbased play apparatus connected to a pressurized source is prohibited 4 restaurants and other food service establishments are prohibited from serving water to their customers unless water is specifically requested by the customer 5 operation of outdoor misting systems used to cool public areas is prohibited 6 the filling of swimming pools fountains spas or other exterior water features is prohibited 7 the washing of automobiles trucks trailers and other types of mobile equipment is prohibited except at facilities equipped with wash water recirculation systems and for vehicles requiring frequent washing to protect public health safety and welfare e variances  the council administrator or their designee is authorized to grant variances to this ordinance where strict application of its provisions would result in serious hardship to a customer a variance may be granted only for reasons involving health or safety an applicant may appeal the denial of a variance within five 5 days of the decision by submitting a written appeal to the city clerk the city council shall hear the appeal at the next city council meeting the decision of the city council is final f violation  violations shall be determined and cited by the council administrator or hisher designee a violator may appeal the citation within five 5 days of its issuance by submitting a written appeal to the city the city council shall hear the appeal at the next city council meeting the decision of the city council is final violators may be granted an administrative waiver if evidence is provided that equipment failure was the cause of the violation a letter from a qualified vendor or equipment invoice will be required to show proof of equipment failure 1 upon discovery of a first violation the violator shall be issued either personally or by mail a warning letter that sets forth the violation and which shall describe the remedy and fines for future violations 2 upon subsequent violations at the same location the violator shall be issued either personally or by mail a citation that sets forth the violation and shall describe the remedy 3 fines shall be invoiced or added to the monthly water bill of the owner or current occupant of the premises where the violation occurred the imposition of the fine shall in no way limit the right of the city to pursue other legal remedies g enforcement  the council administrator or hisher designee is authorized to designate city employees or law enforcement personnel to enforce the provisions of this ordinance h severability  if any provision of this ordinance or the application of any provision to a particular situation is held to be invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction the remaining portions of the ordinance and the application of the ordinance to any other situation shall not be invalidated special water connection charges in addition to water service and water installation costs whenever a connection is made to the public water supply system the property owner shall pay a special water connection charge in an amount determined from time to time by ordinance of the city council payment shall be made at the time the building permit is taken out whenever the use of a parcel intensifies from residential to commercial or industrial the special water connection charge shall be recalculated at the higher rate corresponding to the intensified use with credit for the previously assessed residential rate rules and regulations relating to sanitary sewerage service subd 1 for the purpose of providing funds to meet the cost of operating and maintaining the sewage disposal system and the facilities connected therewith the payment of capital charges represented by bonds certificates of indebtedness or otherwise and the payment of reasonable requirements of replacement and obsolescence thereof there is hereby charged levied and assessed upon each lot parcel of land building or premises having a connection with the sewerage system or otherwise discharging sewage industrial wastes water or other liquids directly or indirectly into the sewerage system and there is hereby charged against the consumer or customer sewer user charge determined and payable as hereinafter provided subd 2 the sewer user charge shall be determined by measuring by means of water meters or special sewer metering devices connected at each lot parcel of land building or premises the quantity of water used and applying the flow rate fee as set forth herein in this cases where the city requires the installation of suitable measuring sampling and analyzing devices to measure suspected high levels of bod ss or other pollutants an additional sewer use surcharge shall be made to cover the additional costs of treatment according to the rates set forth herein in this bod ss and other pollutants subd 3 in the event any lot parcel of land building or premises discharging sanitary sewage industrial wastes water or other liquids into the sanitary sewerage system either directly or indirectly is supplied in whole or in part with water not obtained from the city the consumer or customer shall cause to be installed at their own expense necessary metering equipment as approved by the public works department to measure the quantity of water pumped or used and the charge shall be based on the quantity of water so measured whenever the consumer or customer fails to install such metering equipment or where it is not practicable to measure the water consumed on any premises by a meter or meters the city shall cause to be determined in such manner and by such methods as may be practicable considering conditions and attendant circumstances in each case the estimated volume of water from private sources which discharge into the sanitary sewerage system and such estimate shall be used in lieu of the meter volume of water from private sources to determine the sewer user charge therefor subd 4 the city council shall annually determine and fix the unit costs for use of the sewerage system on the basis of flow including infiltrationinflow bod ss and any other pollutant taking into consideration the cost of treatment of such sewage and may increase or decrease such unit cost as often and in such amounts as may reasonably be required to accomplish the purposes of this subdivision subd 5 the city shall compute the amount due for charges and render a statement thereof at periodic intervals as directed by the city council to the consumer or customer all amounts due shall be payable to the city subd 6 the city finance department shall once each year provide an internal audit report that will address specific areas of concern including the need to generate sufficient revenue user charges to cover total operation and management costs the necessity of maintaining a proportionate system of sewer user charges pursuant to 40 federal rules regulations b the need to review the replacement account to determine its proper level of funding subd 7 property outside the city which is served by and uses the sewerage system shall pay the same amount of sewer user charge as set forth in the above unit costs for property inside the city additional costs may be applied for providing such service to properties outside the city if such extra costs are specifically related to serving those properties charges for sewer service to property outside the city which is served by a collection system maintained by another governmental subdivision shall be the subject of agreements between the city and such other governmental subdivision such agreement to be approved by the city council subd 8 the amounts due to the city for sewer user charges will be computed in accordance with the provisions of this statements will be rendered at the same time and on the same bill with other city services subd 9 nothing in this be held or construed as in any way prohibiting the citys right to levy taxes against any premises affected subd 10 any charges levied by and pursuant to this not paid and becoming delinquent may be recovered from the consumer customer or owner occupant of the premises served in a civil action by the city in any court of competent jurisdiction at the citys election subd 11 funds received from the charges herein established for the payment of bond principal and interest shall be transferred to the related debt retirement fund of the city subd 12 the costs to be recovered pursuant to this the unit cost to be fixed by the city council as defined hereinbefore except as otherwise provided herein shall be determined and allocated to cover operation and maintenance of the citys wastewater collection conveyance and treatment facilities this shall include the annual cost of administration operation and maintenance for the citys wastewater collection conveyance and treatment facilities including sludge disposal costs and shall be deposited in the sanitary sewer fund funds received for replacement costs of equipment and real property shall be deposited in the sanitary sewer replacement fund replacement costs shall be defined as expenditures for obtaining and installing equipment accessories or appurtenances which are necessary during the useful life of the treatment works to maintain the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed subd 13 monitored user charges for those users that the city requires installation of suitable measuring sampling and analyzing devices to measure bod ss or other pollutants the unit costs for flow bod ss or other pollutants shall be calculated by apportioning each cost to flow bod ss or other pollutants and then dividing each cost so apportioned by the total estimated flow bod ss or other pollutants to be received from the users at the wastewater treatment plant in that year a monitored user charges shall be the sum of the products obtained by multiplying the unit costs as determined above by the users actual flow volume in cubic feet bod per 100 pounds ss per 100 pounds or other pollutants during the billing period  however in no case shall the charge be less than that determined by applying the prevailing flow rate charge to the users actual flow volume measured in cubic feet b in addition to the sewer user charge set forth herein the city may impose a sewer user surcharge for other pollutants which require special treatment at any of the citys wastewater conveyance or treatment facilities the surcharge may consist of unit charges reimbursement of documented expenses or a combination thereof c the sewer user surcharge may also include the annual interest and principal cost necessary to retire any bonds issued to pay for construction to the sewage treatment facilities made necessary to provide special treatment with such debt retirement costs to be determined and allocated in the same manner as described for annual operation and maintenance costs subd 14 monitoring of strength and volume when required by the city a user shall install suitable measuring sampling and analyzing devices in compliance with this the city shall not require installation of such devices where the city determines that such user has concentrations of bod and suspended solids no greater than the concentration of such constituents in the general municipal flow and a satisfactory method and access exist for sampling and determining the total daily sewage flow in such cases the charges to those users shall be based on the flow rate as determined and on bod and ss loads equal to the average load of the general municipal flow b each user required by the city to install and maintain sewerage monitoring facilities shall submit to the city a monthly report of flow bod and ss or other pollutants on a form approved by the city this report shall be used for billing purposes and shall be submitted prior to the 15th day of the subsequent month c the city shall have the right to periodically or continuously inspect the monitoring facilities to measure sample and analyze the monitored users flow and to analyze the samples obtained by the monitored user d in the event of any discrepancy between the flows or loads determined by the city and the monitored user the values determined by the city shall be used for billing purposes e all measurements tests and analysis of the characteristics of sewage concentration shall be determined in accordance with procedures established by united states environmental protection agency in 40 federal regulations or the latest edition of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater published by the american public health association and shall be determined at the control manhole provided or upon suitable samples taken at said manhole in the event that no special manhole is available the control manhole shall be considered to be the nearest downstream manhole in the public sewer to the point at which the building sewer is connected f a 24hour composite sample of the sewage shall be taken by the city at least twice each year on those customers being assessed a surcharge additional sampling by the city will be taken upon written request by the user with onehalf of the cost of said sampling to be borne by the user subd 15 charges for nonmonitored users the charge for non monitored users for this be set by determining the total annual cost of the operation and maintenance of the system and subtracting therefrom the total fees collected from other municipalities contract users and monitored users which are applied to such costs the balance remaining divided by the total annual estimated volume of wastewater less the estimated volume for municipalities contract users and monitored users shall be the unit cost per volume of wastewater a the charges to nonmonitored users shall be the product of the unit cost obtained in accordance with this subdivision and the quantity of water used by such user as measured by the city water meter on the premises  provided however that in determining the charge to be paid for premises used exclusively for residential purposes the water meter readings from the first quarter of each year may be used as the basis for the computation of such user charges for each billing period for that year b in the event a nonmonitored user is not supplied with city water or the water so used is not measured the user charge shall be fixed and determined by the city in such methods as it may find just equitable and practicable c in the event sewer service is disconnected by the city during any quarter for any reason the sewer service charge shall be reduced proportionately in the same manner that water service rates are reduced d if a substantial portion of the water utilized by any user is not discharged into the sewerage system the volume of water shall be deducted in computing the sewer use charge provided a separate meter is installed to measure each volume the user desiring to install such separate meter shall make application and payment for the meter to the city and engage at his own expense a plumber to effect the necessary piping changes and install the couplings so the meter can be serviced subd 16 availability charge administrative costs insurance and contingencies shall be recovered by an availability charge which shall be computed in the following manner the total cost of administrative expenses insurance contingencies and other fixed costs as may be determined by city council are to be divided by the number of users and the resulting figure would be the availability costs charged to each user having a service connection subd 17 expenses all expenses relating to installation repair or maintenance of lateral sewer service lines shall be paid by the applicant for such improvements and services controls on use of public sewers and pretreatment of industrial wastewater subd 1 general provisions a purpose and policy this forth uniform requirements for discharges into the wastewater disposal system and enables the city to comply with all state and federal laws b the objectives of this 1 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the wastewater disposal system which will interfere with the operation of the system or the use or disposal of the sludge  2 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the wastewater disposal system which will pass system inadequately treated into receiving waters or the atmosphere or otherwise be incompatible with the system  and 3 to improve the opportunity to recycle and reclaim wastewater and sludge from the system c this for the regulation of discharges into the wastewater disposal system issuance of permits to certain users and of the general requirements for the other users authorizes monitoring and enforcement activities requires user reporting and provides for the setting of fees for the equitable distribution of costs resulting from the program established herein d this apply to the city and to persons outside the city who are by contract or agreement with the city users of the wastewater disposal system that wastewater system includes all structure connections and processes used in the treatment of municipal sanitary and industrial wastewater this also applicable to the bench street industrial wwtp which is an integral component of the wastewater disposal system subd 2 definitions related to pretreatment the following terms as used in this shall have the meanings hereinafter designated 1 clean water act  the federal water pollution control act as amended 33 usc 125 et seq 2 bench street wastewater pretreatment facility  an industrial wastewater treatment works located at 1877 bench street owned and operated by the city whose purpose is to treat industrial wastewater before that waste is pumped into the general collection system for transport and further treatment this facility is considered a part of the wastewater disposal system 3 directorsuperintendent  the directorsuperintendent of wastewater disposal systemof water pollution controlof public works or the persons duly authorized representative 4 industrial user  a person who discharges to the wastewater disposal system liquid wastes resulting from the processes employed in industrial manufacturing trade or business establishments or from the development of any natural resource 5 interference  the inhibition or disruption of the wastewater disposal system processes or operations which causes or significantly contributes to a violation of any requirement of the citys npdes or state disposal system permit the term includes prevention of sewage sludge use or disposal by the city in accordance with published regulations providing guidelines under of the clean water act 33 usc 1251 et seq or any regulations developed pursuant to the solid waste disposal act the clean air act the toxic substances control act or more stringent state criteria applicable to the method of disposal or use employed by the city 6 national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permit  any permit or requirements issued by the minnesota pollution control agency mpca pursuant to the federal water pollution control act as amended 33 usc 1251 et seq  for the purpose of regulating the discharge of sewage industrial wastes or other wastes under the authority of of the clean water act 7 non contact cooling water  the water discharged from any use such as air conditioning cooling or refrigeration or during which the only pollutant added to the water is heat 8 ph  the logarithm of the reciprocal of the concentration of hydrogen ions in grams per liter of solution 9 pretreatment  the process of reducing the amount of pollutants eliminating pollutants or altering the nature of pollutant properties in wastewater to a less harmful state prior to or in lieu of discharging or otherwise introducing such pollutants into the wastewater disposal system the reduction elimination or alteration may be obtained by physical chemical or biological processes process changes or other means except as prohibited by this significant industrial user  any industrial user of the wastewater disposal system which i has a discharge flow of 25000 gallons or more per average work day or ii has a flow greater than five percent of the flow in the wastewater disposal system or iii has in its wastes toxic pollutants as defined pursuant to of the clean water act or minnesota statutes and rules or iv has a significant impact either singly or in combination with other contributing industries on the wastewater disposal system the quality of sludge the systems effluent quality or air emissions generated by the system 11 state disposal system permit  any permit including any terms conditions and requirements thereof issued by the mpca pursuant to minnesota statutes for a disposal system as defined by minnesota statutes subd 8 12 stormwater  any flow occurring during or following any form of natural precipitation and resulting therefrom 13 user  any person who discharges causes or permits the discharge of wastewater into the wastewater disposal system 14 wastewater  the liquid and watercarried industrial or domestic wastes from dwellings commercial buildings industrial facilities and institutions together with any groundwater surface water and stormwater that may be present whether treated or untreated which is discharged into or permitted to enter the wastewater disposal system 15 wastewater disposal system or system  any devices facilities structures equipment or works owned or used by the city for the purpose of the transmission storage treatment recycling and reclamation of industrial and domestic wastewater or necessary to recycle or reuse water including intercepting sewers outfall sewers sewage collection systems pumping power and other equipment and their appurtenances  extensions improvements remodeling additions and alterations thereof  elements essential to provide a reliable recycled water supply such as standby treatment units and clear well facilities  and any works including land that will be an integral part of the treatment process or is used for ultimate disposal of residues resulting from such treatment 16 waters of the state  all streams lakes ponds marshes aquifers irrigation systems drainage systems and all other bodies or accumulations of water surface or underground natural or artificial public or private which are contained within flow border upon the state or any portion thereof 17 best management practices bmps  activities prohibition of practices maintenance procedures and other management practices that reduce the discharge of fat oil and grease fog to the wastewater disposal system 18 fog  acronym for fats oils and grease these include any substance such as a vegetable or animal product that is used in or is a byproduct of the cooking or food preparation process and that turns or may turn viscous or solidify with a change in temperature or as a result of the conditions found in a sanitary sewer 19 fog control program manager  the individual designated by the director of public works to administer the fog control program the fog control program manager is responsible for all determinations of compliance with the program including approval of discretionary variances and waivers 20 food service establishment fse  all food service facilities including but not limited to fullservice restaurants fast food establishments delicatessens cafeterias school cafeterias church kitchens hospitals and medical facilities boarding houses clubhouses adult daycare facilities assisted living facilities convalescent homes meat distributors and processing facilities food processing facilities grocery stores with food preparationservice areas bakeries caterers andor other similar types of operations with commercial kitchen equipment 21 fse grease control responsible party  the entity named on the sewer account for the fse 22 grease interceptor a device designed to separate and retain fog from normal wastes while permitting sewage or liquid wastes to discharge into the drainage system 23 gravity grease interceptor  grease interceptor identified by volume detention time and gravity separation for purposes of this ordinance a gravity grease inceptor shall have a minimum volume of 1000 gallons minimum 2compartment tank and typically located underground usually outside of a building that reduces the amount of fog in wastewater prior to its discharge into the sewer 24 hydromechanical grease interceptor  a grease inceptor that ncorporates air entrainment hydromechanical separation interior baffling andfor barriers in combination or separately for purposes of this ordinance a hydromechanical grease interceptor is a small grease capturing device usually located within a building 25 nonroutine inspection  impromptu unscheduled inspection of an fse made without prior notification or arrangement 26 routine inspection  inspection of an fse which is scheduled in advance or according to a prearranged schedule 27 terms not otherwise defined shall be as given in minnesota statutes chapters 115 and 116 as amended subd 3 regulations and effluent limitations a general discharge prohibitions no user shall discharge or cause to be discharged directly or indirectly any of the following substances into the wastewater disposal system or to any public sewer 1 any liquids solids or gases which by reason of their nature or quantity are or may be sufficient either alone or by interaction with other substances to cause fire or explosion or be injurious in any other way to the wastewater disposal system or to the operation of the system at no time shall waste streams with a closed cup flashpoint of less than 140 degrees fahrenheit or 60 degrees centigrade be introduced into the wastewater disposal system prohibited materials include but are not limited to gasoline kerosene naphtha benzene toluene xylene ethers alcohols ketones aldehydes peroxides chlorates perchlorates bromates carbides hydrides and sulfides 2 solid or viscous substances which will or may cause obstruction to the flow in a sewer or other interference with the operation of the wastewater treatment facilities such as but not limited to grease garbage with particles greater than onehalf inch in any dimension animal guts or tissues paunch manure bones hair hides or fleshings entrails whole blood feathers ashes cinders sand spent lime stone or marble dust metal glass straw shavings grass clippings rags spent grains spent hops waste paper wood plastic gas tar asphalt residues residues from refining or processing of fuel or lubricating oil mud or glass grinding or polishing wastes 3 any wastewater having a ph less than 60 or more than 90 or having any other corrosive property capable of causing damage or hazard to structures equipment and personnel of the wastewater disposal system 4 any wastewater containing toxic pollutants in sufficient quantity either singly or by interaction with other pollutants to inhibit or disrupt any wastewater treatment process constitute a hazard to humans or animals or create a toxic effect in the receiving waters of the wastewater disposal system a toxic pollutant shall include but not be limited to any pollutant identified pursuant to a of the clean water act prescription drugs and other overthe counter pharmaceuticals shall be considered toxic pollutants 5 any noxious or malodorous liquids gases or solids which either singly or by interaction with other wastes are capable of creating a public nuisance or hazard to life or are sufficient to prevent entry into the sewers for their maintenance and repair 6 any wastewater with objectionable color not removed in the treatment process such as but not limited to dye wastes and vegetable tanning solutions 7 any wastewater which creates conditions at or near the wastewater disposal system which violate any statute or any rule regulation or ordinance of any public agency or state or federal regulatory body 8 any wastewater having a temperature greater than 150f 656c or causing individually or in combination with other wastewater the influent at the wastewater treatment plant to have a temperature exceeding 104f 40c 9 any slug load which shall mean any pollutant including oxygen demanding pollutants released in a discharge of such volume or strength as to cause inhibition or disruption in the wastewater disposal system in no case shall a slug load have a flow rate or contain concentrations or quantities of pollutants that exceed for any time period longer than 15 minutes more than 5 times the average 24 hour concentrations quantities or flow of the user during normal operation 10 noncontact cooling water or unpolluted storm or groundwater 11 any wastewater containing fats wax grease or oils whether emulsified or not in excess of +150 mgi or containing substances which may solidify or become viscous at temperatures between 32f and 150f 0c and 656c  and any wastewater containing oil and grease concentrations of mineral origin of greater than +100 mgi whether emulsified or not introduction of any additives into the wastewater disposal system for the purpose of emulsifying fog or biologically or chemically treating any substance introduced into any wastewater facility for purpose of treatment or pretreatment of wastewater unless a specific written authorization by the fog control program manager is obtained discharge of any fog or any other solid materials removed from the grease control device to the wastewater disposal system 12 wastewater containing inert suspended solids such as but not limited to fullers earth lime slurries and lime residues or of dissolved solids such as but not limited to sodium chloride and sodium sulfate in such quantities that they would cause disruption with the wastewater disposal system 13 any wastewater following pretreatment or directly discharged containing the following described elements in concentrations greater than those included in the following list maximum daily concentrations cd 020 mgi cr 280 mgi cu 338 mgi pb 040 mgi hg 010 mgi ni 298 mgi ag 043 mgi zn 261 mgi all discharge shall comply with the above limits unless the city has applied for a pollutant removal credit or exception and a pollutant removal credit or exception has been granted to a user or category of users that permits discharge in excess of the maximum daily limits referenced in this subdivision this exception shall only apply so long as the removal credit remains valid and only so long as the discharge subject to the pollution removal credit or exception does not interfere with the operation of the system or pass system inadequately treated contrary to the purpose statement in subdivision 1b of this in addition to these prohibitions no user shall discharge to any public sewer any discharge which causes interference as defined with the wastewater disposal system pollutants in the effluent from an industrial user shall not be considered to cause interference where the industrial user is in compliance with specific prohibitions or standards developed by federal state or local governments where the industrial user is in compliance with such specific prohibitions or standards and pollutants in the effluent from the industrial users facility nevertheless are determined to have caused or significantly contributed to a violation of any requirement of the citys npdes or state disposal system permit and are likely to cause such a violation in the future the city must take appropriate action to develop and enforce specific effluent limits for that industrial user to ensure renewed and continued compliance with the citys npdes or state disposal system permit c it is unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the city limits or city jurisdiction any sewage or other polluted waters except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of this it is unlawful to either construct maintain use or permit to be used any cesspool privy or privy vault on any part of any lot or parcel of land in the city abutting both on a public sanitary sewer and a water main with which water and sewer connections may be made if said privy privy vault or cesspool be within 500 feet of said public sanitary sewer and also within 500 feet of said water mains the city shall have power whenever there is both a public sewer and a water main in the public highways or grounds upon which any premises in the city abuts to cause the owner or occupant of such parcel of land to connect said premises with said public sewer by sufficient sanitary sewer whenever in the citys opinion the same may be necessary for the preservation of the public health the city shall serve upon such owner or occupant ten days notice in writing specifying the time when such sewer connection or connections must be made and completed and if the said owner or occupant neglects to complete the same within the time specified in addition to the penalties imposed for a violation of any of the provisions of this the city may cause it to be done and shall either recover the whole amount of the expense thereof by an action against the owner in the name of the city before any court having jurisdiction thereof or assess the same against said premises pursuant to minnesota state statutes nothing in this be interpreted to require the service of sewage wastes at published sewer rates when such waste may impair the sewer or cause a higherthannormal expense in operation of the sewerage system nor shall this interpreted to prohibit the handling of deleterious wastes requirements for pretreatment or sewer service rates higher than published rates on an agreement basis such agreements may be approved by the city after considering the problems in handling the effect on the sewerage system and the cost of handling the waste e new connections to the citys sewer system may be restricted andor not allowed in the event that such connection would increase flows andor loads above available capacity existing in either the collection or treatment system f duly authorized city employees bearing proper identification shall at reasonable times be permitted to enter upon properties served by sanitary sewers for the purpose of inspection measurement sampling and testing in connection with operation of the sewer system g persons engaged in construction or maintenance activity where there is connection to or danger of damage to the sewer system shall exercise particular care to protect the sewer system and shall at all times protect keep foreign materials out and accomplish construction or connections in a neat and workmanlike manner failure to do so shall be a violation of this shall not stop the city from correcting the damage or removing the foreign material if necessary on an overtime basis and collecting the costs therefor for other than immediate necessary repair or removal a fiveday written notice shall be deemed adequate notice to the party to repair damage correct faulty construction or remove material from the sewerage system h roof groundwater or surface drain connections to the sanitary sewer system are prohibited all sewer service connections shall be constructed in accordance with requirements of the minnesota plumbing effect at the time of construction and such work shall only be done by a contractor licensed to perform such connection prior to construction of any sewer connection the proper permit shall be obtained from the building official subd 4 limitations on wastewater strength a national categorical pretreatment standards national categorical pretreatment standards promulgated by the us environmental protection agency epa pursuant to the clean water act shall be met by all users which are subject to such standards in any instance where they are more stringent than the limitations in this the director has applied for and obtained from the mpca approval to modify the specific limits in the national categorical pretreatment standards when requested an application for modification of the national categorical pretreatment standards will be considered for submittal by the director when the wastewater treatment system achieves consistent removal of the pollutants consistent removal shall be defined as in 40 cfr 4037 a 1 of the general pretreatment regulations for existing and new sources of pollution conditional revisions of national categorical pretreatment standards may be made by the city in accordance with 4037 b 2 iiv of the general pretreatment regulations for existing and new sources of pollution if requested by the industryies in accordance with requirements of 4037 b 1 i b state requirements state requirements and limitations on discharges shall be met by all users which are subject to such standards in any instance in which they are more stringent than federal requirements and limitations or those in the city right of revision the city reserves the right to establish more stringent limitations or requirements on discharges to the wastewater disposal system if deemed necessary to comply with the objectives of this dilution no user shall increase the use of process water or in any way attempt to dilute a discharge as a partial or complete substitute for adequate treatment to achieve compliance with the limitations in this in the national categorical pretreatment standards or in any state requirements e accidental discharges each user shall provide protection from accidental discharge of prohibited materials or other substances regulated by this necessary facilities to prevent accidental discharge of prohibited materials shall be provided and maintained at the owner or users own cost and expense detailed plans showing facilities and operating procedures to provide this protection shall be submitted to the director for review and shall be approved by the director before construction of the facility review and approval of such plans and operating procedures shall not relieve the industrial user from the responsibility to modify the users facility as necessary to meet the requirements of this shall notify the director immediately upon having a slug or accidental discharge of substances or wastewater in violation of this order to enable countermeasures to be taken by the director to minimize damage to the wastewater disposal system and the receiving waters such notification will not relieve users of liability for any expense loss or damage to the wastewater disposal system or treatment process or for any fines imposed on the city on account thereof under any state or federal law a notice shall be permanently posted on the users bulletin board or other prominent place advising new employees whom to call in the event of a slug or accidental discharge employers shall insure that all employees who may cause or discover such a discharge are advised of the emergency notification procedure subd 5 fees a purpose it is the purpose of this provide for the recovery of costs from users of the wastewater disposal system for the implementation of the program established herein the applicable charges or fees shall be set forth in the schedule of charges and fees to be prepared from time to time by the director and approved by the city council b charges and fees the city council shall adopt charges and fees which may include 1 fees for monitoring inspections and surveillance procedures  2 fees for permit applications  3 appeal fees  and 4 other fees as the director may deem necessary to carry out the requirements contained in this  administrationgeneral user reports the director may require that any person discharging or proposing to discharge wastewater to the wastewater disposal system file a period discharge report the discharge report may include but not be limited to nature of process rates of flow mass discharge rate raw material and production quantities hours of operation number and classification of employees compliance status with any state or federal pretreatment standards or other information which relates to the generation of waste including wastewater constituents and concentrations in the wastewater discharge such reports may also include sludge disposal practices and the chemical constituents and quantity of liquid or gaseous materials stored on site even though they may not normally be discharged at a minimum a summary of such data indicating each industrial users compliance with this be prepared quarterly and submitted to the director in addition to discharge reports the director may require information in the form of wastewater discharge permit applications selfmonitoring reports and compliance schedules subd 7 wastewater discharge permits a mandatory permits all industries proposing to connect or to commence a new discharge to the wastewater disposal system shall obtain a wastewater disposal permit before connecting to or discharging into the wastewater disposal system if the discharge would result in the industry being classified as a significant industrial user all existing significant industrial users or industrial users subject to national categorical pretreatment standards under b and c of the clean water act connected to or discharging into the wastewater disposal system shall obtain a wastewater discharge permit within 180 days after the effective date of this permit application users required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit shall complete and file with the director an application in the form prescribed by the director and accompanied by the applicable fee users shall apply at least 180 days prior to connecting or discharging to the wastewater disposal system in support of the application the user shall submit in units and terms appropriate for evaluation the following information 1 name address and location if different from the address 2 sic number according to the standard industrial classification manual bureau of the budget 197 as amended 3 wastewater constituents and characteristics including but not limited to those governed by subdivisions 3 and 4 of this determined by a reliable analytical laboratory  sampling and analysis shall be performed in accordance with procedures established by the epa pursuant to g of the clean water act and contained in 40 cfr as amended 4 time and duration of discharge 5 average daily and 30minute peak wastewater flow rates including daily monthly and seasonal variations if any 6 site plans floor plans mechanical and plumbing plans and details to show all sewers sewer connections and appurtenances by the size location and elevation 7 description of activities facilities and plant processes on the premises including all materials which are or could be discharged including sludges floats skimmings etc 8 where known the nature and concentration of any pollutants in the discharge which are limited by any city state or national categorical pretreatment standards and for an existing discharge a statement regarding whether or not the pretreatment standards are being met on a consistent basis and if not whether additional operation and maintenance andor additional pretreatment is required for the user to meet applicable pretreatment standards if additional operation and maintenance andor pretreatment will be required a proposed schedule by which the changes will be completed shall be submitted the completion date in this schedule shall not be later than the compliance date established for the applicable pretreatment standard the schedule shall contain increments of progress in the form of dates for the commencement and completion of major events leading to the construction and operation of additional pretreatment required for the user to meet the applicable pretreatment standard no increment shall exceed nine months in length and progress reports concerning each increment shall be submitted within 14 days following each increment date 9 each product produced by type amount and rate of production 10 type and amount of raw materials processed average and maximum per day 11 number of full and parttime employees and hours of work 12 any other information as may be deemed by the director to be necessary to evaluate the permit application c the director will evaluate the data furnished by the user and may require additional information after evaluation and acceptance of the data furnished the director may issue a wastewater discharge permit subject to terms and conditions provided herein d permit conditions wastewater discharge permits shall be expressly subject to all provisions of this all other applicable regulations user charges and fees permit may contain the following 1 the unit charge or schedule of user charges and fees for the wastewater to be discharged to the wastewater disposal system 2 limits on the average and maximum wastewater constituents and characteristics 3 limits on average and maximum rates and time of discharge or requirements for flow regulation and equalization 4 requirements for installation and maintenance of inspection and sampling facilities 5 requirements for installation operation and maintenance of pretreatment facilities 6 specifications for monitoring programs which may include sampling locations frequency and method of sampling number types and standards for tests and reporting schedule 7 compliance schedules 8 requirements for submission of technical reports or discharge reports 9 requirements for maintaining and retaining plant records relating to wastewater discharge as specified by the director but in no case less than three years and affording director access thereto 10 requirements for notification to and acceptance by the director of any new introduction of wastewater constituents or of any substantial change in the volume or character of the wastewater constituents being introduced into the wastewater treatment system 11 requirements for notification of slug or accidental discharges as provided in this reporting of permit violations 12 requirements for disposal of sludges floats skimmings etc 13 other conditions as deemed appropriate by the city to ensure compliance with this permit duration permit shall be issued for a specified time period not to exceed 5 years the user shall apply for permit reissuance a minimum of 180 days prior to the expiration of the users existing permit the terms and conditions of the permit may be subject to modification by the director during the term of the permit as limitations or requirements as stated in this modified or other just cause exists the user shall be informed of any proposed changes in his permit at least 30 days prior to the effective date of change any changes or new conditions in the permit shall include a reasonable time schedule for compliance f permit modifications within nine months of the promulgation of a national categorical pretreatment standard the wastewater discharge permit of users subject to such standard shall be revised to require compliance with such standard within the time frame prescribed by such standard where a user subject to a national categorical pretreatment standard has not previously submitted an application for a wastewater discharge permit as required by this the user shall apply for a wastewater discharge permit within 180 days after the promulgation of the applicable national categorical pretreatment standard in addition the user with an existing wastewater discharge permit shall submit to the director within 180 days after the promulgation of an applicable national categorical pretreatment standard the information required by this the information previously submitted in an application is still current and adequate only a letter from the user certifying such is required g permit transfer wastewater discharge permits are issued to a specific user for a specific operation a wastewater discharge permit shall not be reassigned or transferred or sold to a new owner new user different premises or a new or changed operation without the approval of the director any succeeding owner or user shall also comply with the terms and conditions of the existing permit h monitoring facilities monitoring facilities to allow inspection sampling and flow measurement of the building sewer andor internal drainage systems shall be provided and operated by users where the city determines that monitoring is necessary due to the content andor amount of flow being placed into the system by the user the monitoring facility should normally be situated on the users premises but the director may when such a location would be impractical or cause undue hardship on the user allow the facility to be constructed in the public street or sidewalk area and located so that it will not be obstructed by landscaping or parked vehicles there shall be ample room in or near such sampling manhole or facility to allow accurate sampling and compositing of samples for analysis the facility and sampling and measuring equipment shall be maintained at all times in a safe and proper operating condition at the expense of the user whether constructed on public or private property the sampling and monitoring facilities shall be
