moral character or repute subd 9 renewal of licenses applications for renewal of all licenses under this be made at least 60 days prior to the date of expiration of the license a current within the last twelve months fire inspection report completed by the red wing fire department indicating compliance with all relevant fire codes and regulations shall also accompany the renewal application the city clerk may waive the 60day requirement for good and sufficient cause shown subd 10 delinquent taxes and charges no license under this be granted for operation on any premises upon which taxes assessments or installments thereof or other financial claims of the city are owed and are delinquent and unpaid subd 11 conditional licenses the council may upon a finding of the necessity therefor place such special conditions and restrictions in addition to those stated in this upon any license as it in its discretion may deem reasonable and justified  premises licensed subd 1 validity unless expressly stated therein a license issued under the provisions of this be valid only in the building or structure situated on the premises described in the license and all transactions relating to a sale under such license must take place within such building or structure subd 2 conduct except as herein provided every licensee under this be responsible for the conduct of the licensed place of business and shall maintain conditions of sobriety and order therein subd 3 sellerserver training every licensee under this chapter shall be responsible for providing that the sale or service of liquor or wine upon the licensed premises shall be conducted only be persons having a verification of successful completion of a responsible sellerserver training course on file with the city clerk subd 4 sale by employee any sale of alcoholic beverages in or from any premises licensed under this any employee authorized to make such sale in or from such place is the act of the employer as well as of the person actually making the sale  and every such employer is liable for all of the penalties provided by law for such sale equally with the person actually making the sale subd 5 inspection a all premises licensed under this at all reasonable hours be open to inspection by any police officer to determine whether or not this all other laws are being observed this inspection may include the premises and any books papers and records pertaining to the licensed business all persons as a condition to being issued such license consent to such inspection by such officers without a warrant for searches or seizures b it is unlawful for any licensee or agent or employee of a licensee to hinder or prevent a police officer from making such inspection failure to comply with inspection when requested by a police officer may result in revocation of the license requirements of licensee subd 1 financial responsibility  no beer wine or liquor license shall be issued or renewed unless and until the applicant has provided proof of financial responsibility imposed by statute by filing with the city a certificate that there is in effect an insurance policy or pool providing minimum coverages of 1 $50000 because of bodily injury to any one person in any one occurrence and  subject to the limit for one person in the amount of $100000 because of bodily injury to two or more persons in any one occurrence  and in the amount of $10000 because of injury to or destruction of property of others in any one occurrence  and 2 $50000 for loss of means of support of any one person in any one occurrence and subject to the limit for one person $100000 for loss of means of support of two or more persons in any one occurrence  $50000 for other pecuniary loss of any one person and any one occurrence and $100000 for other pecuniary loss of two or more persons in any one occurrence  an annual aggregate of $300000 may be included in the insurance coverage a exception this section does not apply to onsale beer licensees with sales of beer of less than $25000 for the preceding year nor to offsale beer licensees with sales of beer of less than $50000 for the preceding year nor does it apply to holders of onsale wine licenses with sales of wine of less than $25000 for the preceding year an affidavit of the licensee shall be required to establish the exemption under this subdivision b documents submitted to commissioner all proofs of financial responsibility and exemption affidavits filed with the city under this section shall be submitted by the city to the minnesota commissioner of public safety subd 2 insurance certificate  whenever an insurance certificate is required by this applicant shall file with the city clerk a certificate of insurance showing 1 that the limits are at least as high as required 2 that coverage is effective for at least the license term approved and 3 that such insurance will not be cancelled or terminated without 30 days written notice served upon the city clerk cancellation or termination of such coverage shall be grounds for license revocation unlawful acts subd 1 licensed premises a consumption it is unlawful for any person to consume or any licensee to permit consumption of alcoholic beverages on licensed premises more than 20 minutes after the legal time for making licensed sales b removal of containers  it is unlawful for any onsale licensee to permit any glass bottle or other container containing alcoholic beverages in any quantity to remain upon any table bar stool or other place where customers are served more than 20 minutes after the legal time for making licensed sales c closing  it is unlawful for any person other than an onsale licensees bona fide employee actually engaged in the performance of his duties to be on the premises licensed under this than 30 minutes after the legal time for making licensed sales subd 2 underage persons a consumption it is unlawful for any 1 licensee to permit any underage person to consume alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises 2 underage person to consume alcoholic beverages except in the household of the minors parent or guardian and then only with the consent and in the presence of the parent or guardian b purchasing  it is unlawful for any 1 person to sell barter furnish or give alcoholic beverages to an underage person unless such person is the parent or guardian of the underage person and then only for consumption in the household and in the presence of the parent or guardian 2 underage person to purchase or attempt to purchase any alcoholic beverage  3 person to induce an underage person to purchase or procure any alcoholic beverage c possession it is unlawful for an underage person to possess any alcoholic beverage with the intent to consume it at a place other than the household of the persons parent or guardian possession of an alcoholic beverage by an underage person at a place other than the household of the parent or guardian is prima facie evidence of intent to consume it at a place other than the household of a parent or guardian  d entering licensed premises  it is unlawful for any underage person to enter licensed premises for the purpose of purchasing or consuming any alcoholic beverage it is not unlawful for any person who has attained the age of 18 years to enter licensed premises for the following purposes 1 to perform work for the establishment  including the serving of alcoholic beverages unless otherwise prohibited by statute  2 to consume meals  and 3 to attend social functions that are held in a portion of the establishment where liquor is not sold it is unlawful for a licensee to permit a person under the age of 18 years to enter licensed premises unless attending a social event at which alcoholic beverages are not served  or in the company of a parent or guardian  e misrepresentation of age  it is unlawful for a minor to make a misrepresentation of age for the purpose of purchasing an alcoholic beverage  f proof of age proof of age for purchasing or consuming alcoholic beverages may be established only by a valid drivers license a minnesota identification card or in the case of a foreign national by a valid passport g license inspection license inspectors or persons as designated by the city are authorized to conduct periodic inspections of the premises of liquor license holders to assure compliance with the city state law licensees shall be responsible for the conduct of their employees  agents and representatives while on the licensed premises fines for noncompliance may be issued for violations  any fine is subject to appeal to the city council subd 3 alcoholic beverages it is unlawful for any a person to knowingly induce another to make an illegal sale or purchase of an alcoholic beverage b licensee to sell or serve an alcoholic beverage to any person who is obviously intoxicated c licensee to fail where reasonable doubt of legal age could exist to require adequate proof of age of a person upon licensed premises  d licensee to sell an alcoholic beverage on any day or during any hour when such sales are not permitted by law e licensee to allow consumption of an alcoholic beverage on licensed premises on any day or during any hour when such consumption is not permitted by law f person to purchase an alcoholic beverage on any day or during any hour when such sales are not permitted by law subd 4 alcoholic beverages in certain buildings and grounds it is unlawful for any person to introduce or possess upon or in any school ground or building any alcoholic beverage except for experiments in laboratories authorized by school personnel and except for those organizations which have been issued temporary licenses to sell beer and for any person to possess beer as a result of a purchase from those organizations holding temporary licenses subd 5 consumption and possession of alcoholic beverages on streets public property and city parks a it is unlawful for any person to consume or possess in an unsealed container alcoholic beverages on any street or other public property except when and where permission has been specifically granted or licensed by the council provided that between sunrise and  pm of each day if the parks are otherwise open to use the possession and consumption of alcoholic beverages shall be allowed unless otherwise posted  this subparagraph a shall not apply to the consumption of alcoholic beverages at the athletic field and colvill park courtyard during events scheduled with approval of the city council and which are not school events b this section shall not apply to the possession of an unsealed container in a motor vehicle on streets or public property when the container is kept in the trunk of such vehicle if it is equipped with a trunk or kept in some other area of the vehicle not normally occupied by the driver or passengers if that motor vehicle is not equipped with a trunk for the purpose of this section a utility or glove compartment shall be deemed to be within the area occupied by the driver or passengers subd 6 nudity or obscenity a definitions as used in this section the following words and terms shall have the meanings stated 1 nudity  the showing of the human male or female genitals pubic area or buttocks with less than a fully opaque covering  the showing of the female breast with less than a fully opaque covering of any part of the nipple  the exposure of any device costume or covering which gives the appearance of or simulates the genitals pubic hair natal cleft perineum anal region or pubic hair region  or the exposure of any device worn as a cover over the nipples andor areola of the female breast which device simulates and gives the realistic appearance of nipples andor areola 2 obscene performance  a play motion picture dance show or other presentation whether pictured animated or live performed before an audience and which in whole or in part depicts or reveals nudity sexual conduct sexual excitement or sadomasochistic abuse or which includes obscenities or explicit verbal descriptions or narrative accounts of sexual conduct 3 obscenities  those those slang words generally rejected for regular use in society that are used to refer to genitals  female breasts sexual conduct or excretory functions or products either that have no other meaning or that in context are clearly used for their bodily sexual or excretory meaning b unlawful act it is unlawful for any person issued a license provided for in this permit upon licensed premises any nudity obscene performance or continued use of obscenities by any agent employee patron or other person subd 7 ultimate fighting a purpose  ultimate fighting is regulated in b unlawful act no licensee shall permit promote or allow participation in ultimate fighting in any licensed establishment or any adjoining property owned or leased by the licensee  c violations  penalties  the penalties provided in this including but not limited to those set forth in subd 4e and apply to violations of this 06 social host subd 1 purpose and findings  the city council intends to discourage underage possession and consumption of alcohol even if done within the confines of a private residence and intends to hold persons criminally responsible who host events or gatherings where underage persons possess or consume alcohol regardless of whether the person hosting the event or gathering supplied the alcohol the city council finds that a events and gatherings held on private or public property where alcohol is possessed or consumed by underage persons are harmful to those persons and constitute a potential threat to public health requiring prevention or abatement b prohibiting underage consumption acts to protect underage persons as well as the general public from injuries related to alcohol consumption such as alcohol overdose or alcoholrelated traffic collisions c alcohol is an addictive drug which if used irresponsibly could have drastic effects on those who use it as well as those who are affected by the actions of an irresponsible user d often events or gatherings involving underage possession and consumption occur outside the presence of parents  however there are times when the parents isare present and condone the activity and in some circumstances provide the alcohol e even though giving or furnishing alcohol to an underage person is a crime it is difficult to prove and an ordinance is necessary to help further combat underage consumption  f a deterrent effect will be created by holding a person criminally responsible for hosting an event or gathering where underage possession or consumption occurs  subd 2 authority this section is enacted pursuant to minnesota statutes subd 3 definitions for the purpose of this section the following terms as used in this section shall have the meanings stated 1 event or gathering  any group of three or more persons who have assembled or gathered together for a social occasion or other activity 2 host  to aid conduct allow entertain organize supervise control or permit a gathering or event 3 parent  any person having legal custody of a juvenile a as natural adoptive parent or stepparent  b as a legal guardian  or c as a person to whom legal custody has been given by order of the court 4 person  any individual partnership copartnership corporation or any association of one or more individuals 5 residence or premises  any home yard farm field land apartment condominium hotel or motel room or other dwelling unit or a hall or meeting room park or any other place of assembly public or private whether occupied on a temporary or permanent basis whether occupied as a dwelling or specifically for a party or other social function and whether owned  leased rented or used with or without permission or compensation subd 4 prohibited acts a it is unlawful for any persons to  1 host or allow an event or gathering  2 at any residence premises or on any other private or public property  3 where alcohol or alcoholic beverages are present  4 when the person knows or reasonably should know that an underage person will or does a consume any alcohol or alcoholic beverage  or b possess any alcohol or alcoholic beverage with the intent to consume it  and 5 the person fails to take reasonable steps to prevent possession or consumption by the underage persons b a person is criminally responsible for violating this subdivision if the person intentionally aids advises hires counsels or conspires with or otherwise procures another to commit the prohibited act c a person who hosts an event or gathering does not have to be present at the event or gathering to be criminally responsible subd 5 exceptions a this section does not apply to conduct solely between an underage person and his or her parents while present in the parents household b this section does not apply to legally protected religious observances c this section does not apply to retail intoxicating liquor or 32 percent malt liquor licensees municipal liquor stores or bottle club permit holders who are regulated by minnesota statutes subd  1a1 d this section does not apply to situations where underage persons are lawfully in possession of alcohol or alcoholic beverages during the course and scope of employment subd 6 police officer enforcement this section can be enforced by any subd 7 severability if any subsection sentence clause phrase word  or other portion of this section is for any reason  held to be unconstitutional or invalid in whole  or in part by any court of competent jurisdiction  such portion shall be deemed severable  and such unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this law which remaining portions shall continue in full force and effect beer license subd 1 license required it is unlawful for any person to sell or keep or offer for sale  any beer without a license therefor from the city this section shall not apply to sales by manufacturers to wholesalers or to sales by wholesalers to persons holding onsale or offsale beer licenses from the city any person licensed to sell liquor onsale shall not be required to obtain an onsale beer license and may sell beer onsale without an additional license  any person licensed to sell liquor offsale shall not be required to obtain an offsale beer license and may sell beer offsale without an additional license  subd 2 restrictions and regulations  a no gambling or gambling device shall be permitted on any licensed premises except such as are licensed by or under the control of the minnesota gambling control board  b no licensee shall during the effective period of such license  be the owner or holder of a federal retail liquor dealers tax stamp for the sale of intoxicating liquor unless such owner or holder also holds a liquor license from the city and ownership or holding thereof shall be grounds for immediate revocation without a hearing  c no license shall be granted to a wholesaler or manufacturer of beer or to anyone holding a financial interest in such manufacture or wholesaling d no person who has not attained the age of 18 years shall be employed to sell or serve beer in any onsale establishment e no license shall be granted for any building within 300 feet of any school ground or within 100 feet of any place of worship unless specifically authorized by the city council in its sole discretion f onsale beer licenses may be granted to only exclusive liquor stores motels hotels restaurants clubs drug stores bowling centers theaters and congressionally chartered veterans organizations g every license shall be granted subject to the provisions of this all other applicable provisions of the city other laws relating to the operation of licensees business subd 3 hours and days of sales a no sale of beer may be made between  am and  am on the days of monday nor between  a m and  noon on sunday b no offsale beer sales may be made on thanksgiving day christmas day or after  pm on christmas eve c no licensee may sell beer onsale between  am and  am unless the licensee has received approval by the city council and obtained a permit from the commissioner of public safety state of minnesota subd 4 temporary license a applicant a temporary onsale or offsale license for the sale of beer within the city limits may be issued to a club or charitable  religious or nonprofit organization b conditions 1 an application for a temporary license shall state the exact dates and place of proposed temporary sale  2 no applicant shall qualify for a temporary license for more than a total of seven days in any calendar year 3 the council may but is not obligated to grant a temporary beer license on premises owned or controlled by the city any such license may be conditioned qualified or restricted as the council sees fit if the premises to be licensed are owned or under the control of the city the applicant shall file with the city prior to issuance of the license a certificate of liability insurance coverage in at least the sum of $50000 for injury to any one person and $100 000 for injury to more than one person naming the city as an insured during the license period such license shall be issued only on the condition that the applicant will not sell in excess of $10000 retail value worth of beer in any calendar year and thereupon shall be exempt from proof of financial responsibility as provided for herein liquor license subd 1 license required it is unlawful for any person directly or indirectly on any pretense or by any device  to sell barter keep for sale or otherwise dispose of liquor as part of a commercial transaction without a license from the city this not apply to 1 such potable liquors intended for therapeutic purposes and not as a beverage  2 industrial alcohol and its compounds not prepared or used for beverage purposes  3 wine in the possession of a person duly licensed under this an onsale wine licensee  4 sales by manufacturers to wholesalers duly licensed as such by the commissioner  or 5 sales by wholesalers to persons holding liquor licenses from the city any person licensed to sell liquor onsale shall not be required to obtain an onsale beer license and may sell beer onsale without an additional license any person licensed to sell liquor offsale shall not be required to obtain an offsale beer license and may sell beer offsale without an additional license subd 2 restrictions and regulations a no license shall be granted to a wholesaler or manufacturer of liquor or to anyone holding a financial interest in such manufacture or wholesaling b no license shall be effective until a permit shall be issued to a licensee under the laws of the united states if such permit be required under such laws of the state of minnesota c no gambling or gambling device shall be permitted on any licensed premises except such as are licensed by or under the control of the minnesota gambling control board d no person under the age of 18 years shall be employed upon premises or in any rooms constituting the same except that persons under the age of 18 years may be employed as musicians or to perform the duties of a busser or dishwasher in places defined as a restaurant hotel or motel e no licensee shall sell offer for sale or keep for sale  liquor in any original package which has been refilled or partly refilled f no licensee shall display liquor to the public during hours when the sale of liquor is prohibited  g no license shall be granted for any building within 300 feet of any school ground or within 100 feet of any place of worship unless specifically authorized by the city council in its sole discretion  h no more than one offsale license shall be held by any person and no person may hold an offsale license for more than one location the council may immediately revoke all licenses in which such person has an additional offsale interest the term interest includes any pecuniary interest in the ownership operation management  or profits of a retail liquor establishment but does not include bona fide loans  bona fide rental agreements   bona fide open accounts or other obligations held with or without security arising out of the ordinary and regular course of business of selling or leasing merchandise fixtures or supplies to such establishment   an interest in a corporation owning or operating a hotel but having at least 150 or more rental units holding a liquor license in conjunction therewith  or 10 percent or less interest in any other corporation holding a license a person who receives moneys from time to time directly or indirectly from a licensee in the absence of a bona fide consideration therefore and excluding bona fide gifts or donations shall be deemed to have a pecuniary interest in such retail license  in determining bona tides the reasonable value of the goods or things received as consideration for any payment by the licensee and all other facts reasonably tending to prove or disprove the existence of any purposeful scheme or arrangement to evade the prohibitions of this subdivision shall be considered  i onsale licenses shall be granted only to exclusive liquor stores  hotels motels restaurants clubs bowling centers theaters and congressionally chartered veterans organizations  j  the council may issue the number of licenses authorized by statute or local referendum or restrict such number from time to time as it may in its discretion  deem proper k every license shall be granted subject to the prov1s1ons of this all other applicable provisions of the city other laws relating to the operation of the licensed business  l it is lawful for an offsale licensee to provide samples of wine liqueurs and cordials which the licensee currently has in stock and is offering for sale to the general public without obtaining an additional license provided the wine liqueur and cordial samples are dispensed at no charge and consumed on the licensed premises during the permitted hours of offsale in a quantity less than 50 milliliters of wine per variety per customer and 25 milliliters of liqueur or cordial per variety per customer m no person who has not successfully completed a responsible sellerserver training course with proof of successful completion on file in the office of the city clerk may sell or serve liquor or wine on the licensed premises subd 3 hours and days of sales a no onsale liquor sales may be made after  am on sunday until  am on monday no onsale liquor sales may be made after  am  until  am  on any other weekday  b no offsale liquor sales may be made before  am or after  pm on any weekday or on sundays except between the hours of  am  and  pm no offsale liquor sales may be made on thanksgiving day christmas day december 25 or after  pm on christmas eve december 24 c no licensee may sell liquor onsale between  a m and  am unless the licensee has received approval from the city council and obtained a permit from the commissioner of public safety state of minnesota d no delivery of alcohol to an offsale licensee may be made by a wholesaler or accepted by an offsale licensee on a sunday no order solicitation or merchandising may be made by a wholesaler on a sunday  subd 4 sunday sales the electorate of the city having authorized the same a sunday onsale liquor license may be issued to hotels restaurants and clubs theaters and also bowling centers which have facilities for serving at least 30 guests at one time the hours of such sales shall be from  am until  midnight in conjunction with the serving of food in the event new years eve falls on a sunday the hours of sale for the abovedescribed establishments shall be from  am on sunday to  a m or  a m with proper state licensure on monday this section shall not affect the ability of a licensed bed and breakfast facility to provide wine to guests under subd  2f of this  sports or convention facilities license the council may authorize any holder of an onsale liquor license issued by the city or by an adjacent municipality to sell liquor at any convention  banquet  conference  meeting or social affair conducted on the premises of a sports or convention facility owned by the city or instrumentality thereof having independent policy making and appropriating authority and located within the city the licensee must be engaged to sell liquor at such an event by the person or organization permitted to use the premises and may sell liquor only to persons attending the event the licensee shall not sell liquor to any person attending or participating in any amateur athletic event sales may be limited to designated areas of the facility subd 6 intoxicating malt liquor license for theaters the council may issue an onsale intoxicating malt liquor license to an operator of a theater within the city a theater operator holding an onsale intoxicating malt liquor license is authorized to sell intoxicating malt liquor and beer on all days of the week to persons attending events at the theater subd 7 temporary license a license authorized notwithstanding any provision of the city the contrary  the council may issue a license for the temporary onsale of liquor in connection with a social event sponsored by the licensee such license may provide that the licensee may contract with the holder of a fullyear onsale license issued by the city for liquor catering services  b applicant the applicant for a license under this section must be a club or charitable  religious or other nonprofit organization in existence for at least three years  c terms and conditions of license 1 no license is valid until approved by the state commissioner of public safety 2 no license shall be issued for more than four consecutive days 3 all licenses and licensees are subject to all provisions of statutes and the city to liquor sale and licensing accordingly  liquor liability insurance shall be required for temporary onsale licenses to the same degree as is required for yearly onsale licenses the licensee shall provide proof of financial responsibility coverage and in the case of catering by a fullyear onsale licensee such caterer shall provide proof of the extension of such coverage to the licensed premises 4 licenses may authorize sales on premises other than those owned or permanently occupied by the licensee 5 no temporary license shall issue until the city clerk is furnished with a written statement of verification from the applicant or licensee that all persons selling or serving liquor or wine upon the premises where liquor or wine is to be served have successfully completed a responsible sellerserver training course and proof of successful completion for all sellers or servers of liquor or wine upon the licensed premises is on file with in the office of the city clerk 6 charitable religious or other nonprofit organizations shall be exempt from the training verification fee d insurance required the council may but at no time shall it be under any obligation to grant a temporary liquor license on premises owned or controlled by the city any such license may be conditioned qualified or restricted as the council sees fit if the premises to be licensed are owned or controlled by the city the applicant shall file with the city prior to issuance of the license a certificate of liability insurance coverage in at least the sum of $50000 for injury to any one person $100000 for injury to more than one person and $10000 for property damage naming the city as an insured during the license period wine license subd 1 license required it is unlawful for any person to sell or keep or offer for sale any wine without a license therefor from the city this section shall not apply to 1 possession or handling for sale or otherwise of sacramental wine by any representative of any religious order or for use in connection with a legitimate religious ceremony  2 sales by manufacturers to wholesalers duly licensed as such by the state of minnesota  3 sales by wholesalers to persons holding onsale or offsale liquor licenses from the city  or 4 sales by wholesalers to persons holding onsale wine licenses from the city subd 2 restrictions and regulations a no license shall be granted to a wholesaler or manufacturer of wine or to anyone holding a financial interest in such manufacture or wholesaling b no gambling or gambling device shall be permitted on any licensed premises except as licensed by or under the control of the minnesota gambling control board c no person under 18 years of age shall be employed upon the premises where onsale wine is offered or in any rooms constituting the same except that persons under the age of 18 years may be employed to perform the duties of a musician actor usher ticket seller busser or dishwasher in places defined as a restaurant hotel motel or theater persons under 18 years of age may also be employed as waiters or waitresses to serve food in rooms in which only wine is sold onsale provided they shall not be permitted to serve or sell wine d no license shall be granted for any building within 300 feet of any school ground or within 100 feet of any place of worship unless specifically authorized by the city council in its sole discretion  e no more than one license shall be held by any person  for the purpose of this subparagraph any person owning a beneficial interest of five percent or more of any licensed establishment shall be considered a licensee f onsale wine licenses shall be granted only to the following 1 a restaurant as defined in this has appropriate facilities for seating at least 25 guests at one time  2 a licensed bed and breakfast facility to furnish wine only to registered guests of the facility and if the facility contains a licensed commercial kitchen also to guests attending private events at the facility  3 a theater to furnish wine only to persons attending events at the theater an onsale wine license shall not be required for a bed and breakfast facility to provide at no additional charge to a person renting a room at the facility not more than two glasses of wine per day containing not more than four fluid ounces if 1 the wine is consumed on the premises of the facility  and 2 the facility is registered with the state commissioner of public safety g every license shall be granted subject to the provisions of this all other applicable provisions of the city other laws relating to the operation of the licensed business  subd 3 hours and days of sales a no onsale of wine may be made between  am and  a m on sunday nor between  am until  am on monday nor between the hours of  am and  am on any other weekday b in the event new years eve falls on a sunday the hours of sale shall be from  am on sunday to  am on monday the  am closing time listed assumes the onsale wine licensee has received approval by the city council and the commissioner of public safety state of minnesota for a  am closing if required approvals are not received then the closing time shall be at  am subd 4 license sale of intoxicating malt liquors at onsale without a a a holder of an onsale wine license issued pursuant to this section who is also licensed to sell 32 percent malt liquors at onsale pursuant to this may sell intoxicating malt liquors at onsale without an additional license brewpub license subd 1 brewpub defined a brewpub is a restaurant operated on the same premises as a brewery that is licensed pursuant to this  state brewpub licenses required a brewpub must be licensed by the state of minnesota and is subject to the restrictions and regulations in this minnesota statutes 301 or their successor subd 3 general restrictions and regulations for brewpubs  except as otherwise provided in this the restrictions and regulations for liquor licenses contained in of this applicable to brewpubs a a brewpub must possess a liquor brewermanufacturer license issued by the state of minnesota b total sale of malt liquor produced and packaged on the licensed premises shall not exceed 3500 barrels per year with no more than 750 barrels per year of malt liquor produced and packaged on the licensed premises being sold offsale pursuant to this a brewpub may only provide offsale with a brewpub offsale intoxicating license issued by the city brewpub offsale shall be limited to malt liquor produced and packaged on the licensed premises in 64 ounce containers commonly known as growlers or in 750 milliliter bottles that are designed sealed and labeled pursuant to minnesota statutes as it may be amended from time to time d offsale of malt liquor under this be made between the hours of  am and  pm monday between the hours of  a m  and  p m on sunday  no offsale malt liquor sales may be made on thanksgiving day  christmas day december 25  or after 8 00 pm on christmas eve december 24 e all malt liquor sold offsale under this be removed from the premises by  pm fixing fees fees for all licenses provided for in this including but not by way of limitation license fees for onsale and off sale of beer temporary onsale of beer onsale and offsale of liquor onsale of liquor by clubs onsale of wine and application and investigation fees  shall be fixed and determined by the council adopted by ordinance  and uniformly penalty 660 chapters general business licensing and regulation definitions as used in this the following words and terms shall have the meanings stated 1 applicant  any person making an application for a license under this application  a form to be completed by the applicant to request a license furnished by the city and uniformly required as a prerequisite to the consideration of the issuance of a license for a business 3 bond  a corporate surety document in the form and with the provisions acceptable and specifically approved by the city attorney 4 business  any activity occupation sale of goods or services or transaction that is either licensed or regulated or both licensed and regulated by the terms and conditions of this license  a document issued by the city permitting an applicant to carry on and transact a business 6 licensee  an applicant who following completion and approval of an application holds a valid current unexpired and unrevoked license from the city for carrying on a business 7 license fee  the money paid to the city pursuant to an application and prior to issuance of a license to transact and carry on a business 8 sale sell and sold  all forms of barter and all manner or means of furnishing merchandise to persons follows applications all applications shall be made as subd 1 all applications shall be made at the office of the permits and license manager upon forms furnished by the city subd 2 all initial applications shall be accompanied by an investigation fee to be set from time to time by council ordinance to cover the cost of investigation as herein provided and a general authorizationrelease form authorizing the release of information to the city if the council determines that it is in the public interest to undertake an investigation of an applicant for the renewal of a license the applicant shall pay an investigation fee and provide an updated authorizationrelease form which shall accompany the application for license renewal subd 3 all such applications must be subscribed sworn to and include but not be limited to the following a applicants full name first middle last and age b applicants present address and length of time applicant has lived at that address c applicants phone numbers home business cell and email address d applicants occupation and length of time so engaged e applicants addresses and occupations for the three years preceding the date of application f names and addresses of applicants employers if any for the three years preceding the date of application g whether or not applicant has ever been convicted of a felony gross misdemeanor or misdemeanor including violation of a municipal ordinance but excluding traffic violations and if so the date and place of conviction and the nature of the offense h type of license and location of premises for which application is made i at least four character references j any other information that the council deems necessary considering the nature of the business for which license application is made subd 4 it is unlawful for any applicant to intentionally make a false statement or omission upon any application form upon discovery of any such falsehood or willful omission the city shall automatically reject the license application or if already issued shall render any license or permit issued pursuant thereto void and of no effect subd 5 upon receipt of each completed application investigation fee and authorizationrelease form the permits and license manager will forward all application information to the police department which shall conduct a criminal history check and investigate the truth of statements made therein and the moral character and business reputation of each applicant for license to such extent as the police department deems necessary the police department shall forward the results of its investigation to the permits and license manager who will report said the results to the city council the council shall not consider an application before such the investigation has been completed and its results forwarded to the council subd 6 applications for renewal licenses may be made in abbreviated form as the council may adopt by ordinance action on application termination and duplicate license subd 1 approval the council may grant any application for the period of the remainder of the then current calendar year or for the entire ensuing license year all applications including proposed license periods must be consistent with this  issuance if an application is approved the permits and license manager shall forthwith issue a license in the form prescribed by the council upon payment of the appropriate license fee and approval of the bond or insurance as to form and surety or carrier if required all licenses shall be on a calendar year basis unless otherwise specified herein as to particular businesses unless otherwise herein specified license fees shall be prorated on the basis of 112th for each calendar month or part thereof remaining in the then current license year for licenses where the fee is less than $100 a minimum license fee equal to onehalf of the annual license fee shall be charged except as to licenses which by their terms apply citywide licenses shall be valid only at the specified location subd 3 revocation termination licenses shall terminate only by expiration or subd 4 refusal suspension and revocation the council may for any reasonable cause refuse to grant any application or suspend or revoke any license no license shall be granted to a person of questionable moral character or business reputation before suspension or revocation of any license the council shall give reasonable notice to the licensee and grant the licensee the opportunity to be heard grounds for suspension or revocation may be but are not limited to any of the following 1 the licensee suffered or permitted illegal acts upon the licensed premises  2 the licensee had knowledge of such illegal acts but failed to report the acts to police  3 the licensee failed or refused to cooperate fully with police in investigating the alleged illegal acts  or 4 the activities of the licensee created a serious danger to public health safety or welfare subd 5 duplicate license duplicates of all original licenses may be issued by the permits and license manager without action by the council upon the licensees affidavit that the original has been lost and upon payment of a fee of $25 for issuance of the duplicate all duplicate licenses shall be clearly marked duplicate fixing license fees except as otherwise herein provided all fees for licenses under this be fixed and determined by the council adopted by ordinance and uniformly enforced carrying or posting all peddlers or transient merchants shall at all times when so engaged be in possession of their license all other licensees shall post their licenses in their place of business near the licensed activity in the case of machine or other device licensing however the city may provide a sticker for the current license year which shall be affixed to each machine or device requiring a sticker and the sticker shall suffice for the posting requirement all licensees shall display their licenses upon demand by any city officer or authorized other government official penalty for property owner it is unlawful for persons who own or control real property to knowingly permit the property to be used without a license for any business for which a license is required by this 07 responsibility of licensee the conduct of agents or employees of a licensee while engaged in performance of their duties for their principal or employer under the license shall be deemed the conduct of the licensee conditional licenses the council may upon a finding of necessity place conditions and restrictions upon a license as it in its discretion may deem reasonable and justified renewal of licenses applications for renewal of an existing license shall be made at least 30 days prior to the date of expiration of the license and shall contain information required by the city this time requirement may be waived by the council for good and sufficient cause the city may but shall not be responsible for notifying each licensee of the deadline for renewal insurance requirements whenever insurance is required by a section of this after approval by the council but before the license shall issue the applicant shall file with the permits and license manager a policy or certificate of public liability insurance showing that 1 the limits are at least as high as required  2 coverage is effective for at least the license term approved  and 3 the insurance will not be cancelled or terminated without 30 days written notice served upon the permits and license manager cancellation termination or insufficiency of required insurance coverage shall be grounds for license revocation license denial and fixing rates  hearing subd 1 right to deny the council reserves the right to deny any application for a license to operate any business licensed or regulated under this the business involves 1 service to the public  2 rates charged for service  3 use of public streets or other public property by the applicant or the public  or 4 the public health safety and convenience the council may also consider the location of the business in making this determination before making such a determination however the council shall hold a public hearing with notice to interested parties and the public as it may deem necessary or proper in action calling for such a hearing subd 2 rates where under specific provisions of this the council has reserved the right to fix or approve fees rates or charges of a licensed or regulated business the rates shall be uniform for each category or class of service and no licensee or proprietor of a regulated business shall claim or demand payment in excess of the uniform guidelines subd 3 hearing any applicant or licensee under this challenges denial of a license or rates fixed or approved by the council shall have a right to a hearing before the council upon written request notice of time place and purpose of the hearing shall be given to such persons and by such means as the council may determine in calling the hearing private use of public property subd 1 application individuals or groups desiring to use city property for an event or construction project must complete an application and submit it to the city for approval an application for private use of public property may be obtained from the public works office subd 2 application deadline applications must be submitted to the city at least 30 days prior to the planned event or commencement of the construction project subd 3 council action required applications requesting a street closure or waiver of fees must be approved by the city council all other applications may by acted upon by city administrative staff subd 4 public health authorization required for food service if an applicants plans for an event on public property include food service the applicant must include a copy of a public health authorization obtained from the goodhue county public health department with the application for private use of public property submitted to the city shows subd 1 license required it is unlawful for any person to present any public show movie caravan circus carnival theatrical or other performance or exhibition without first having obtained a license from the city subd 2 instances exceptions no license shall be required in the following a performances presented in the local schools and colleges under the sponsorship of such schools and colleges and primarily for the students only b performances of athletic musical or theatrical events sponsored by local schools or colleges using student talent only c any performance or event in or sponsored by bona fide local church and nonprofit organizations provided that such organization shall be incorporated small vehicle passenger service subd 1 definitions the following terms as used in this shall have the meanings stated 1 vehicles for hire  any motor vehicle for hire including but not limited to taxicabs engaged in the business of transporting passengers within the city having a seating capacity of seven or fewer persons including the driver and not operating on a fixed route vehicles for hire does not include a vehicle under contract with a transportation network company and used exclusively for hire in accordance with that contract 2 small vehicle passenger service  a service provided by a person engaged in the forhire transportation of passengers in a vehicle designed to transport seven or fewer persons including the driver small vehicle passenger service does not include transportation network companies 3 operator  a licensee owning or otherwise having control of one or more vehicles for hire 4 driver  the person driving and having physical control over a vehicle for hire the driver may be the licensee or in the employ of the licensed operator 5 for hire for remuneration or compensation of any kind promised paid given to or received by a person for the transportation of persons 6 taxicab stand  any place along the curb or street or elsewhere which is exclusively reserved by the city for the use of vehicle for hire 7 special transportation service  motor vehicle transportation including but not limited to mobility vans provided on a regular basis by a public or private entity or person that is designed exclusively or primarily to serve individuals who are elderly or disabled and who are unable to use regular means of transportation but do not require ambulance service 8 motor carrier of passengers  a service provided by a person engaged in the forhire transportation of passengers in vehicles designed to transport eight or more persons including the driver 9 transportation network company  a corporation partnership sole proprietorship or other entity that is operating in minnesota that uses a digital network to connect transportation network company riders to transportation network company drivers who provide prearranged rides including but not limited to lyft and uber subd 2 license required it is unlawful for any person to drive a vehicle for hire or operate a small vehicle passenger service without first having obtained a small vehicle passenger service license from the city it is unlawful for anyone to operate as a motor carrier of passengers within city limits without a certificate of registration or permit issued by the minnesota department of transportation all small vehicle passenger service licenses issued by the city of red wing unless revoked sooner will expire on december 31 of each year eligibility for a license to drive or operate a vehicle for hire shall be as follows a is the holder of a valid minnesota drivers license authorizing operation of the licensed vehicle  b is at least 18 years elg of age  c has no felony gross misdemeanor or misdemeanor convictions in the state of minnesota or any other state in the last five years for matters involving the use of threat or use of force possession or sale of controlled substances prostitution or indecent conduct  d has no felony gross misdemeanor or misdemeanor convictions in the state of minnesota or any other state in the last five years for matters involving leaving the scene of an accident driving under the influence of an alcoholic beverage or drug theft damage to property reckless or careless driving or refusing to take a chemical test  e has provided a written consent to a criminal history background check to the city subd 3 license issuance and display and vehicle marking all licenses shall be issued for specific vehicles except as otherwise herein provided license tags including number and year for which issued shall be plainly visible from the front of the vehicle both sides of every licensed vehicle for hire when in use shall be plainly and permanently marked as such with a painted sign or appurtenances showing the full or abbreviated name of the licensed operator licenses from vehicles retired from service may be transferred to proper replacement vehicles by the permits and license manager upon application being made for such transfer subd 4 insurance required before a small vehicle passenger service license is issued by the council and at all times effective during the licensed period the licensee shall have and maintain property damage liability and bodily injury insurance in the amount of $500000 per person $500000 per accident and $100000 property damage insurance if split limits or $500000 combined single limit csl the license holder shall ensure each licensed and insured vehicle is properly titled in the companys name subd 5 mechanical condition before issuing a new small vehicle passenger service license or upon renewal thereof the applicant shall present to the permits and license manager a certificate signed by a competent and experienced mechanic showing that the vehicle is 1 in good mechanical condition  2 thoroughly safe for transportation of passengers  and 3 in neat and clean condition a similar certificate may be required from time to time during the licensed period subd 6 taxicab stands the council is authorized to establish taxicab stands in places on city streets as the council determines necessary in establishing taxicab stands the council shall take into consideration the need for stands and the convenience to the general public taxicab stands shall be available on a firstcome firstserved basis drivers shall stay within five feet of their vehicle when a taxicab stand is occupied no other vehicle for hire shall loiter or wait for the taxicab stand to become vacant taxicab stands shall be plainly marked subd 7 smoking in accordance with the minnesota clean indoor air act minnesota statutes section  as it may be amended from time to time smoking of tobacco and plant products is prohibited inside any vehicle for hire this prohibition applies to smoking of ecigarettes tobacco shall have the same definition as used in of this  driver impairment no driver shall be permitted to operate a vehicle for hire while under the influence of alcohol or any moodaltering drug including prescription and overthecounter drugs no driver shall possess any controlled substance or alcoholic beverage while operating a vehicle for hire subd 9 exceptions additional license requirements exemptions and a special transportation services including mobility vans are exempt from this licensure requirement if certified by the state of minnesota and using a driver who is qualified pursuant to minnesota rules or operating under a permit from the minnesota department of transportation b a vehicle for hire having no valid red wing small vehicle passenger service license may bring passengers into red wing but may not pick up passengers or accept any business within the city of red wing c motor carriers of passengers are required to register with the minnesota department of transportation in accordance with minnesota statutes section  d the carrying of passengers as a business for compensation by a vehicle other than a vehicle duly licensed under and operating in accordance with the provisions of this ordinance or by a vehicle contracted transportation network company or by a motor carrier operating under minnesota statutes is hereby forbidden e this in equal force to all small passenger vehicle services motor carriers of passengers and special transportation services operating within the city regardless of whether the services principal place of business is located outside of the city tobacco subd 1 definitions as used in this section the terms used shall have the following meanings 1 tobacco  cigarettes and any product containing made or derived from tobacco that is intended for human consumption whether chewed smoked absorbed dissolved inhaled snorted sniffed or ingested by other means or any component part or accessory of a tobacco product including but not limited to cigars  cheroots  stogies  perique  granulated plug cut crimp cut ready rubbed and other smoking tobacco snuff snuff flour  cavendish  plug and twist tobacco  fine cut and other chewing tobaccos  shorts  refuse scraps  clippings cuttings and sweepings of tobacco  and other kinds and forms of tobacco 2 tobaccorelated device  cigarette papers or pipes for smoking or other devices intentionally designed or intended to be used in a manner that enables the chewing sniffing smoking or inhalation of vapors of tobacco or tobacco products including components of tobaccorelated devices marketed or sold separately 3 electronicdelivery device  any product containing or delivering nicotine lobelia or any other substance intended for human consumption that can be used by a person to simulate smoking in the delivery of nicotine or any other substance of vapor from the product including any component part of a product marketed or sold separately 4 nicotine or lobelia delivery device  any product containing or delivering nicotine or lobelia intended for human consumption or any component part of such a product that is not tobacco or an electronicdelivery device 5 adult  a person 18 years of age or over 6 licensee  any person lawfully possessing a license to sell dispense or give away tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronic delivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices and shall include any employee agent or representative of any person having such a license 7 person  any individual corporation partnership or other entity 8 daycare facility  a daycare center as defined in minnesota rules  subpart 5 as amended 9 vending machine  any mechanical electrical or electronic or other type of device which dispenses tobacco or tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices upon the insertion of money tokens or other form of payment directly or into the machine by the person seeking to purchase the tobacco or tobaccorelated device electronicdelivery device or nicotine or lobelia delivery device subd 2 license required a license it is unlawful for any person directly or indirectly to keep for retail sale sell at retail or otherwise furnish for profit or benefit any tobaccoobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices without a valid license obtained from the city application for the license shall be on a form approved and provided by the city b amended definitions any amendments to the definitions of the terms tobacco tobacco related device or electronic delivery device found in minnesota statutes section  or to nicotine or lobelia delivery device as addressed in minnesota statutes section  shall be considered amendments to the definition of the terms found herein any license issued pursuant to this entitle the licensee to sell all tobacco tobacco related devices electronic delivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices as defined herein while that license remains active c license fee the license fee shall be set from timetotime by city council ordinance all tobacco licenses shall be valid for one calendar year from january 1 to december 31 licenses may be issued anytime after january 1 but shall expire on december 31 of the year of issuance and the license fee shall not be prorated subd 3 restrictions a separate licenses shall be issued for the sale of tobacco at each fixed place of business and no license shall be issued for a movable place of business no license shall be transferred to the new owner should a licensed establishment be sold the new owner of any such establishment must apply for a new license b it is unlawful for any person to sell dispense or give away any tobacco tobaccorelated device electronicdelivery device or nicotine or lobelia delivery device to any person without first having the person provide a valid form of identification providing proof that the individual is at least 18 years of age c it is unlawful for any licensee to manufacture advertise deliver or sell any drug paraphernalia as that term is defined in of the city violation of this restriction may be punished as a misdemeanor as provided in red wing city 27 andor be grounds for the suspension revocation denial or nonrenewal of a license issued pursuant to this suspension or revocation of a license shall be done in conformance with red wing city 03 subd 5 notice of the hearing and the final decision shall be in writing any such suspension revocation denial or nonrenewal shall also conform with subdivision 10 of this no tobacco license shall be issued to any establishment within 1000 feet of any school property or daycare facility as measured by the shortest line between the property to be occupied by the proposed licensee and the property occupied by the school or daycare facility unless the licensee continuously holds a tobacco license predating the enactment of this provision or the date that the school or daycare facility occupied the property e it is unlawful for the licensee to sell any liquid whether or not such liquid contains nicotine intended for human consumption and use in an electronicdelivery device that is not contained in packaging that is child resistant packaging as set forth in 16 cfr  170015b1 subd 4 compliance checks law enforcement officials or persons as designated by the city shall conduct periodic compliance checks of the premises of all holders of licenses for the sale of tobacco products compliance checks will be held at least two times per year these compliance checks may include but shall not be limited to surveillance including minors under the age of 18 who attempt to purchase tobacco products a law enforcement official or persons as designated by the city shall issue a license violation citation to any license holder found violating any provision of this code or the laws of the state of minnesota license suspension or revocation may be instituted following the issuance of a citation or criminal conviction of any officer director manager or other agent employee or representative of any licensee subd 5 responsibility licensees shall be responsible for the conduct of their employees agents and representatives while on the licensed premises any violation of this section by an employee agent or representative shall also be considered a violation by the licensee for the purposes of imposing a civil penalty license suspension revocation denial or nonrenewal subd 6 vending machines no sale of tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices may occur machines subd 7 selfservice merchandising no sale of tobacco tobacco related devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices shall occur from open displays which are accessible to the public without the intervention of the licensee this subdivision shall not apply to the sale of cartons of cigarettes by a licensee who derives at least 90 percent of its revenue from tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices and where the licensee ensures that no person younger than 18 years of age is present or permitted to enter at any time subd 8 use and sampling nothing in this prohibit the sampling of tobacco as provided for in the minnesota clean indoor air act minnesota statutes subdivision 4 provided that the licensee ensures that no person younger than 18 years of age is present or permitted to enter the premises at any time this provision shall extend to allow sampling using electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices at licensed establishments deriving at least 90 percent of revenue from electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices according to the same restrictions and limitations it is prohibited for licensed establishments to provide access to seating in exchange for a fee or any other consideration including but not limited to the purchase of tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices subd 9 penalties a licensees any violation of the restrictions attached to the tobacco license including but not limited to sale of tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices to any person under 18 years of age shall be cause for administrative penalty suspension revocation denial or nonrenewal of such license as well as any civil or criminal remedy available at law any suspension or revocation of a license shall be done in conformance with red wing city 03 subd 5 notice of the hearing and the final decision shall be in writing license violations shall carry the following minimum administrative penalties $75 for the first violation  $200 for a second violation at the same location within 24 months of the initial violation and $250 and a minimum 7day suspension for the third violation within 24 months of the initial violation nothing in this section prohibits the city from imposing additional penalties based upon the circumstances of violation and the history of license violations at the same location in the case of a license suspension or revocation there shall be no license fee refund any person whose license has been revoked shall not be eligible for another tobacco license for one year from the date of the license revocation the city council reserves the right to attach reasonable conditions to the reinstatement of a suspended or revoked license b individuals 1 first offense any person who sells or furnishes tobacco tobacco related devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices to a person under 18 years of age shall be charged with a misdemeanor for the first violation the notice and hearing requirements for a licensee shall also apply to any person accused of violating this provision 2 subsequent offenses a any person who sells tobacco tobacco related devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices to a person under 18 years of age a subsequent time within five years of a previous conviction for the same offense is guilty of a gross misdemeanor b any person who furnishes tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices to a person under 18 years of age after conviction for the same offense shall be guilty of a gross misdemeanor for each subsequent violation 3 administrative fine each offense committed by an individual under this section shall carry a fine of $50 per offense 4 affirmative defense it is an affirmative defense to a charge under this section if the defendant proves by a preponderance of the evidence that the defendant reasonably and in good faith relied upon representative of proof of age as described in minnesota statutes subd 6 as it may be amended from time to time c minors 1 misdemeanor a person under the age of 18 years who purchases or attempts to purchase tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronic delivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices and who uses a drivers license permit minnesota identification card or any type of false identification to misrepresent the persons age is guilty of a misdemeanor 2 petty misdemeanor a person under the age of 18 years who possesses smokes chews otherwise ingests or purchases or attempts to purchase tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronic delivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices is guilty of a petty misdemeanor 3 any person under the age of 18 years who purchases possesses or uses tobacco tobaccorelated devices electronicdelivery devices or nicotine or lobelia delivery devices shall be referred to an alternative juvenile justice system if no alternative system is available or suitable to the juveniles situation the juvenile shall be subject to a $25 administrative penalty the notice and hearing requirements for a licensee shall also apply to any person accused of violating this provision subd 10 appeal of suspension revocation denial or nonrenewal of license a in the event the city suspends revokes denies or determines not to renew a tobacco license the city shall send to the licensee by certified mail return receipt requested written notice of the action and the right to appeal the aggrieved party may appeal the decision of the city within 10 days of receiving notice of the citys action filing of an appeal shall stay the action of the city in suspending or revoking a license until the city council makes a final decision failure to file an appeal within the 10day period shall be deemed a waiver of appeal b the city council may appoint a committee or an independent hearing officer to hear an appeal hereunder report findings of fact and provide a recommendation for disposition to the council hearings on the appeal shall be open to the public and the licensee or applicant shall have the right to appear and be represented by legal counsel and to offer evidence on its behalf at the conclusion of the hearing the city council shall make a final decision sidewalk cafes subd 1 authorized  license required a any person authorized to operate a restaurant on designated premises within the city of red wing may apply to the city council for a license to conduct a portion of the restaurants authorized business in a sidewalk cafe on a part of the public way immediately adjoining the designated premises application shall be made on forms provided by the city and shall be accompanied by the fee required by city ordinance a restaurant if licensed under of the red wing city the onsale of alcoholic beverages may also request an amendment to that license to allow the sidewalk cafe to be a part of the licensed premises b a scaled diagram must be submitted with information as requested on the application including but not limited to the following  width of the building or the leased premises including the dimension of the street frontage where the sidewalk cafe will be located   layout for the sidewalk cafe furnishings tables chairs umbrellas fencing and anything else to be placed on the sidewalk including the dimensions of the seating area   width of the sidewalk remaining for pedestrian use   the property lines  and  location of trees including tree grates boulevard areas other landscaping trash containers bike racks fire hydrants mailboxes street signs utility poles and boxes and other obstacles in the case of a restaurant that holds a license under of the red wing city wishes to serve alcohol in the sidewalk cafe this diagram shall be considered a description of the extended premises for purposes of the request to amend the onsale alcohol license c to the extent authorized in any license granted under the provisions of this section the licensee may conduct licensed business on the public way notwithstanding the provisions of of the red wing city  restrictions a each sidewalk cafe license shall specify the area in which the cafe may be operated cafe seating shall be allowed on the public sidewalk or hardsurfaced public walkway directly abutting the building housing the restaurants premises no sidewalk cafe seating sale or service shall be permitted on any unpaved or uneven surface or in any portion of the street designated for vehicular travel b no license shall authorize any permanent installation of any tables chairs furnishings fencing or other equipment on the public way only metal cafe style tables and chairs shall be allowed in the licensed sidewalk cafe area  no glass plastic or picnic style tables will be permitted umbrellas will be allowed if they do not create an obstacle for pedestrians or pose a safety hazard it shall be the duty of the licensed restaurant to maintain sidewalk cafe furnishings such as chairs tables and fencing in a neat clean safe and sanitary condition and to inspect each item periodically c no license shall authorize placing any cafe fixtures on the sidewalk closer than 70 inches from any tree boulevard landscaping public trash can bike rack fire hydrant mailbox street sign utility pole or box or other obstacle before  am measured from the obstacle perpendicular from the curb toward the cafe fixtures after  am the sidewalk cafe must maintain a minimum of 44 inches of clearance from all obstacles for pedestrians as measured from the obstacle perpendicular from the curb toward the cafe fixtures d no license shall authorize a sidewalk cafe at any location prohibited by state law or this section except as herein provided e except as specifically provided herein the ownership operation and maintenance of a sidewalk cafe shall be subject to all applicable laws ordinances and regulations f no sidewalk cafe that is part of the licensed premises under of the red wing city be located within 200 feet of a residentially zoned district the measurement will be taken from the nearest portion of the sidewalk cafe to the nearest boundary of the residentially zoned district this subsection shall not apply to any such restaurant whose gross sales revenue during the preceding fiscal year from the sale of food and beverages not containing alcohol was in an amount of not less than 70 percent of the total gross revenue for the sale of food and beverages g a restaurant holding a license under of the red wing city includes a sidewalk cafe in the licensed premises may allow consumption of alcohol in the sidewalk cafe area until  pm only the license holder shall comply with all requirements of law and must take all reasonable steps to insure that alcoholic beverages are consumed only by patrons of the restaurant who are of age and not by passersby or persons who are not of age or who are obviously intoxicated and ensure that alcoholic beverages served to patrons remain on the licensed premises h each sidewalk cafe seating area that is part of the licensed premises under of the red wing city be delineated with a continuous stable barrier with one egress onto the public way the barrier will be a minimum of 36 inches and a maximum of 48 inches above the sidewalk surface i the location of a sidewalk cafe shall in no way obstruct any of the existing required means of egress from the restaurant j the occupant load within the interior of the restaurant as established by the fire marshal shall be reduced by the allowable occupant load in the sidewalk cafe so that all patrons can be accommodated indoors should the need arise due to inclement weather or other circumstances subd 3 indemnification and insurance before a license is issued pursuant to this section the applicant shall a execute and deliver to the permits and license manager on a form prescribed by the city an agreement in which the applicant agrees to indemnify defend and hold the city harmless from any personal injury or property damage resulting from or in any way related to operation of the sidewalk cafe b file with the permits and license manager evidence of commercial general liability insurance protecting the applicant against liability imposed by law arising out of the ownership maintenance or operation of such sidewalk cafe with limits in an amount of at least $1000000 per occurrence  $2000000 general aggregate limit coverage limit requirement may be satisfied by a general liability policy in combination with an excess liability or umbrella liability policy the insurance coverage must be primary written on an occurrence basis and must list the city of red wing as an additional insured all certificates shall provide for 30 days written notice to the city prior to cancellation restaurants licensed under of the red wing city extend liquor liability coverage with minimum coverage of $1000000 per occurrence and $1000000 aggregate to include the sidewalk cafe area if the sidewalk cafe is included in the licensed premises no license issued pursuant to this section shall be valid at any time the insurance required herein is not maintained and evidence of its continuance filed with the permits and license manager subd 4 suspension and revocation a any license authorized by this section may be revoked at any time by the city council for violations of this section or the license terms the license may also be suspended by the city council for a period as the council shall determine b upon conviction of the licensee or the licensees agent or employee for the violation of any city ordinance or state law in connection with the ownership maintenance or operation of a sidewalk cafe the license shall automatically become suspended the suspension shall continue until the council acts to reinstate the license upon petition by the licensee subd 5 separability every prov1s1on of this section shall be separable from every other provision to the extent that if any provision shall be held invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction it shall not invalidate any other provision food wagons subd 1 purpose the purpose of this section is to regulate the operations of food wagon within the city subd 2 definition food wagon shall be defined as any vehicle stand or device used for the purpose of selling food andor drink ready to be consumed while parked on public property or right of way subd 3 license required it is unlawful for any person to operate a food wagon without a license from the city operations meeting the definition of a food wagon and operating under a valid food wagon license do not need a solicitors license under of the city  license issuance fee and display licenses including number and dates for which issued shall be plainly visible on the outside of the food wagon licenses may be issued on an annual or per event basis an application on the form prescribed by the city shall be completed by the applicant and shall be accompanied by a fee as established by ordinance subd 5 indemnification before a food wagon license is issued by the city the licensee shall execute and deliver to the permits and license manager on a form prescribed by the city an indemnification agreement holding the city harmless for any personal injury or property damage resulting from operation of the food wagon subd 6 restrictions a food wagons shall be allowed only at approved locations within the city and shall not travel from point to point around the city unless specifically authorized to do so by council action b no food wagon shall be allowed to dispense food on public property when there is a permit issued for another food or similar wagon in association with an organized and permitted event festival celebration or tournament at the same location no food wagon shall be allowed to dispense food at colvill park during the pool season unless it is part
