of an organized and permitted event festival or celebration c a person operating a food wagon may apply for and receive an annual license for different sites in the city at various times throughout the license period provided that the food wagon is only operated in one site at a time and provided that the operator notifies the permits and license manager of the location of the food wagon in advance of each specific time that food is sold from the wagon subd 7 food wagon regulations a no food shall be sold except directly from the food wagon b radios and other audio devices shall be permitted only inside the food wagon no music or noise shall be permitted that is audible 30 feet from the food wagon no amplification device shall be permitted on the exterior of any food wagon c food wagon sales shall be permitted only between the hours of sunrise and  pm unless the city council gives express permission to deviate from these hours d food wagon owners shall clean up around their food wagons at the end of each business day e all food wagons shall be kept in good repair and order and shall have a neat appearance f there shall be no drainage of liquids allowed from the food wagon onto public property g in the event that a food wagon is not used to dispense food for a period of 21 consecutive days excluding days when food dispensation is not allowed under subdivision 6 of this  the permit may be forfeited h no license shall be issued to any food wagon until proof of any appropriate and necessary licensure by the state of minnesota andor goodhue county is provided subd 8 forfeiture and revocation a food wagon license may be revoked or forfeited for violation of any of the provisions of this any other violation of the city other applicable laws and regulations food wagon licenses are not transferable lodging tax subd 1 definitions for the purpose of this the following terms phrases and words and their derivations shall have the meanings given herein 1 lodger  the person obtaining lodging from an operator 2 lodging  the furnishing of accommodation for a fee by a retreat centervacation home hotel bed & breakfast motel or rooming house except where the accommodation shall be for a continuous period of 30 days or more to the same lodgers the furnishing of rooms by religious educational or nonprofit organizations shall not constitute lodging for purposes of this operator  a person who provides lodging to others or any officer agent or employee of such person 4 person  any individual corporation partnership association estate receiver trustee executor administrator assignee syndicate or any other combination of individuals whenever the term person is used in any provision of this imposing a penalty the terms as applied to a corporation association or partnership shall mean two officers or partners thereof as the case may be 5 rent  the total fee charged for lodging whether paid in money or otherwise not including any fees for services rendered in connection with furnishing lodging other than the room fee itself subd 2 imposition of tax the city shall impose and collect a tax of three percent on the rent charged by an operator for providing lodging to any person  the tax shall be stated and charged separately and collected by the operator from the lodger the tax collected shall be a debt owed by the operator to the city and shall be extinguished only by payment to the city in no case shall the tax imposed by this section upon an operator exceed the amount of tax which the operator is authorized and required by this collect from a lodger subd 3 collections each operator shall collect the tax imposed by this the time the rent is paid the tax collections shall be deemed to be held in trust by the operator for the city the amount of tax shall be separately stated from the rent charged for the lodging and those persons paying the tax shall receive a receipt of payment from the operator subd 4 exceptions and exemptions a exceptions no tax shall be imposed on rent for lodging paid by any officer or employee of a foreign government who is exempt due to the express provisions of federal law or international treaty b exemptions an exemption shall be granted to any person whose occupancy is beyond the power of the city to tax no exemption shall be granted except upon a claim made at the time the rent is collected the claim shall be made in writing and under penalty of perjury on forms provided by the city finance director all exemption claims shall be forwarded to the finance director when the returns and collections are submitted as required by this  advertising no tax prohibited it shall be unlawful for any operator to advertise or hold out or state to the public or any customer directly or indirectly that the tax or any part thereof will be assumed or absorbed by the operator that it will not be added to the rent or that if added it or any part thereof will be refunded in computing the tax to be collected amounts of tax less than one cent shall be rounded up to one additional cent subd 6 payment and returns the taxes imposed by this be paid by the operator to the finance director monthly not less than 15 days after the end of the month in which the taxes were collected at the time of payment the operator shall submit a return upon forms supplied by the finance director the return shall contain the following minimum information a the total amount of rent collected for lodging during the period covered by the return b the amount of tax required to be collected and due for the period c the signature of the person filing the return or that of the persons agent duly authorized in writing d the period covered by the return e the amount of uncollectible rental charges subject to the lodging tax the operator may offset against the taxes payable from any reporting period the amount of taxes imposed by this paid as a result of any transaction the consideration for which became uncollectible during the reporting period but only in proportion to the portion of consideration which became uncollectible subd 7 examination of return adjustments notices and demands the finance director shall after the return is filed review the return and make any investigation or examination of the records and accounts of the person making the return as needed to determine its accuracy the tax computed by the finance director on the basis of the examination shall be the tax due if the tax due is found to be greater than the tax paid the excess shall be paid to the finance director on behalf of the city ten days after receipt of a notice given either personally to the operator or sent by registered mail to the address shown on the return if the tax paid is greater than the tax due the excess shall be refunded to the person who paid the tax ten days after determination of the refund subd 8 refunds any person may apply to the finance director for a refund of taxes paid for a prescribed period in excess of the amount legally due for that period provided that no application for refund shall be considered unless filed within one year after the tax was paid or within one year from the filing of the return whichever period is longer the finance director shall examine the claim and file written findings denying or allowing the claim in whole or in part and shall mail a notice by registered mail to the address stated on the return if the claim is allowed in whole or in part the finance director shall credit the amount of the allowance against any taxes due under this the claimant and the balance of the allowance if any shall be paid to the claimant subd 9 failure to file a return a if any operator required by this file a return fails to do so within the time prescribed or makes a willfully incorrect false or fraudulent return the operator shall upon written notice and demand by the city file the return or corrected return within five days of receipt of the notice and shall at the same time pay any tax due if the operator fails to file a return or corrected return within five days the finance director shall make a return or corrected return for the operator from the information that the finance director can obtain and shall assess a tax on that basis this tax less any payments previously made on account of the tax for the taxable period covered by the return shall be paid within five days of the receipt of written notice and demand for payment any return or assessment made by the finance director shall be on its face correct and valid the operator shall have the burden of establishing incorrectness or invalidity of the return or assessment b if any portion of a tax imposed by this including penalties is not paid within 30 days after it is due the city may institute any legal action needed to recover the amount due plus interest penalties and costs and disbursements of the action c upon good cause shown the finance director may grant an operator one 30 day extension of time within which to file a return and make payment of taxes due provided that interest during the extension shall be added to the taxes due at the rate of 10 percent per year subd 10 penalties a if any tax imposed by this not paid within the prescribed period for payment or any extension approved by the finance director a penalty equal to 10 percent of the amount remaining unpaid shall be added b in case of any failure to file a return within the time prescribed by this unless it is shown that the failure is not due to willful neglect there shall be added to the 10 percent specific penalty provided in subparagraph a of this subdivision 10 percent if the failure is for not more than 30 days with an additional five percent for each additional 30 days or fraction thereof during which such failure continues not exceeding 25 percent in the aggregate if the penalty as computed does not exceed $10 a minimum penalty of $10 shall be assessed the penalty added to any tax shall be collected at the same time and in the same manner and as a part of the tax unless the tax has been paid before the discovery of the negligence in which case the amount added shall be collected in the same manner as the tax c if any person willfully fails to file any return or make any payment required by this willfully files a false or fraudulent return or willfully attempts in any manner to evade or defeat payment of the tax due there shall also be imposed as a penalty an amount equal to 50 percent of any tax less any amounts paid on the basis of the false or fraudulent return found due for the period to which the return related the penalty imposed by this subdivision shall be collected as part of the tax and shall be in addition to any other penalties provided by this all payments received shall be credited first to penalties next to interest and then to tax due e the amount of tax not timely paid together with any penalty provided by this section shall bear interest at the maximum rate per year as prescribed by minnesota statutes as it may be amended from time to time from the time the tax should have been paid until it is paid any interest and penalty shall be added to the tax and be collected as a part thereof subd 11 administration of tax the finance director shall administer and enforce the assessment and collection of taxes imposed by this finance director shall furnish blank forms for the returns and other documents required by this distribute them throughout the city and provide them on request failure to receive or secure the forms however shall not relieve any person from any obligation required under this  examine records the finance director and persons authorized in writing to act on behalf of the finance director may examine the books papers and records of any operator in order to verify the accuracy of any return made or if no return was made to ascertain the tax as provided in this operator is directed and required to give the person authorized to examine the books papers and records the means facilities and opportunity for these examinations and investigations subd 13 violations it is a violation of this any person to willfully fail to file a return required by this fail to pay the tax due after written demand for payment fail to remit the taxes collected or any penalty or interest imposed by this written demand for payment refuse to permit the finance director or any duly authorized agents or employees of the city to examine the books records and papers pertaining to the tax due or willfully file an incomplete false or fraudulent return subd 14 use of proceeds ninetyfive percent of the proceeds obtained from the collection of taxes pursuant to this be used by the city to fund a local tourism or convention bureau for marketing the city as a tourist destination or convention center the remaining five percent shall be used to defray the citys costs in administering this tax subd 15 the tourism or convention bureau which is selected to receive the proceeds referenced in subdivision 14 of this provide the city with an audited financial statement of its operations once every three years the year selected for audit will be determined by the auditor by means of a random sample or as otherwise determined in the auditors work plan additionally the tourism or convention bureau shall provide the city with an annual fiscal report farmers market subd 1 purpose the purpose of this section is to set forth the policy of the city with regard to vendors operating at the red wing farmers market hereinafter vendors subd 2 definitions market goods shall include 1 vendor  a person or agent who sells market goods to the public 2 market goods  vendorgrown fresh fruits and vegetables  a vendorgrown herbs and spices  b vendorproduced farmstead products such as cheese meats fish poultry eggs baked goods honey maple syrup and preserves if prepared and labeled in accordance with rules established by the minnesota department of agriculture  c vendorgrown bedding plants hanging and potted plants and cut flowers  d vendorgrown dried flowers and plants  and e arts crafts and other locally produced handmade products 3 market food wagons  any vehicle stand or device used for the purpose of selling food andor drink ready to be consumed while parked at the saturday market market food wagons are only allowed at the saturday farmers market and are considered vendors as defined in this subdivision 4 satellite market  a farmers market that is not located in front of city hall and instead is located at a different private or public location subd 3 permit required it is unlawful for any person to operate as a vendor without obtaining a permit for the farmers market permits may be issued by the farmers market association manager or at city offices upon application by vendors on forms furnished by the city or the association on a firstcome first served basis daily permits with the exception of saturday permits shall be purchased at city offices between the hours of  am and  pm each weekday daily permits may be issued for any number or configuration of days excluding saturdays permits needed for sunday shall be purchased by friday of that week seasonal and saturday permits shall be purchased farmers market association seasonal permits shall also be available for purchase with a limit of seven permits being issued per season the city council at its discretion may enter into a management agreement with any farmers market association to manage the farmers market including satellite markets collect fees and ensure compliance with the city subd 4 indemnification before receiving a permit the vendor shall execute and deliver to the permits and license manager an indemnification agreement upon a form to be furnished by the city holding the city harmless for any personal injury or property damage resulting from the vendors activities subd 5 fee all permit applications shall be accompanied by a payment of a fee to be established by ordinance subd 6 on sunday permits shall allow vendors to park only on the south side of fourth street between bush street and plum street except for satellite markets as described below on saturdays permits shall also allow vendors to park in the west city hall parking lot fronting bush street and to use the front lawn of city hall facing bush street a valid permit under this section exempts the vendor from the twohour parking limit generally enforced on this block each vendor is entitled to only one permit per day and each permit is good for only one vehicle and one stall a maximum limit of ten permits per day will be issued for each day of the week except saturday for fourth street this limitation of ten permits for each day except saturday does not apply to satellite markets for the saturday farmers market a maximum limit of fourteen permits shall be issued for fourth street and an additional six permits may be issued specifically for the west city hall parking lot a permit shall be nontransferable between vendors and shall be nonrefundable if there is an approved management agreement with a farmers market association the farmers market association shall have the option of conducting the saturday market on fourth street between bush street and plum street and use the west city hall parking lot fronting bush street and the front lawn of city hall facing bush street a maximum of 20 vendor stalls  or the saturday market may be conducted on the north side of levee street from broad street east of the first seven parking stalls to bush street and the west side of bush street north of levee street and the east side of bush street north of levee street a maximum of 30 vendor stalls in addition if approved by the permits and license manager a farmers market association may manage satellite farmers markets at other privately and publicly owned locations subd 7 vendor regulations a tables shall be allowed on the sidewalk adjacent to the motor vehicle from which the market goods are being sold but shall not exceed the width of the parking stall space and must maintain a minimum of 40 inches clearance from all obstacles for pedestrians no tables shall be allowed in the street food items must be kept at least six inches above the ground b no music or noise shall be permitted that is audible within 30 feet of the vendors vehicle c no sales shall be permitted before sunrise or after sunset d no pets or other live animals shall be allowed in the vendor area e all vendors shall clean up around their vehicles when they have completed their sales for each day f all vendors agree to abide by the operational guidelines of the farmers market association said operational guidelines shall require review and approval by the permits and license manager subd 8 market food wagon regulations a no food shall be sold except directly from the market food wagon or market food wagon setup b all market food wagons and market food wagon setups shall be kept in good repair and order and shall have a neat appearance c there shall be no drainage of liquids allowed from the market food wagon or market food wagon setup onto public property d no permit shall be issued on any market food wagon until proof of appropriate and necessary licensure by the state of minnesota department of health or department of agriculture is provided e all vendor regulations listed in subd 7 also apply to market food wagons subd 9 signage the association shall be allowed to place a frame style swinger signs or sandwich signs on city rightofway for the purpose of directing visitors to the saturday farmers market location this is a device which is ordinarily in the shape of an a or some variation thereof located on the ground easily moveable not permanently attached thereto and which is usually two sided aframeswingersandwich signs must meet the following regulations a such signs shall be no larger than 10 square feet in sign area per side b such signs shall not be taller than 4 feet or wider than 212 feet c such signs shall only be displayed during saturday farmers market hours d such signs may be placed on private property with permission or on the public sidewalk near the saturday farmers market but must provide at least 60 inches of clearance on the sidewalk for pedestrian movement e such signs shall be placed no closer than 48 inches from the face of the public street curb f only one such sign shall be allowed per zoned lot subd 10 revocation the permits and license manager may in writing revoke any permit issued under this section or refuse to grant or renew the permit of any vendor in violation of this section of any other city or of any regulations adopted by the city tattooing and body piercing subd 1 purpose and applicability due to the inherent risk to the health and safety of persons associated with tattooing body piercing and other body art procedures the purpose and intent of this to establish rules regulations and standards for tattooing body piercing and other body art procedures performed within the city of red wing this apply to all body art establishments including tattoo parlors and establishments at which body piercing is performed body art technicians and operators of body art establishments including tattoo parlors and establishments at which body piercing is performed subd 2 definitions a for the purpose of this the following words and phrases have the meanings given to them in minnesota statutes as amended 1 body art or body art procedure  2 body art establishment  3 body piercing  4 department 5 guest artist  6 operator  7 tattooing  8 technician or body art technician  and 9 temporary body art establishment b for the purpose of this the term license means a license issued by the minnesota department of health in accordance with the procedures and standards identified in minnesota statutes as amended subd 3 body art procedures a no tattooing body piercing or other body art procedure shall be performed within the city of red wing except at a body art establishment or temporary body art establishment that is the subject of a valid establishment license or at a temporary event in accordance with a temporary event permit issued by the department of health pursuant to minnesota statutes b no tattooing shall be performed within the city of red wing except by a technician or guest artist holding a valid tattoo technician license c no body piercing or other body art procedure other than tattooing shall be performed within the city of red wing except by a technician or guest artist holding a valid body piercing technician license d no tattooing body piercing or other body art procedure shall be performed in the city of red wing in any manner which deviates from minnesota statutes as amended subd 4 unlawful conduct any person who violates this be guilty of a misdemeanor which shall be punishable by the payment of a fine not to exceed $1000 andor imprisonment for a period not to exceed 90 days subd 5 professional standards all technicians shall comply with the provisions of minnesota statutes as amended subd 6 reporting the city of red wing shall report all known violations of any health safety professional standards andor other requirement of minnesota statutes as amended to the minnesota department of health and may request that the department take appropriate remedial action including but not limited to the revocation of any license or permit issued pursuant to minnesota statutes as amended subd 7 proof of licensure all technician guest artist and establishment licenses as well as all temporary event permits issued by the department of health pursuant to minnesota statutes must be prominently displayed and available for inspection at all times while any tattooing body piercing or other body art procedure is being conducted junk dealers subd 1 definition the term junk as used in this section means and includes but is not limited to scrap of all kinds such as metal paper rags and wood subd 2 license required it is unlawful for any person to deal in junk without having a license from the city subd 3 bond requirement before receiving a junk dealers license the applicant shall execute and deliver to the permits and license manager a bond in the penal sum of $10000 with sufficient sureties approved by the council and conditioned that the applicant will in every particular conform with the requirements of any law relating to junk dealers subd 4 restriction no license shall be granted to any person for operation upon premises contrary to any zoning provision of the city other law merchants peddlers solicitors and transient subd 1 definitions except as may otherwise be provided or clearly implied by context all terms shall be given their commonly accepted definitions for the purpose of this section the following definitions shall apply 1 doortodoor advocacy  includes doortodoor canvassing and pamphleteering as a method for the dissemination of religious political and other ideas 2 peddler  a person who goes from housetohouse doortodoor businesstobusiness streettostreet or any other type of placeto place for the purpose of offering for sale displaying or exposing for sale selling or attempting to sell and delivering immediately upon sale the goods wares products merchandise or other personal property that the person is carrying or otherwise transporting the term peddler shall have the same meaning as the term hawker 3 person  any natural individual group organization corporation partnership or association as applied to groups organizations corporations partnerships and associations the term shall include each member officer partner associate agent or employee 4 regular business day  any day during which the city hall is normally open for the purpose of conducting public business holidays defined by state law shall not be counted as regular business days 5 solicitor  a person who goes from housetohouse doortodoor businesstobusiness streettostreet or any other type of placeto place for the purpose of obtaining or attempting to obtain orders for goods wares products merchandise other personal property or services of which the person may be carrying or transporting samples or that may be described in a catalog or by other means and for which delivery or performance shall occur at a later time the absence of samples or catalogs shall not remove a person from the scope of this section if the actual purpose of the persons activity is to obtain or attempt to obtain orders as discussed above the term shall have the same meaning as the term canvasser 6 transient merchant  a person who temporarily sets up business to sell or purchase out of a vehicle trailer boxcar tent hotelmotel other portable shelter or empty storefront for the purpose of exposing or displaying for sale selling or attempting to sell and delivering goods wares products merchandise or other personal property and who does not remain or intend to remain in any one location for more than 14 consecutive days subd 2 exceptions to definitions a for the purpose of the requirements of this the terms peddler solicitor and transient merchant shall not apply to any person selling or attempting to sell at wholesale any goods wares products merchandise or other personal property to a retailer of the items being sold by the wholesale the terms also shall not apply to any person who is personally known by the person being solicited or who is first contacted by the person being solicited b persons conducting the type of sales commonly known as garage sales rummage sales or estate sales as well as those persons participating in an organized multiperson bazaar flea market or festival shall be exempt from the definitions of peddlers solicitors and transient merchants as shall any person conducting an auction as a properly licensed auctioneer or any officer of the court conducting a courtordered sale exemption from the definitions for the scope of this not excuse any person from complying with any other applicable statutory provision or local ordinance c nothing in this section prohibits or restricts doortodoor advocacy persons engaging in doortodoor advocacy are not required to register as solicitors under subdivision 6 of this  licensing  exemptions a county license required no person shall conduct business as a peddler solicitor or transient merchant within the city limits without first obtaining the appropriate license from the county as required by minnesota statutes as it may be amended from time to time if the county issues a license for the activity b city license required except as otherwise provided for by this section no person shall conduct business as either a peddler or a transient merchant without first obtaining a license from the city this license is nontransferable solicitors need not be licensed but are required to register under subdivision 6 of this application application for a city license to conduct business as a peddler or transient merchant shall be made at least 14 regular business days before the applicant wishes to begin conducting business application for a license shall be made on a form approved by the city council and available from the office of the permits and license manager all applications shall be signed by the applicant and shall include the following information 1 applicants full legal name and date of birth  2 all other names under which the applicant conducts business or to which the applicant officially answers  3 a physical description of the applicant hair color eye color height weight and distinguishing marks and features  4 full address and telephone number of applicants permanent residence  5 full legal name of any and all business operations owned managed or operated by applicant or for which the applicant is an employee or agent  6 full address and telephone number of applicants regular place of business if any  7 the type of business for which the applicant is applying for a license and a general description of the items to be sold or services to be provided  8 whether the applicant is applying for an annual or daily license  9 the dates during which the applicant intends to conduct business and if the applicant is applying for a daily license the number of days the applicant will be conducting business in the city maximum 14 consecutive days  10 any and all addresses and telephone numbers where the applicant can be reached while conducting business within the city including the location where a transient merchant intends to set up business  11 written permission of the property owner or the property owners agent for any property to be used by a transient merchant  12 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted within the last five years of any felony gross misdemeanor or misdemeanor for violation of any state or federal statute or any local ordinance other than traffic offenses  13 a list of the three most recent locations where the applicant has conducted business as a peddler or transient merchant  14 proof of any required county license  15 a general description of the items to be sold or services to be provided  16 the applicants drivers license number or other acceptable form of identification  17 the license plate number registration information and vehicle identification number for any vehicle to be used in conjunction with the licensed business and a description of the vehicle  18 all additional information deemed necessary by the city council d fee all applications for a license under this be accompanied by the fee established by ordinance e procedure upon receipt of the completed application and payment of the license fee the permits and license manager within two regular business days shall determine if the application is complete an application is determined to be complete only if all required information is provided if the permits and license manager determines that the application is incomplete the permits and license manager shall inform the applicant what required information is missing if the application is complete the permits and license manager shall order any investigation including background checks necessary to verify the information provided with the application within 10 regular business days of receiving a complete application the permits and license manager shall issue the license unless there are grounds for denying the license under subdivision 4 of this in which case the permits and license manager must deny the license if the permits and license manager denies the license the applicant must be notified in writing of the decision the reason for denial and of the applicants right to appeal the denial by requesting within 20 days of receiving notice of rejection a public hearing before the city council the city council shall hear the appeal within 20 days of the date of the request the decision of the city council following the public hearing can be appealed by petitioning the minnesota court of appeals for a writ of certiorari f duration an annual license granted under this be valid for one calendar year from the date of issue all other licenses granted under this be valid only during the time period indicated on the license g license exemptions 1 no license shall be required of any person going from houseto house doortodoor businesstobusiness streettostreet or other type of placetoplace when the activity is for the purpose of exercising that persons state or federal constitutional rights such as the freedom of speech press and religion except that this exemption may be lost if the persons exercise of constitutional rights is merely incidental to a commercial activity 2 professional fundraisers working on behalf of an otherwise exempt person or group shall not be exempt from the licensing requirements of this no license shall be required of any person or group that is a tax exempt transient merchant when it operates in an area of the city zoned as central business district b3 for one period up to three days in length per calendar year registration is still required pursuant to subdivision 6 of this any person claiming to be exempt from the licensing or registration requirements of this section shall when requested present to the permits and license manager proof of qualification for such exemption subd 4 license ineligibility the following shall be grounds for denying a license under this a the failure of the applicant to obtain and show proof of having obtained any required county license b the failure of the applicant to truthfully provide any of the information requested by the city as a part of the application or the failure to sign the application or the failure to pay the required fee at the time of application c the conviction of the applicant within the past five years from the date of application for any violation of any federal or state statute or regulation or of any local ordinance which adversely reflects on the persons ability to conduct the business for which the license is being sought in an honest and legal manner those violations shall include but not be limited to burglary theft larceny swindling fraud unlawful business practices and any form of actual or threatened physical harm against another person d the revocation within the past five years of any license issued to the applicant for the purpose of conducting business as a peddler solicitor or transient merchant subd 5 suspension and revocation a generally any license or certificate of registration issued under this section may be suspended or revoked at the discretion of the city council for violation of any of the following 1 fraud misrepresentation or incorrect statements on the application form 2 fraud misrepresentation or false statements made during the course of the licensed activity 3 failure to exhibit the license or certificate of registration when requested to do so by any prospective customer or city employee 4 conviction of any offense for which granting of a license could have been denied under subdivision 4 of this violation of any provision of this section b multiple persons under one license the suspension or revocation of any license issued for the purpose of authorizing multiple persons to conduct business as peddlers or transient merchants on behalf of the licensee shall serve as a suspension or revocation of each authorized persons authority to conduct business as a peddler or transient merchant on behalf of the licensee whose license is suspended or revoked c notice prior to revoking or suspending any license issued under this the city shall provide the license holder with written notice of the alleged violations and inform the licensee of the right to a hearing on the alleged violation notice shall be delivered in person or by mail to the permanent residential address listed on the license application or if no residential address is listed to the business address provided on the license application d public hearing upon receiving the notice provided in section c of this subdivision the licensee shall have the right to request a public hearing if no request for a hearing is received by the permits and license manager within 10 regular business days following the service of the notice the city may proceed with the suspension or revocation for the purpose of mailed notices service shall be considered complete as of the date the notice is placed in the mail if a public hearing is requested within the stated timeframe a hearing shall be scheduled within 20 days from the date of the request within three regular business days of the hearing the city council shall notify the licensee of its decision e emergency if in the discretion of the city council imminent harm to the health or safety of the public may occur because of the actions of a peddler or transient merchant licensed under this the city council may immediately suspend the persons license and provide notice of the right to hold a subsequent public hearing as prescribed in subparagraph d of this subdivision f appeals any person whose license is suspended or revoked under this section shall have the right to appeal that decision in court subd 6 registration all solicitors and any person exempt from the licensing requirements under subdivision 3 of this shall be required to register with the city persons engaging in doortodoor advocacy shall not be required to register registration shall be made on the same form required for a license application but no fee shall be required immediately upon completion of the registration form the permits and license manager shall issue to the registrant a certificate of registration as proof of the registration certificates of registration are nontransferable subd 7 prohibited activities no peddler solicitor or transient merchant shall conduct business or otherwise behave in any of the following manners a calling attention to the business or items to be sold by means of blowing any horn or whistle ringing any bell crying out or by any other noise so as to be unreasonably audible within an enclosed structure b obstructing the free flow of either vehicular or pedestrian traffic on any street alley sidewalk or other public rightofway c conducting business in a way as to create a threat to the health safety and welfare of any individual or the general public d conducting business before  am or after  pm e failing to provide proof of identification and license or certificate of registration when requested  or using the license or certificate of registration of another person f making any false or misleading statements about the product or service being sold including untrue statements of endorsement no peddler or transient merchant shall claim to have the endorsement of the city solely based on the city having issued a license to that person g remaining on the property of another when requested to leave or to otherwise conduct business in a manner a reasonable person would find obscene threatening intimidating or abusive subd 8 exclusion by placard no peddler solicitor or transient merchant unless invited to do so by the property owner or tenant shall enter the property of another for the purpose of conducting business as a peddler solicitor or transient merchant when the property is marked with a sign or placard with print of at least 48 point in size stating no peddlers no solicitors no transient merchants peddlers and solicitors prohibited or other comparable statement no person other than the property owner or tenant shall remove deface or otherwise tamper with any sign or placard under this section subd 9 penalties a a separate offense shall be deemed committed upon each day during which a violation occurs or continues charitable gambling subd 1 purpose the purpose of this section is to regulate and control the conduct of lawful gambling gambling and to ensure that profits derived therefrom in the city of red wing provide direct benefits to the citys citizens subd 2 statutes incorporated the provisions of minnesota statutes relating to gambling and providing penalties for violations thereof are hereby adopted and made a part of this section the provisions of this additional restrictions placed on gambling by the city subd 3 definitions the terms defined in minnesota statutes have the meanings assigned therein unless the text of this section expressly provides otherwise in addition the following terms shall have the following meanings 1 resident manager or agent  at the time of application to the city the applicant shall appoint in writing a natural person as its gambling manager or agent the manager or agent shall consent in writing to 1 take full responsibility for the conduct of the licensed premises  and 2 serve as agent for service of notices and other process relating to the permit or license the manager or agent must be a person who by reason of age character reputation and other attributes could qualify as a gambling manager the manager or agent however need not be or trained to be the organizations gambling manager as that term is defined in state statute if the manager or agent ceases to act in that capacity for the licensee without appointment of a successor the permit or license issued pursuant to the appointment shall be subject to revocation or suspension 2 trade area  the citys trade area includes all of goodhue county in minnesota and trenton and isabelle townships of pierce county wisconsin subd 4 gambling prohibited  exemption a no person except an organization which is licensed by or has a valid exemption permit from the state or has a permit from the city shall conduct lawful gambling within the city a city permit shall be obtained each time an exemption permit is sought from the gambling control board board all permits required by this section or state statutes shall be prominently displayed during the permit year at the premises licensed to conduct gambling b all gambling activities exempt from licensure by statute shall require a city permit for the conduct of exempt gambling subd 5 inspections filing of records and reports  access to records and a every organization permitted to conduct lawful gambling in the city shall file with the permits and license manager copies of all records and reports required to be filed with the board the records and reports shall be due to the city at the same time they are due to the board b every organization shall file an additional report with the city proving compliance with the trade area spending restrictions imposed by this section the report shall be on a form prescribed by the permits and license manager and shall be submitted annually and in advance of application for renewal c all licensed or permitted gambling operations are deemed to have consented to inspection of the licensed or permitted premises by the city d authorized employees or agents of the city may inspect at any reasonable time without notice or search warrant all records including gambling accounts and other bank records required by the board to be maintained and preserved subd 6 application a an organization shall make application for a premises permit on a form prescribed by the board the applicant shall provide a complete copy of the state application to the city b an organization holding a premises permit must notify the permits and license manager in writing within ten days of any material change in the information contained in the application c the council shall act on the application within 60 days from the date complete materials are submitted but shall not approve an application to the board for a new premises permit until at least 30 days after the date of the application subd 7 general conditions a the city council may require a copy of the financial audit or financial review required by the state of any organization that conducts lawful gambling in the city at the organizations expense the audit shall include information on all gross receipts profits and expenses incurred by the organization in the conduct of gambling as well as information on uses of profits and trade area limitations the audit report shall be submitted to the city council upon timely completion or at the application for renewal but no later than 180 days after the end of the gambling license year b gambling manager required each licensed organization must designate a gambling manager the gambling manager designated by an organization shall be responsible for the lawful conduct of all gambling in compliance with all laws and state rules an organization may not conduct gambling without a gambling manager any organization changing gambling managers or adding or removing gambling managers must notify the city in writing within ten days of the change c hours of operation unless specifically permitted by the city council no gambling shall be conducted between the hours of  am and  am monday  am and  am daily tuesday 00 am and  am sunday subd 8 conditions for allowing premises to be used for gambling a no organization or person shall directly or indirectly conduct allow or permit gambling without a license issued by the board or an exemption from the board and license from the city b no person organization or business entity shall suffer or permit any gaming table or gambling equipment to be used for the purpose of gambling in any house lot yard or garden owned occupied or controlled by that person organization or business entity except for those organizations licensed by the board and issued permits pursuant to this unless the person organization or business entity is a lessor of premises leased to an organization issued the license or permit for gambling subd 9 leased premises  general restrictions on use a leaseownership required an organization may conduct licensed gambling only on premises it owns or leases leases must be for a period of at least one year and must be on a form prescribed by the board copies of all leases must accompany an application to the city a lease may be a conditional lease based on granting of the permit no lease agreement payments may exceed limitations established by the board as set forth in minnesota statutes subd 1 as it may be amended from time to time no person distributor manufacturer lessor or organization other than the licensed organization leasing or owning the space may conduct any gambling activity on the leasedowned premises while gambling is being conducted on the premises b no lessor shall permit more than one organization to conduct gambling at the leased premises at the same time c no person organization or business licensed to conduct gambling at a leased location shall sell or solicit beyond the limits of leased space as indicated on the lease agreement subd 10 establishments applying for or holding liquor licenses no licensed liquor establishment shall keep possess operate or permit the keeping possession or operation of any video games of chance or gambling device including slot machines roulette wheels punch boards and pinball machines which return coins or slugs chips or tokens of any kind which are redeemable for merchandise cash or other item of value on the licensed premises in addition no dice or playing card gambling is allowed in any licensed establishment only gambling licensed by the board and conducted pursuant to state statute and this permitted on licensed establishments personal gambling for nominal consideration is allowed in a licensed establishment when allowed by state statute subd 11 investigations  permit fees and local contributions a all organizations exempt from state licensing requirements which are applying for a permit to conduct gambling in the city shall pay a permit fee to the city established by ordinance b any organization applying for or renewing a premises permit or bingo hall license must pay an investigation fee at the time of application established by ordinance c all permit applications must be referred to the police department and to other departments as necessary for verification and investigation of the facts set forth in the application the investigation shall include but not be limited to a criminal history background check a written report of the findings along with a recommendation of the police department regarding the license application shall be forwarded to the council with the application d designated trade area any organization licensed to conduct gambling within the city shall expend at least 50 percent of its expenditures on lawful purposes conducted or located within the trade area a licensed organization may request relief from this provision the city council may in its sole discretion grant such relief when the circumstances warrant subd 12 granting of premises permits and bingo hall licenses a the city may deny an application to the board for a premises permit or bingo hall license if 1 the liquor licensee owner or manager of the site has been convicted of a violation of any gambling or liquor license laws  2 the citys investigation indicates that the organization or gambling manager failed to comply with the terms or conditions of any other license or indicates a history of noncompliance with state or local law regulating the conduct of gambling  3 noncompliance with any applicable zoning building fire and health codes of the city or other regulations in this section  or 4 noncompliance with requirements of this section or other stated factors including but not limited to the health safety and welfare of the city b an application made to the board for a premises permit or bingo hall license to conduct lawful gambling in the city may be denied by resolution of the city council if notification of such resolution is made to the board within 60 days of the receipt of the complete application by the permits and license manager subd 13 violations violations of this result in penalties imposed by or civil sanctions imposed by the city council pawnbrokers subd 1 purpose the city council finds that use of services provided by pawnbrokers offers an opportunity for the commission of crimes and their concealment because pawn businesses have the ability to receive and transfer property stolen by others easily and quickly the city council also finds that consumer protection regulation is warranted in transactions involving pawnbrokers the purpose of this section is to prevent pawn businesses from being used as facilities for the commission of crimes and to assure that these businesses comply with basic consumer protection standards thereby protecting the public health safety and general welfare of the citizens of the city to help the red wing police better regulate pawn businesses decrease and stabilize costs associated with the regulation of the pawn industry and increase identification of criminal activities in the pawn industry timely collection and sharing of pawn transaction information this section also implements and establishes the required use of an automated pawn system of the city of red wings choosing subd 2 shall mean definitions when used in this section the following words 1 pawnbroker  any natural person partnership or corporation either as principal agent or employee who loans money on deposit or pledge of personal property or other valuable thing  or who deals in the purchasing of personal property or other valuable thing on condition of selling it back again at a stipulated price within a fixed period of time  or who loans money secured by chattel mortgage on personal property taking possession of the property or any part thereof so mortgaged to the extent that a pawnbrokers business also includes buying personal property previously used rented or leased or selling it on consignment the provisions of this apply the following are expressly exempt from the definition of pawnbroker any bank regulated by the state of minnesota the comptroller of the currency of the united states the federal deposit insurance corporation fdic the board of governors of the federal reserve system or any other federal or state authority and their affiliates  any bank or savings association whose deposits or accounts are eligible for insurance by the fdic or any successor to it and all affiliates of those banks and savings associations  any state or federally chartered credit union  any industrial loan and thrift company or regulated lender subject to licensing and regulation by the department of commerce  and antique and second hand goods dealers so long as they do not engage in the activities of a pawnbroker as defined herein 2 reportable transaction  every transaction conducted by a pawnbroker in which merchandise is received pawn purchase consignment or trade or in which a pawn is renewed extended or redeemed is reportable except a the bulk purchase or consignment of new or used merchandise from a merchant manufacturer or wholesaler having an established permanent place of business and the retail sale of that merchandise provided the pawnbroker must maintain a record of the purchase or consignment which describes each item and must mark each item in a manner which relates it to that transaction record b retail and wholesale sales of merchandise originally received by pawn or purchase and for which all applicable hold andor redemption periods have expired 3 billable transaction  every reportable transaction conducted by a pawnbroker is a billable transaction except renewals redemptions or extensions of existing pawns on items previously reported and continuously in the licensees possession subd 3 license required no person shall engage in the business of pawnbrokering at any location without a pawnbroker license for that location any pawn transaction made without the benefit of a license is void a separate license is required for each place of business no pawnbroker license may be transferred to a different location or a different person issuance of a license under this not relieve the licensee from obtaining any other licenses required to conduct business at the same or any other locations subd 4 new ownership any change directly or beneficially in the ownership of any licensed pawnshop shall require an application for a new license the new owner must satisfy all current eligibility requirements subd 5 license fees a the annual license fees for licenses issued under this be established by ordinance within the following parameters the billable transaction license fee shall reflect the cost of processing transactions electronically and manually and other related regulatory expenses as determined by the city council and shall be reviewed and adjusted if necessary annually licensees shall be notified in writing 30 days before any adjustment is implemented b billable transaction fees shall be billed monthly and are due and payable within 30 days failure to pay fees by the due date is a violation of this  investigation fee an applicant for a new license or for the renewal of an existing license that is more than six months past due shall deposit an investigation fee with the permits and license manager at the time an application is submitted the fee shall cover the costs involved in verifying and investigating the license application needed to assure compliance with this deposit and the actual investigation fee guidelines shall be established by ordinance subd 7 term of license a expiration all licenses shall expire on december 31 each license shall remain in full force and effect until surrendered suspended revoked or expired a license may be suspended or revoked for failure to comply with this section b no effect on existing contract the expiration revocation suspension or surrender of any license under this section however shall not impair or affect any preexisting lawful obligation between the licensee and any pledgor c notification the permits and license manager shall notify the police chief of any licensee whose license has expired or been surrendered suspended or revoked as provided by this section subd 8 application required a contents an application form provided by the permits and license manager must be completed by every applicant for a new pawnbroker license or for renewal of an existing license every new applicant must provide all the following information 1 if the applicant is a natural person a name place and date of birth street resident address and phone number b whether the applicant has ever used or has been known by a name other than the applicants name and if so the name or names used and information concerning dates and places used c the name of the business if it is to be conducted under a designation name or style other than the name of the applicant and a certified copy of the certificate as required by minnesota statutes d any street address at which the applicant has lived during the preceding five years e the type name and location of every business or occupation in which the applicant has been engaged during the preceding five years and the names and addresses of the applicants employers and business partners if any for the preceding five years f whether the applicant has ever been convicted of a felony misdemeanor or violation of any ordinance other than a traffic ordinance if so the applicant must furnish information as to the time place and offense of all such convictions g a physical description of the applicant h applicants current personal financial statement and true copies of the applicants federal and state tax returns for the two years prior to application i if the applicant does not manage the business the name of the managers or other persons in charge of the business and all information concerning each of them required in a h of subdivision 8a1 of this if the applicant is a partnership a the names and addresses of all general and limited partners and all information concerning each general partner required in subdivision 8a1 of this b the names of the managing partners and the interest of each partner in the licensed pawnbroker business c a true copy of the partnership agreement shall be submitted with the application if the partnership is required to file a certificate as to a trade name pursuant to minnesota statutes a certified copy of such certificate must be attached to the application d a true copy of the federal and state tax returns for partnership for the two years prior to application e if the applicant does not manage the business the name of the managers or other persons in charge of the business and all information concerning each of them required in a h of subdivision 8a1 of this section 3 if the applicant is a corporation or other organization a the name of the corporation or business form and if incorporated the state of incorporation b a true copy of the certificate of incorporation articles of incorporation or association agreement and bylaws shall be attached to the application if the applicant is a foreign corporation a certificate of authority as required by minnesota statutes must be attached c the name of the managers or other persons in charge of the business and all information concerning each manager proprietor or agent required in a h of subdivision 8a1 of this d a list of all persons who control or own an interest in excess of five percent in the organization or business form or who are officers of the corporation or business form and all information concerning these persons required in subdivision 8a1 of this subdivision however shall not apply to a corporation whose stock is publicly traded on a stock exchange and is applying for a license to be owned and operated by it 4 for all applicants a whether the applicant holds a current pawnbroker precious metal dealer or secondhand goods dealer license from any other governmental unit b whether the applicant has previously been denied or had revoked or suspended a pawnbroker precious metal dealer or secondhand dealer license from any other governmental unit c the location of the business premises d if the applicant does not own the business premises a true and complete copy of the executed lease e the legal description of the premises to be licensed f whether all real estate and personal property taxes that are due and payable for the premises to be licensed have been paid and if not paid the years and amounts that are unpaid g whenever the application is for premises either planned under construction or undergoing substantial alteration the application must be accompanied by a set of preliminary plans showing the design of the proposed premises to be licensed h the applicants social security number and minnesota business identification number i such other information as the city council may require of which the applicant is notified 5 new manager when a licensee places a manager in charge of a business or if the named managers in charge of a licensed business changes the licensee must complete and submit the appropriate application on forms provided by the permits and license manager within 14 days of the new managers start date the application must include all appropriate information required in this subdivision upon completion of an investigation of a new manager the licensee must pay an amount equal to the cost of the investigation as established ordinance to assure compliance with this application execution all applications for a license under this section must be signed and sworn under oath or affirmation by the applicant if the application is that of a natural person it must be signed and sworn by such person  if that of a corporation by an officer thereof  if that of a partnership by one of the general partners  and if that of an unincorporated association by the manager or managing officer thereof c investigation the employee designated by the police chief must investigate the truthfulness of the statements set forth in the application the applicant must furnish to the employee designated by the police chief evidence that the investigator reasonably requires to investigate the truth of the statements set forth in the application d persons ineligible for a license no licenses under this be issued to a natural person who or to a partnership with a general partner or managing partner who or to a corporation or other organization with a manager proprietor or agent in charge who 1 is under the age of 21 at the time that the application is filed  2 has been convicted of any crime directly related to the pawnbroker business as prescribed by minnesota statutes as it may be amended from time to time and has not shown competent evidence of sufficient rehabilitation and present fitness to perform the duties of a licensee under this prescribed by minnesota statutes  or 3 is not of good moral character or repute as determined by the council subd 9 bond required before a license will be issued every applicant must submit a $5000 bond with completed forms provided by the permits and license manager all bonds must be issued on the condition that the principal will observe and conduct business in conformance with all laws relating to pawnbrokers and that the principal will account for and deliver to any person legally entitled any goods which have come into the principals hand principals business as a pawnbroker or in lieu thereof will pay the reasonable value in money to the person the bond shall contain a provision that no bond may be canceled except upon 30 days written notice to the city which shall be served upon the permits and license manager the bond may be used to reimburse losses as a result of violations of this ordinance in the event losses exceed the amount of the bond those who suffered losses will be reimbursed based on a prorated share of losses reported within 14 days of the discovery of the alleged violations and on a first come first served basis after that time in the event losses are less than the amount of the bond the city may use the bond to defer costs directly incurred in enforcing this ordinance against the licensee as a result of the violations subd 10 records required at the time of any reportable transaction other than renewals extensions or redemptions every licensee must immediately record the following information in a computerized record approved by the red wing police a a complete and accurate description of each item including but not limited to any trademark identification number serial number model number brand name or other identifying mark on such an item b the purchase price amount of money loaned upon or pledged therefor c the maturity date of the transaction and the amount due including monthly and annual interest rates and all pawn fees and charges d date time and place the item of property was received by the licensee and the unique alpha andor numeric transaction identifier that distinguishes it from all other transactions in the licensees records e full name residence address residence telephone number date of birth and accurate description of the person from whom the item was received including sex height weight race color of eyes and color of hair f the identification number and state of issue from any of the following forms of identification of the seller 1 current valid minnesota drivers license 2 current valid minnesota identification card 3 current valid photo identification card issued by another state or province of canada g the signature of the person identified in the transaction h the licensee must also take a color photograph or color video recording of 1 each customer involved in a billable transaction 2 every item pawned or sold that does not have a unique serial or identification number permanently engraved or affixed if a photograph is taken it must be at least two inches in length by two inches in width and must be maintained in such a manner that the photograph can be readily matched and correlated with all other records of the transaction to which they relate such photographs must be available to the police chief or designee upon request the major portion of the photograph must include an identifiable front facial closeup of the person who pawned or sold the item items photographed must be accurately depicted the licensee must inform the person that he or she is being photographed by displaying a sign of readily legible size in a conspicuous place on the premises if a video photograph is taken the video camera must zoom in on the person pawning or selling the item so as to include an identifiable closeup of that persons face items photographed by video must be accurately depicted video photographs must be electronically referenced by time and date so they can be readily matched and correlated with all other records of the transaction to which they relate the licensee must inform the person that he or she is being videotaped by displaying a sign of sufficient size in a conspicuous place on the premises the licensee must keep the exposed videotape for three months i digitized photographs licensees may fulfill the color photograph requirements in subdivision 1oh of this submitting them as digital images in a format specified by the issuing authority electronically crossreferenced to the reportable transaction with which they are associated notwithstanding the digital images may be captured from required video recordings this provision does not alter or amend the requirements in subdivision 1oh of this renewals extensions and redemptions for renewals extensions and redemptions the licensee shall provide the original transaction identifier the date of the current transaction and the type of transaction k inspection of records the records must at all reasonable times be open to inspection by the red wing police data entries shall be retained for at least three years from the date of transaction entries of required digital images shall be retained a minimum of 90 days subd 11 permitted charges a maximum fee a pawnbrokers fee may not exceed the maximum fee as established by minnesota statutes b date due the pawnshop fee shall be deemed earned and due as of the date of the pawn transaction and a like sum shall be deemed earned and due on the same day of the succeeding month if full payment is made more than two weeks before the next succeeding date however the pawnbroker shall remit onehalf of the pawnshop fee for that month to the pledgor c interest interest shall not be deducted in advance any loan shall not be divided or split so as to yield greater interest or fees than would be permitted on a single consolidated loan any interest charge or fee received in excess of the amount permitted under this section shall be uncollectible and the pawn transaction shall be void d posted schedule of charges a schedule of charges in accordance with this section shall be posted on the pawnshop premises in a place clearly visible to the public e insurance charge prohibited a pawnbroker shall not sell or charge for insurance in connection with a pawn transaction subd 12 daily reports to police a method licensees must provide to the red wing police the information required in subdivisions 1oa of this by the business day following the date of the transaction the licensee must display a sign of readily legible size and in a conspicuous place on the premises so as to inform all patrons that all transactions are reported to the red wing police daily licensees must submit every reportable transaction to the red wing police daily in the following manner licensees must provide to the red wing police the information required in subdivisions 1oa of this by transferring it from their computers to the red wing police via modem or other approved electronic means all required records must be transmitted completely and accurately after the close of business each day in accordance with standards and procedures established by the city using a dialcallback protocol or other procedures that address security concerns of the licensees and the issuing authority b billable transaction fees licensees will be charged for billable transactions in accordance with the established fee structure except 1 if a licensee is temporarily unable to successfully transfer the required reports by modem the licensee must provide the red wing police printed copies of all reportable transactions for that date by  noon the next business day 2 if the problem is determined to be in the licensees system and is not corrected by the close of the first business day following the failure the licensee must provide the required reports as detailed in subdivision 12a of this section and must be charged at the regular rate for transactions close of the first business day following the failure and at the regular rate plus a 10 percent surcharge for all subsequent billable transactions until the error is corrected  or 3 if the problem is determined to be outside the licensees system the licensee must provide the required reports in detail in subdivision 12a of this section and will be billed at the regular rate for billable transactions until the error is corrected 4 if a licensee who has consistently reported via modem is unable to capture digitize or transmit the photographs required in subdivisions 1oh and 101 of this the licensee must immediately take all required photographs immediately develop the photographs cross reference the photographs to the correct transaction and deliver them to the red wing police by  noon the next business day billable transactions will be charged at the regular rate for transactions close of the first business day following the failure and at the surcharged rate for all subsequent billable transactions until the error is corrected 5 subdivisions 1281 of this the red wing police may upon presentation of extenuating circumstances extend the period that a qualifying licensee is billed at the regular rate for billable transactions subd 13 receipt required every licensee must provide a receipt to the party identified in every reportable transaction signed by that party and must maintain a duplicate of that receipt for three years the receipt must include at least the following information a the name address and telephone number of the licensed business b the date and time the item was received by the licensee c whether the item was pawned or sold or the nature of the transaction d an accurate description of each item received including but not limited to any trademark identification number serial number model number brand name or other identifying mark on such an item e the signature or unique identifier of the licensee or employee who conducted the transaction f the amount advanced or paid g the monthly and annual interest rates including all pawn fees and charges h the last regular day of business by which the item must be redeemed by the pledgor without risk that the item will be sold and the amount necessary to redeem the pawned item on that date i the full name residence address residence telephone number and date of birth of the pledgor or seller j the identification number and state of issue from any of the following forms of identification of the seller 1 current valid minnesota drivers license  2 current valid minnesota identification card  or 3 current valid photo drivers license or identification card issued by another state or a province of canada k description of the pledgor or seller including approximate sex height weight race color of eyes and color of hair l the following printed statements as required by minnesota statutes as it may be amended from time to time 1 any personal property pledged to a pawnbroker within this state is subject to sale or disposal when there has been no payment made on the account for a period of not less than 60 days past the date of the pawn transaction renewal or extension  no further notice is necessary there is no obligation for the pledgor to redeem pledged goods 2 the pledgor of this item attests that it is not stolen it has no liens or encumbrances against it and the pledgor has the right to sell or pawn the item 3 this item is redeemable only by the pledgor to whom the receipt was issued or any person identified in a written and notarized authorization to redeem the property identified in the receipt or a person identified in writing by the pledgor at the time of the initial transaction and signed by the pledgor written authorization for release of property to persons other than the original pledgor must be maintained along with the original transaction record m the signature of the pledgor or seller subd 14 motor vehicle pawn transactions a pawnbroker who holds title to a motor vehicle as part of a pawn transaction shall a be licensed as a used motor vehicle dealer under minnesota statutes b verify that there are no liens or encumbrances against the motor vehicle with the minnesota department of public safety  and c verify that the pledgor has automobile insurance on the vehicle as required by law pawnbrokers shall not sell a motor vehicle covered by a pawn transaction until 90 days after recovery of the motor vehicle subd 15 redemption period a any person pledging pawning or depositing an item for security must have a minimum of 60 days from the date of that transaction to redeem the item before it may be forfeited and sold b during the 60 day holding period items may not be removed from the licensed location except for storage as provided in subdivision 24 of this under the following circumstances 1 licensees are permitted to return pledged goods to the pledgor at any time during the redemption period 2 licensees are permitted to sell the pledged goods or remove the pledged goods from the licensed premises or other storage at any time after the expiration of the redemption period set forth in this subdivision  and 3 licensees who purchase goods not involving a pawn transaction are permitted to sell or remove the purchased goods from the licensed premises or other storage 31 days or later from the purchase transaction date c licensees must return pledged goods to a pledgor or seller or provide compensation for lost or damaged goods upon payment of the full amount due the licensee unless either 1 the date of redemption is more than 60 days past the date of the pawn transaction renewal or extension and the pawnbroker has sold the pledged goods pursuant to subdivision 17 of this   or 2 the pledged goods have been taken into custody by a court or a law enforcement officer or agency d licensees are prohibited from redeeming any item to anyone other than the person to whom the receipt was issued or to any person identified in a written and notarized authorization to redeem the property identified in the receipt or to a person identified in writing by the pledgor or with approval of the police department written authorization for release of property to persons other than original pledgor must be maintained along with original transaction record in accordance with subdivision of 1oj of this  risk of loss in the event the goods are lost or damaged while in possession of the pawnbroker the pawnbroker shall compensate the pledgor for the fair market value of the lost or damaged goods subd 17 effect of nonredemption the pledgor shall have no obligation to redeem pledged goods or make any payment on a pawn transaction pledged goods not redeemed within at least 60 days of the date of the pawn transaction renewal or extension shall automatically be forfeited to the pawnbroker qualified right title and interest in forfeited goods shall automatically vest in the pawnbroker subd 18 holding period any item purchased by a licensee must not be sold or otherwise transferred for 31 days from the date of the transaction subd 19 police order to hold property a investigative hold whenever a law enforcement official from any agency notifies a licensee not to sell an item the item must not be sold or removed from the premises the investigative hold shall be confirmed in writing by the originating agency within 72 hours and will remain in effect for 15 days from the date of initial notification or until the investigative order is cancelled or until an order to holdconfiscate is issued pursuant to subdivision 198 of this whichever comes first b order to hold whenever the police chief or designee notifies a licensee not to sell an item the item must not be sold or removed from the licensed premises until authorized in writing by the police chief or designee the hold order shall be confirmed in writing within 72 hours the order to hold shall expire 90 days from the date it is placed unless the police chief or designee determines the hold is still necessary and notifies the licensee in writing c order to confiscate if an item is identified as stolen or evidence in a criminal case the police chief or designee may 1 physically confiscate and remove it from the shop pursuant to a written order from the police chief or designee or 2 place
